Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Grilled Lemon-Marjoram Chicken Salad&#34; @ Vintner Grill - 8/15/13
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Classic Cobb W/Grilled Beef Tenderloin Salad&#34; @ Vintner Grill - 8/15/13

ush9fQ5w9b2fXCAJmgqNeg.text: Service was excellent.  We started with an assortment of cheeses, calamari and grilled octopus.  They were all amazing.  I drink a lot of Arnold palmers and they happily brought me plenty of refills.  Several of us had two different salmon dishes which were wonderful.  My favorite was the scallops over pea risotto.  The servers did a great job of pre-bussing which was impressive.  No one likes sitting there looking at their dirty dishes after the meal is concluded.  My buddy and I shared the chocolate tart which was decadent. My father in law left his credit card at the table.  The general manager called me the next day to inform me the card had been left there and he would keep it in his safe.  They had our number from the reservation.  I was very impressed the manager would do that.  I will absolutely be back many more times.

oz-nBRMpTWFjKdeYlUMMbg.text: Awesome place to visit & totally unexpected. Restaurant is surrounded by  office buildings in summerlin. Service is good with warm and friendly staff.  Food is good as well--butternut squash soup, butter lettuce salad, crab cakes, beef medallion, seabass, free range chicken, & apple turnover. Delish! Will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef medallion
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor area

XDbNjp3jRndpehsZvdQV-w.text: Not impressed. Overpriced with a snooty atmosphere. I have been there a few times for cocktails with business associates and have withheld any judgement until this review. I gave it three stars for the food only.  The gal at the podium was a snob. The waitress took forever to take our drink order and even then the bottle of wine took an additional 15 minutes to arrive.  Love the food and I just have issues with the service.

UvppsWMnxk-7lBfyn8XMow.text: We celebrated my birthday dinner at vitner grill last night. It was not only outstanding food but service too. Starting with the sweet helpful hostess who seated us to the one and only waiter called Jeff. He suggested appetizers, entrees and desserts that were outstanding. Octopus,  lamb boulabaise,  veal, steak and an amazing wine that completed our meal. His service was above and beyond and we left feeling that we all made a new friend. Thank you for a truly amazing dining experience. We will return and request Jeff.

1bnjJWvcrNt7dEDgmFuYWA.text: My wife and I were looking for a quiet, well decorated restaurant with a good wine list and good food. We were not disappointed in Vintner Grill last night. The greeting from the hostess was warm and friendly and we were seated right away. The white modernistic decor was very soothing, the music was appropriate and at a comfortable volume, the Woody Allen movie scenes playing on the few televisions was fun, and our waitress (I'm so sorry I've forgotten her name. Young lady, slightly pregnant.) was very prompt, knowledgeable and courteous.  With over 400 wines on the list, we chose the Bouchard Pere & Fils "Beaune du Chateau" 1er Cru Burgundian Pinot Noir. Great choice to be able to pair with most menu items. Light notes of cherry and strawberry, light spice, medium body, light hints of oak. Very much a standard example of old world pinot noir. Tasty.  A large selection of fun breads to choose from was presented by the very cordial bus staff and the butter presentation was really fun also.  We started with V.G.'s version of Calamari. Fried lemon wheels and fried haricot vert accompanied the well cooked and seasoned delicacy. The sauce however, was the star of the show. Cilantro, salt, pepper, and a light curry was a welcome change from the standard marinara that usually accompanies this dish. Well done Chef.  My wife ordered the Salmon Tajine. The sauce was flavorful, and the vegetables were well done. The salmon seemed to lack the "sear" that we normally enjoy but overall a good dish. It was a little cumbersome to eat though.  I ordered the braised lamb bolognese. Incredibly flavorful braised lamb over slightly over cooked pasta in a VERY rich bolognese.  The most fun part of the dish was the cold Mascarpone cheese topping the dish that was an incredibly exciting juxtaposition to the hot, thick bolognese. Again, well done Chef. I was halfway through the dish when I found myself overwhelmed by the richness. Very good, but quickly filling and rich.  The only reason that I can't give 5 stars on this visit is that our entrees arrived before our appetizer was cleared and there was no attempt to crumb the table. But I must reiterate that we had a wonderful time with our server and she was outgoing, hospitable, knowledgeable and helped us have a great time. Thank you Vintner Grill, we needed that.

uTzi0gqAvLIsJfLSMg3eGw.text: They have great food and a nice wine selection. It is hidden in an office complex. I did not know the place was there until I lived here for five years. Odd location.

rL-5HChD8cdWrxJyEzViDw.text: We took my mother in law here for her birthday, and she said it was the best restaurant she had ever been too. My initial reaction was "well, it's up there", then the more I thought about it I couldn't think of somewhere better.   Most importantly, the food was absolutely amazing. I got the flat-iron steak, absolutely tender. My wife got the chicken with a honey mustard glaze, very tender and the skin was cooked perfect. My mother in law got the halibut and the skin was cooked so it was crispy and the fish had so much flavor. I've never enjoyed white fish as much as the halibut here.   The atmosphere is of course sophisticated and classy while also being (intentionally) whimsical, as if to say "hey we're fancy but we don't take ourselves too seriously". The irony is, of course, that they do take themselves seriously. And the proof is in the pudding. Literally. Their desserts are out of this world.

hQarbt2sUYoSDZPHojAYDA.text: CLASSY ALL THE WAY! Our dinner was AMAZING. The Fig Bruschetta was INCREDIBLE. So much yumminess in one bite. The blueberry lemon meyer cheescake was SO good.  The decor of the place is very classic, with old black and white films playing in the background. It sets the mood so well. This is a must try, for EVERYONE!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9d-ZPGPc5dPrGNc3dD7fLg.text: First heard of Vintner Grill during my real estate group's cocktail party launch of Diamond Cake magazine. Finally made it around to having dinner here last Saturday. It is tucked away in an office complex off Charleston. The entry is unassuming and easy to miss. The decor is upscale chic modern. We were seated right away as we made reservations from Open Table off Yelp. The clientele that night seemed to be predominantly retiree age with a few scattered specks of youth. Our observation was that most of the women in there looked miserable. (You can marry for money but it doesn't buy happiness). You must come dressed up here or feel dramatically out of place amidst the money crowd. Luckily we came prepared. It took a while for someone to finally come over to bring us a menu and take drink orders. The cocktail menu consisted of old timer favorites with modern ingredients. For such a fancy place, they could have utilized a classier menu holder, rather than a plain clipboard. The selections seemed standard when comparing to previous posts of the menu with some slight changes. One of our favorite things was the butter dish with wells of infused olive oil...a welcomed forbidden treat after a week of "clean eating". The bread selection was very nice as well...get the brioche and try the cranberry bacon loaf. We each ordered the butter lettuce salad with warm Brie. The salad was a little difficult to eat because of large leaves but the encrusted Brie was good. I ordered the Mediterranean sea bass with haricot vert (French baby green beans), potatoes and chopped olives. The fish was fresh and light just like a sea bass should be, the veges were a nice accompaniment and retained their crispness. My wife ordered the veal scallopini with angel hair pasta. I tried some and it was delicious. Lean, thin veal cutlets in a wonderful marsala sauce. I would order that the next time. The wine was a Malbec that was smooth and light. They bring the bottle to the table to pour. The waiter seemed a bit too touchy feely for our comfort but not too creepy lol. Service was slow at some points. The prices are Strip prices without the Strip feel. As a local, I would rather spend my money on a restaurant on the Strip next time for the same quality of food with a little better service and much better ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass

erWyeZW6qTDOt8UsRg2PZw.text: For old cinema glamour mixed with romance, delicious food and great drinks, make a reservation at the Vintner Grill.  I absolutely love coming to this restaurant.  The ambience is fantastic and the service provided makes you feel catered to.  It's a great place to share dinner with your loved one or a small group of friends - having a fantastic time while dining.  They provide a great selection of bread with yummy infused butter spreads while you look over the menu.  One of my favorite appetizers on the menu is the calamari, it is fried and has a lemon curry aioli dipping sauce.  There are even thinly sliced rounds of lemon that are fried up with the calamari... the flavors all come together nicely!!  Do be ware though that it is easy to drive past VG as it is tucked in an industrial plaza and is some what hidden.  But once you find it you will not be disappointed.  You can't lose with sitting either inside or out, they are two different feels but both are great!

is3xlA9rJkHDiWpUZZDaoQ.text: A great experience every time we come, it's in a unique area (middle of business park), has classy white and black ambiance, sophisticated bar, and the food is always impressive!  We love the butter and bread too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel, raisin, white choc
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main dining
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramelized apple upside down cake

aCYrRZzVZyFV_PzKUFeVtQ.text: Get the seafood bouillabaisse. Lots of seafood in a flavorful broth served with pesto bread.

OamNcN5BCPTmgaS8v2Be9w.text: Brought girlfriend here for a celebratory dinner and found it to be consistent with the positive yelp reviews.  This restaurant is in an office complex and you would never know it was there unless you worked in this complex or heard about it elsewhere.  I chose patio seating based on the reviews and was not disappointed. The inside looks very elegant, but the patio is much more quiet and romantic. It is the perfect atmosphere for a date. The inside would be great for a large group.  For an appetizer we chose the hummus based on the yelp reviews. The hummus and pita chips were delicious!   They offered several different kinds of bread which were great as well as very good butter.  For entrees, I ordered the half chicken which was very good. My girlfriend had the scallops which were also good.  Prices are around $30-40 per plate which is still cheaper than top restaurants on the strip.   Contrary to negative reviews, we did not have any issues with service.  The only issue we did have was that the fire alarm went off for about 20 minutes about 2/3 into our meal. Luckily we were outside so it wasn't too disruptive. Despite this disruption I would eat here again.

w2Ttul0WK8NAuUgjXB4rZg.text: Prices, portions and a really nice environment!  I was looking for a nice place to eat that was not on the Las Vegas Strip and I came across this little gem.  Nice place!  We sat down in the back at a 2 person table.  We wanted to sit together so they let us turn the table sideways so we could both sit on the bench side by side!  Cocktails?  Huge wine selection.  I had a martini and he tossed some blue cheese stuffed olives in it.  It was fantastic.  Then the waiter brought out a bread tray with a good selection of breads.  I had the pretzel bread and the BACON cranberry.  Tasty!  I brought my lady here because she likes lamb.  I had the ravioli which was good and surprise......  She had the lamb appetizer ;) .  The lamb was a huge portion for the money and she took half of it home!  Great place, great atmosphere, good price for the experience.  I would return for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This restaurant is a great place  to bring a classy last :-)

KlB960m6kGlb28HplSvaCA.text: We used Vintner Grill to cater our anniversary party this past weekend.  Steven and the staff were absolutely amazing.  The food, the presentation, the service-were all incredible.  We can't thank them enough for their professionalism.  We would definitely recommend them and would use them again for any event.  A definite 5 star experience.

KR4VqQQ509SlVQJLqE5hKw.text: The food was perfect. The ambiance was perfect. The service was really REALLY bad.  We got to the restaurant, the hostess girl just seemed not to care. I think that's really the best way to put it, she just didn't care, like she's worked there for too long and she just doesn't care. When we got there she told us that the table was being setup, and the silverware must have been flown in from China while we waited, because we waited for 30min for that setup.  Out server was even worse. After we got seated it took 20min for him to come by and give us the menus, then another 20min until he stopped by again to take out drink orders and we ordered food as well getting the sense of their pace. Then another 20min for HALF our party to get their drink orders.  We had to chase the waiter down for round x2 drinks that were promised and of course came only after another 20min of waiting.  Beginning of the night the waiter told us that Vintner is Strip quality food off the Strip. Well on the Strip, Strip quality food also tends to come with Strip quality service.  What a shame really. The food was good and the ambience was fantastic. But the wait stuff was so bad it's stupid.  I would not recommend this restaurant.

kkWdI_CtozBVQwiXk4Ghzw.text: I love this place. Everything I have had here is simply exquisite. I always look forward to coming back.   The halibut is amazing. I love the pretzel bread. Also, the banana strudel was surprisingly delicious. I only wish they were open right now for lunch on a Sunday because I want to eat it now!

7lLG9dvLnSUdwHXvtmVXSg.text: Finally made it to Vintner Grill for my birthday dinner a few weeks back. Overall, we had a good experience.  I really liked the decor and you didn't feel at all like you were in a business park.   We were quickly seated by the hostess when we arrived (she could have been friendlier) and ended up between two larger, and louder, tables. I don't blame the restaurant - it just got really loud being by these tables. Eventually they both left and it calmed down a bit.  The food was very good. We shared a meat and cheese platter, which was delicious. We followed with a Italian sausage flatbread and the braised lamb Bolognese. Both were very good. The meal was finished with a birthday dessert, which did not disappoint.  The only reason I am not giving this visit a higher rating is because of the service. Our server was very friendly, but he seemed to go missing at times. He was always apologetic when he returned, but it just happened a little too much. We only had two courses, but we were there for three hours.  Don't get me wrong, I like to linger for a fine meal, but this was a little too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy birthday dessert
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatbread - also delicious
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and cheese platter - delicious

aXZt2jsNKze69rb_E3PLNQ.text: Went here with family for Easter.  Nice interior.  Great service.  Fish dish I had was outstanding.  It was expensive, but worth it.  I will go back again.

JtZEVCPuWTXBEjPaKZoi0Q.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Summerlin.  If you're going to splurge this is the place to do it.  From the minute you walk in the door you are greeted by very warm and friendly staff.  Our server, Jeff, was outstanding (as usual)!  He was able to go be us some great suggestions with wine pairings.  The grilled octopus and halibut was very delicious!  Highly recommend Vitner grill!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RZOFVkvFrLI5-ZkCP44nTQ.text: My mom and I had dinner here recently and it was a wonderful experience.  The restaurant is very unassuming in a business complex.  But when you get inside, you are transformed.  The decor of the restaurant is old Hollywood glamour with old movies playing.  Beautiful.  We got seated at a nice window table.  They have nice pillows to lean against on the banquette.    I started with a Moscow Mule.  Yummy!  It was served in the traditional copper cub which is fun.  I had the mixed green salad with fresh pear, candied walnuts, gorgonzola crostini and champagne vinaigrette.  Nice portion, tasty.  I then had the pan seared diver scallops with sweet corn risotto, heirloom tomatoes and shaved pecorino cheese.  The scallops were cooked perfectly.  Soft inside, crisp exterior.  Good risotto too.    Mom started with a butter nut squash soup.  She really liked it.  Was on the spicier side.  She then had the veal scaloppini with crimini mushrooms, lemon, marsala and capellini aglio olio.  I ate the mushrooms which were very tasty.  Definitely a very nice upscale meal.  I will be back.  They do lunch too.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squash soup
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear salad
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow Mule

prVruTZbBDypPdM-TEIoNw.text: The food is always delicious. Love that you can come in shorts and a t-shirt or dressed to the nines. It is Vegas after all. The service here has always been great. We had three people last night. We were at the high to table in the bar. NOTE: the chair height is to high for the table. Way too high. Therefore if you are over 5'3 it feels like your meal is in your lap. Very uncomfortable to eat at these tables. I hope one day they fix this.  For three people 2 cocktails each, 1 app, 2 salads and 3 entrees. Just over $300. The food portions are small as they should be. This isn't a chain. If you are looking for "quality" this is the place. If you want "quantity" then go elsewhere.

H4N_7KMkU3mcFPMLdhrD-g.text: Vintner grill in recent years has gained a large local following with good reason.   Because of it's location we delayed coming in for years... boy was that a bad decision on our part!   Walking in from the business plaza parking lot I was pleasantly surprised to find myself in the reception area of a high-end, upscale dining room with wood paneled ceilings and projectors silently playing classic black and white movies.  We were immediately greeted with a smile and promptly sat and offered drinks.   Listing 25+ cheeses they proudly offer the largest fromage selection in the area grouped into 5 categories from soft to semi-soft to blue to firm to cheddar. They carefully pair each with corresponding breads, jams, mustards, and fruit.  We ordered the truffled ricotta (which is the only cheese made in house) and a 10 year aged cheddar from Wisconsin and both were amazing!!!  The house made ricotta was outstanding, supper creamy and oh so light ... almost like a whipped consistency.  My husband also ordered a black truffle salami which he enjoyed as well.  For starters I ordered the oven roasted beats salad which is served with baby spinach, lavender goat cheese, hazelnuts, and mustard vinaigrette. It was highly recommended by our waiter and indeed it did not disappoint. My husband ordered the beef and barley soup with braised short ribs and crimini mushrooms which he loved.    If we stopped here, before the entrees, my review would have hands down been 5 stars, which I wanted to give so badly.  On yelp the Vegan Portobello Picatta had rave reviews.  One yelper said this was the best vegetarian dish on earth.  As a life long vegetarian, I like to support the vegan and vegetarian items when offered and I really  wanted to like this dish.  When it came out mine was mostly capers and fennel and had very little portobello mushroom.  The sauce tasted heavily of brine.  I wasn't a fan.  Mine may have been a one off because so many people on yelp loved this dish. On the other hand, my husband ordered the homemade tortellini filled with truffle ricotta cheese, organic mushrooms, summer corn sauce, and white truffle oil which was delicious!!!    For dessert the chef's Pumpkin Cheesecake was great but the waiter poured pipping hot tea in my husbands lap.   Really inside Vintner is a beautiful restaurant, for all but one plate the food was delicious, and other than the tea mishap the service was spectacular. Vintner did so many things so so right... We will return and with luck be able to give them the 5 star re-review they deserve.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the back of the main dining room.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10/13/17 Dinner Menu
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread service

ZZMtRRzr-YS469qM8mI6hw.text: My boyfriend takes me here on special occasions and I have to say every time it has always been a fantastic experience. The food, service and ambiance are all exceptional.   At our last dinner, we ordered the octopus appetizer and it was melt in your mouth delicious. I don't know how they get a piece of seafood so soft but I'm guessing they must marinate it in some kind of wine before stewing it.   For our main dishes, I usually order the chicken and he gets the rib eye and they're both bombdotcom.  Chocolate tart for dessert is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Pear Tart
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus appetizer

kswY1LiTmSLPF7wivclWXA.text: We sat at the bar, waiting for our table & that was the BEST part of the meal! Their cheese is amazing! I had a drink called "blueberry crush" which was good. My brother had a delicious white Russian my mother had a great glass of Riesling. After that it went down hill. The water wasn't chilled and we paid for bottled water- $9.50 a bottle. The bread wasn't warm. They did not have enough servers for the Thanksgiving holiday. My Portabella Marsala was Very good & my brother loved the Rib Eye; but,this is a potentially four star restaurant acting like a two star. The bathroom had the hand towels filling the trash and some on the floor.  It was a $300 meal that ended up being very disappointed - more for the service/ambience than the food itself.  Dessert was so/so. If this was the first time I went I would not go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their cheese is superb!

NMjlnnuBYKYhvdNvDVJ2Yg.text: My favorite farm to table lunch option in the Summerlin area has been Vitners Grill for over 5 years.....especially a day like today, refreshing fall breeze, and the scent of well manicured garden blowing creates the perfect atmosphere.  Their setting is elegant and perfect for a business meeting or birthday lunch with a few friends....or even just because. There is something special about the indoor and outdoor patio sitting with fresh garden aroma wafting on top of freshly prepared dishes.   There is a $25 power lunch menu, including choice of starter, entree and dessert...but I am not much a dessert person,especially for lunch, so I stick to my a la cart with glass of vino from their rather attractive selections on their wine menu. They also offer a half-size wine option, which is still plenty for lunch....leaving room to try a yummy soup or salad. One of my favorites at VG is their seasonal soup selection. Today I had "fire roasted red pepper soup with smoked chicken".....this flavor is already welcoming Autumn to my palate....a half size order was plenty to indulge in before the entree.  I have my go-to waiter or waitress at any restaurant I regularly dine at....they can help elevate the experience to another level by providing exceptional service time and time again....and at Vintners Grill, I have Ray....always welcoming and ready with the perfect recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread selections
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fire roasted red pepper soup w/ smoked chicken, garbanzo beans &amp; basil pesto, half portion $6
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet butter lettuce salad  w/ warm brie, carrots, cherry tomatoes, and orang-balsamic vinaigrette, half portion $7

4JoG9-dNiu_IFsz-bniUuw.text: Had the blueberry crush drink, crab cake appetizer, crab ravioli and the chocolate torte dessert.  Was delicious!   The bread and butter service was bomb.  Actually was my fav part!   I'll totally be back!

Xq6xR28n6miU6O14i4TziQ.text: This is a great and a little upscale place to grab some lunch. And probably dinner too. I was there killing time while I got my Mercedes serviced. I asked to sit in the lounge area. The very skinny older lady hostess had to call someone and make sure that I can sit there for lunch. That was a little bit strange. I started off with bread that was really delicious. They have about five different varieties. I like the bacon one the most. Their butter spread was also delicious. One was green that tasted like a pesto and the second one tasted something like an olive tapenade/sun-dried tomatoes. But, you can ask to make sure what it was. I then got three starters. The calamari was lightly fried and came with the delicious curry aioli, I usually don't like curry but it had very little curry. And it was a little sweet. Which I liked. The crab cake was delicious, it had a lot of crab in it. And, finally the white bean hummus was ok. The tiramisu for dessert was a little too chocolatey for me. And not enough cream. For me personally, it was just OK. I didn't even finish it. Overall, I give the food a 4 and the service maybe a 3. The service could definitely be better and friendlier.

raxC-vnCrr5t5qPbD_3pKA.text: Fabulous, amazing, beautiful, wonderful. There are not enough words to express how wonderful Vintner Grill is. We had our wedding and reception at Vintner. We did a full buy out and had about 130 guests. The food was fabulous and they accommodated specialty diets and allergies. Each guest felt taken care of. The service was exceptional. Our guest commented on how great it was. The bar tenders were absolutely a highlight. They accommodated and made the environment so friendly and fun. We heard 0 complaints from our guests and heard hundreds of compliments about the staff, food, and atmosphere.   Leisha, the special events coordinator was beyond expected. Every request was attended to. I had no worries. Everything was done with such care. When she couldn't fulfill a request, she pointed me in a direction to help with the request. She was always prompt with communication and always so genuinely nice. Throughout the process, confusion was minimal and communication was always clear.   Tom, the general manager, took the whole experience to a new level. He walked us though his suggestions for the ceremony, which made things more beautiful. He even helped direct our bridal party down the isle. During the entire reception, everything was so well attended to. I had 0 worries on anything. Everything went so smoothly. At the end of the night, he was so congratulatory and showed genuine happiness for our happiness on our special day. Each staff member did. Truly an experience to remember fondly for our entire lives.   Thank you, Vintner staff. Thank you!

a_zkdsX7WfVLHM92zZX8PQ.text: FOOD: (5 STARS) Everything was delicious! Wifey had blueberry crush, treviso caesars and petite prime steak. I had stella, treviso caesars and full lamb bolognese. The best calamari I've tried so far, must have been the curry aioli.  AMBIENCE: (5 STARS) Classy.   SERVICE: (5 STARS) Waiter was very attentive and genuinely pleasant. I just don't remember his name (am really bad with names).  LOCATION: (5 STARS) When you're actually inside, you forget that it's in a business complex, just a mile drive from my place.   Why 4.5 STARS and not 5?   Saw one male worker behind the kitchen counter, nibbling something he snatched from someone's plate!   Hostess kind of made me uncomfortable from whispering several times to the guy that would sit us. Did she not have planned a table for a party of 2 early on?  The guy that would sit us kept a nice smile (helped us feel comfortable) while the hostess still whispered to him as we started to walk to our table.    White table napkin was "linty." Wife asked for a black napkin after we saw one lady in black outfit at the next table had a black napkin in her lap.   Nevertheless, wife and I enjoyed the place, the service, specially the food. We will come back with family and friends next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. patio
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. interior
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. interior

eXDaoDKqFG6xLBpgGFsNCQ.text: We were planning to celebrate friend's birthday at Vintners Grill. There was eight of us, including two children. As presents, we ended up with three nice bottles of wine, and of course, we expected corkage fee. When we arrived, we asked for the Champagne to be chilled. They took the bottle, presumably to put it in an ice bucket. Then, the bizarre evening started. Several waiters started arguing, right at our table, about who is going to work our table. Apparently, they decided that a team of two will start, and then they will switch, and then, another team will take over at the end. The agreement was hammered out only after two different people trying to get us water and drinks. While this was going on, a band carried equipment in, and started playing extremely loud music, (toping 118 decibels if the phone app is to be believed), which made verbal communication with the staff and among ourselves somewhat challenging. The music continued the whole evening, the ringing in our ears for hours after we left. When the time for birthday toast came, waiter started serving the champagne but, it turned out it did not made it into the ice bucket, as requested, and promised. Pity. Fortunately (we foolishly thought), we had another bottle of chilled bubbly. However, we were informed, they can only open two bottles in one evening, (reason escapes me, as they make $30/bottle corkage), so if they open the chilled bottle, after they opened the warm one, we could not enjoy the red Bordeaux, we were hoping to have with the meal. As for the meal, it was well executed, no problem, but no WOW either. Pastry chef obviously knows his craft, desert was the best part. If they replace the manager, half of the wait staff, and stay away from the loud live music, this place could become decent neighborhood eatery. As it is, it is a lousy place to have dinner.

dB_tevOGMZEpaOz4CFSKFQ.text: We love this place!   Had the bouillabaisse and corvina, the special. Then meyer lemon cheesecake. Also, the flight #2 wine tasting.   Bernie was exceptional and will ask for him next time.

8aKp50lgGr8XMV1RlxCTZA.text: I have to say, I have been coming here for a couple of years and I really enjoy the calming ambiance of this place.  We usually go here when we are in the mood to have a nice cheese plate and some yummy wine.  The seating options are nice, for casual experience, go to the bar or the comfortable sectional couch area next to the bar... quick service and comfortable environment  Or choose fine dining and be escorted to nice tables with experienced wait staff and a great menu.  I always choose multiple options usually from the appetizer or beginnings menu and we stay for an hour or so.  I have never had a bad experience even when it was very busy.  Do not let the location throw you off as it is set and hidden by business offices, once inside, they have managed to make you feel like you weren't on a business luncheon or happy hour next to offices.  I even have to compliment the valet staff, no matter what, I have rarely had to wait for my car, by the time I make it to the stand, the car is ready and valet is holding the door open.

mXKS3_SAG3uTL9vRRztghg.text: Great place for dinner.  Portions were pretty sizable.  I expected tiny portions for my tiramisu & halibut because it's such a fancy place, but no, I was actually pretty impressed! A must for dinner!!

XmH0a_Hs7il6eKBzAMI8OQ.text: First visit, first impression:  a very nice place with a cool vibe with delicious food that approaches the quality of many high-end restaurants on the strip.  Vintner's is somewhat hidden in an office complex, which somehow adds to the coolness of the place.  We walked in to find low ceilings; an old movie showing on translucent, hanging screens; fabric dividers between the larger sections of the restaurant; and a large bar in the middle of it all.  Like I said--pretty cool!  Folks were dressed nicely, but not stuffy.  While not required, jackets for the guys and nice slacks or skirts for the gals throughout the restaurant ensured a special atmosphere without being stuffy.  We did see a few folks in very casual clothing and even jeans, but I have to believe they probably felt underdressed.  We were told to make a reservation because of the popularity of the place, and the advice was good.  We were seated quickly, and it was clear if we didn't have a reserved table, we would have had to go elsewhere.  The hostess was very courteous but our waiter seemed to go back and forth between wanting to impress us (which is a bit awkward), and being a bit put out that he was working.  He wasn't rude, but seemed...preoccupied.  The service was fine, but in the end he's the only reason this isn't a 4-star review.  The menu rivaled many of the more expensive places around town.  The food was delicious but it took a while for it to come out after we ordered, frankly longer than it seemed it probably should have, but we didn't mind since we were there to enjoy a leisurely and relaxing evening.  We enjoyed pan seared Halibut and a ribeye followed by dessert for each of us (salted caramel creme brulet and tiramisu), and accompanied dinner with a beer, a moscow mule and a coffee.  The bill came to $126:  a reasonable price for the quality of the food and the convenience of having a place like this so close to home.  Parking is easy:  you can self park or valet and it's all very close to the restaurant.  There are even reserved spots for the restaurant, but watch the signs.  There are also quite a few spots marked as "not restaurant parking" (rather than marked as reserved for another business by name).  It gave me the impression the restaurant doesn't have a good relationship with it's neighbors.  If you're looking for a place for a nicer evening out but don't want to truly dress up, give Vintner Grill a try.  I think you'll like it.  Related, here's a final thought:  I mentioned the waiter kept my rating lower than it would have been otherwise.  After just that one visit, it's clear I need to go back to find out what's normal.  Even though I marked this as a 3-star rating, based on what we've heard from so many of our friends I expect a return visit or two will result in a revised, higher rating.  (Looks like I have an excuse to go back!)

_odPDDMxKEbvwCq_joykWA.text: We came here for my dad's birthday dinner on a Sunday. We requested to be seated outdoors to enjoy the lovely summer evening and we were able to. The patio is gorgeous and you feel like you're in a garden. For my cocktail, I got the Bastille Day which was made very well - just the right amount of mixing of flavors and alcohol. For my meal, I got the grilled Atlantic salmon on spaghetti squash. Everything tasted great and the presentation was beautiful. I also tried a little gelato that my dad ordered which was bomb. This is a pretty upscale restaurant so the prices and atmosphere reflect that. We didn't sense any particular dress code but looking a bit nicer than normal is probably wise. I heard they also have music here certain nights of the week so that would be nice. I'd probably come back for a special occasion - it'd be a beautiful place for a wedding rehearsal dinner or reception!

7l_pvk9w4Eg0B4Yw5ftdew.text: Thanksgiving dinner was a total success at vintner grill, the service and the quality of the food was outstanding, turkey menu was delicious and it so was the regular menu choices like risotto, steak,Caesar salad and calamari. The restaurant is located in the back of business center but don't let this fool you because the decor is beautiful and patio area is chic and inviting, we will come back for sure.

Vv3xmjkHWa5zfoG8WXTlYg.text: LOVE their beet salad and scallops. So perfectly cooked and designed for harmonious taste. Highly recommend!

WxfMIW_vRNH3Mfoh0JUxZw.text: It used to be a great place with a great  food-not anymore!  First our server wasn't nice at all ,didn't say hey or smiled not even trying to be nice.  The food was tasteless some of it like the chicken was still raw,the steak was super sweet(from the sauce ) and definitely not worth the $50, the fish was super dry like a piece of rubber!! You can see the quality going downhill here- Even the complimentary bread was so dry and definitely not fresh.  We feel sorry for this place,used to be our favorite spot in town

M9SGTWKNsBh5x0W-4dyK9w.text: On my second time there I wanted to have everything in the menu.  The food is excellent  The service is excellent  The coktails are amazing  Little bit expensive though.

b5SZy4_r53AxQQxSvwJNkQ.text: Classy, delicious food, fair price Great for Business lunch, fancy date, impressing the parents.   Crispy calamari with curry aioli was delicious. Never had curry aioli before but it complements the calamari so well. Get the large version of the appetizer because you'll end up wanting more.  Braised Lamb bolognese was melt-in-your mouth good. Generous portion of lamb with a punch of flavor in the mouth. Loved it.  Friend had the pastrami sandwich and he loved it as well.   Friendly and attentive service.  Good open seating. Clean, bright atmosphere.   Bathroom is very clean, so the kitchen must be spectacularly clean.

kqvZDIBuMo4l_gSSF8gLgA.text: No! Did not have a great night here sadly. Came highly recommended by yelp so I was excited.  Had a reservation. We were pleasantly greeted and then seated after a short wait.  The restaurant wasn't full but "our" table wasn't ready quite yet so after a bit we were seated.  Chairs were not really comfortable.  Restaurant was not busy but we had to wait for a server quite some time.  He came- we asked about wine- got a bottle but it wasn't really a good wine.  Dinner was OK.  The starter salads were good but after that fail.  I had a flatbread that wasn't good and wasn't prepared as I asked.  Food took so long I didn't order anything else since I would have to wait a long time and our server didn't come back to chek on us.  Overall, underwhelmed by service and food  Would not come again

jfb__DIC4QxxURivpjJitQ.text: There day time bartender , not the usual ...has no clue . Very unprofessional.  There manager ,seems to be more concerned about his meal and drink then his machines or guests .. Again very unprofessional.

cpinPVoJ6WcwpGPV4zKxig.text: My girlfriend and I came here for a Valentine's Day dinner. The ambiance, decor, service, drinks and food was amazing and quite upper crust (It's a good thing)! Top notch. We opted for the special, limited Valentine's Day menu and we were not disappointed. My steak was cooked perfect and the desserts were divine! We will definitely be back to experience more options on the menu. I suggest this restaurant if you want to take a loved one out for a date night or special occasion.

ess8ST5ekJr62Z_fwxpo0Q.text: Sorry we couldn't give this five stars.  Be sure you review the prices on the menu and know if you want the half size portion.  We didn't notice the difference in prices and only concentrated on which food item we wished to order.  Turns out that we were served the full portion and not the half, even though we didn't specifically say "full" or "half" portion.  A good waiter would have asked, "Would you like the half or full portion?"  Instead he assumed that it should be the full portion and charged $34 for the pan-grilled fish. Perhaps, since it was lunch and not dinner, he could have assumed it was half, but no he assumed full.  The person bringing the bread and coffee and was NOT very personable or friendly.  The waiter was irritated that we questioned the "half" vs "full" portion.  Really expected friendlier persons to be serving at such a highly-rated restaurant.  The cobb salad dressing is a "sweet" vinagrette.  A little too sweet for my taste but the presentation was lovely.  Lots of other places to try.

R1R4d-btwKWD_MdEbDec9A.text: It is hard for me to find a place that hits on all marks but this place did it.   Service was fantastic, food was great, and ambiance was great. The menu had the perfect selection, variety of options, and everyone in our large group was happy.   I was also impressed to see that their coffee is served with a French press.  Can't say enough about this place.

uQgdk0TC4u_dxMFH69uG_w.text: Why doesn't every office park have a quality restaurant?  Come to think of it, why don't I work in this office park?  I have been here a few times before for drinks, and a couple other times for dinner a while back...but restaurant week brought me back.  Vintner Grill is a classy, upscale...perhaps even romantic kind of place with nice decor and a distinctive feel.  I also like that most people are dressed up a bit more than at comparable places...it adds more charm.  I know that I am going to get a quality product here with good service.  The flavors will be solid, but they also aren't going to push the creative envelope too far here either.  I am generally looking for something a little more adventurous/creative when I dine at this price-range, but I'd come back to Vintner for a consistently good meal.  I enjoyed the pumpkin gnocchi, the parsnip puree, and the halibut.  I'd do these again without hesitation.

R4zFkYtgFD2yvh8IU4FvOA.text: Irvin and Jeff are probably the best waiters I have ever had. The food is exceptional.  Service is superb.

PZH1k-qSvuDlLIa6mH_iSA.text: Let me start with a HUGE pet peeve of mine.  I walk into a restaurant that's not even 25% full, your hostess walks me past six empty tables and she takes me to a table right next to another couple... Like we just joined them for dinner?!  Really!  Your server's convenience and who's turn it is should NEVER be my problem!!!  Obviously, I asked for another table.    I love going to Vintners for the variety of cheeses.  It's always fun to try new flavors and wow your taste buds. My wife had the stroganoff.  It was ok.  The problem is, if you're going to put stroganoff on your menu, it better be fantastic!  Meat was ok, noddles were overdone, sauce was "just like mama makes."    I had the lamb, which was incredible.  Someone will have to explain to me the culinary technique of cooking Brussels sprouts so they are warm but really hard to chew... To me that says under cooked.  No room for dessert this time.    Overall good visit, but I think next time it will be cheese tray and dessert.  If I want a good   Entree, I'll just save a thirty minute drive and eat on the strip somewhere.  Love this restaurant and the ambiance...  For $ 140, I expected more.  This restaurant should be on my top ten list... Someday maybe...

qowR4_o0GoolJXB6y40tKA.text: While a tad difficult to find if you've never been there, Vintner is spectacular.  The service is great, the food is good and changes often.  This is a very romantic place and I can even enjoy my cigar outside by the fire pit!  Drinks are excellent!

vEhAtRqsR9iIzCWc99johw.text: Expensive yes, but consistently good. Attention paid to the drinks and food. When a restaurant prepares an excellent salad then you know they care about the quality. Great for a special occasion or business dinner.

v5LRfJUt6HY60m_t2eXohQ.text: Make sure to pay with cash, I used a brand new CC, 1st time used here and BAM! Next day called by fraud alert from my CC company.  Someone used a CC skimmer to get all my info and tried to buy a bunch of crap online and send money through Western Union to New Jersey.  Humm,  our waiter was the only one whom I gave it to.  Be careful using CC's here, setup monitoring alerts if you do use one.  Thanks to my CC company it was reported as real fraud from here and I didn't pay a dime.  Food, ok'ish,  wild kittens running around the Patio.  SMH.   One star because I have to or I can't post this review.   10 stars for my CC company getting all my fraudulent money back.

RBbkZvmBQ8CehQ2K1G5CNQ.text: SO DISAPPOINTING!  The one star I am giving this restaurant is ONLY due to the spectacular decoration. I had a group dinner at Christmas time and every dish was magnificent. I felt as though I had finally found an off the strip restaurant that had the ingenuity of an "on the strip" venue. We had seared to perfection scallops and corn ravioli that too this day has me scouring menus for that same dish every time I find myself out. I was beyond disappointed to come back this week to a completely different menu and the food was just bland. The presentation of the dishes were elementary. It's sad because I had found this hidden gem and now it's just an overpriced restaurant with a below average menu you can find anywhere. What happened?

inNTihw7HTAiOVfjpxmoJg.text: Let me start by saying the place looks great and the service overall is quite good. However the quality of the food is just terrible. I have been here twice and got food poisoning the second time snd both times the dishes tasted like microwave food. Will not come back for sure and I suggest to avoid at all costs unless you got money to blow and need a real excuse to skip work the next day.

yoh7ltFhM3sMQnCoQZu1sg.text: Love the food and Jeff is the best waitress ever! She's so thoughtful and attentive. Even offered my baby a sippy cup. I'm coming back all the time now just to see her!!! Miss you already!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm

AbVw8DV0_N6UQSyR1Bo_7Q.text: Walking into this beautifully designed restaurant, I was hopeful. This is a hard restaurant to review. I absolutely loved many things about this place, but there are definitely some aspects I think they could improve upon.  The decor, the lighting, the free valet parking, the comfortable seating all scream luxury, yet with an air of comfort and homie-ness. The staff matched that with their warmth and friendliness. Our server did a good job. Not fantastic, but good. The service seemed to get a little lazy at the end.  The first two courses were terrific. We started with cheese (faux pas!). The sheep's milk petite basque was sharp and mildly pungent. The truffled ricotta was creamy and luxurious. Both were delightful with the homemade strawberry and apricot mustard jams they were served beside. We also had the venison salami which was good but nothing special.  I judge crab cakes based on what they are garnished with (since they all taste about the same to me). This variation has a beautiful, creamy tarragon vinaigrette, some peppery greens and a tangy,  sweet roasted bell pepper relish. The combination was divine.  The baby gem "wedge" salad was also a refreshing combination of flavors: tender baby gem lettuce, with large chunks of piquant blue cheese, salty and crispy pancetta, sweet poached pears, tomatoes and a blue cheese-bacon dressing.  The main courses were decent. Jen got the sauteed salmon. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare and was quite fresh tasting, though overly salted. The lobster sauce was decadent and creamy. The mashed potatoes were a little cold and had a strange tasting spice in them (maybe cardamom?).  I had the roasted, boneless half chicken with truffle glaze and cavatelli served "Mac and cheese" style. The skin was perfectly crispy and the glaze was sweet and luxurious. Unfortunately, the chicken itself was a little dry (as it tends to be if not brined). The cavatelli, though creamy and cheesy needed some salt. It was also served with some broccolini that was still very crunchy.  Despite its minor faults to an otherwise lovely dining experience, I enjoyed this place and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and meat plate: truffled ricotta, petite basque, venison salami, apricot-mustard and strawberry jams
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand crafted raspberry lemonade. Not too sweet which was nice
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing bread selection: bacon-cranberry, green olive, brioche

j3n2sWrX9xyJtkGlrun76g.text: Took my wife here a couple months ago and it was an awful experience. Food way overpriced and crowded atmosphere. Tables were too close together and I could hear the couple next to us just as good as I could hear my wife.

H5wsueDYSw4rxbDRn4cwZw.text: The food was amazing as always but service wise we had to ask a few times for the next steps, we waited quite a bit. Also, we did mention we were there celebrating a birthday in our reservation and even though we all ordered wine, appetizers, main dishes and desserts, not even a candle was added to a dessert. Not very good service in my opinion when a celebration is not acknowledged.  I do need to mention that everything we ordered was beyond delicious.  Crab cakes, beet salad, gnocchi, chicken, sea bass and halibut, with tiramisu, pumpkin creme brulee and Apple cake. All so good.

ZuwBDZ1Off_T7NcVkHNP1Q.text: Food was very good. Service was excellent. Taking this down one star because of atmosphere. Visually appealing but the level of the noise was off the charts. So loud we gave up even trying to have a conversation. Waiter had to ask questions individually because when he was back far enough to address both of us you couldn't hear him.

URMv1ByjWvdp2zltvRtH3A.text: Delicious!!  Unique atmosphere balancing fine dining with comfortable seating. The cheese and meat tray was wonderful, especially liked the aged provolone and venison salami- great flavor!  Summer gazpacho Chef's special was perfect. And finished with unique Corrot cake cheesecake.  Friendly yet professional servers.  Nice drive away from the Vegas Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R2kooWBWXSZ2pUlEU_A0Kg.text: 4.5 Stars  I've been asking my significant other to take me to Vintner Grill for a long time....and some how we always forget about this place when we have date night. Anyways, I finally made it on a busy Saturday night with reservations!! I've only been to Vintner for a wine event so I was really excited to try the food. We started off with some drinks....I ordered the Tropical Paradise I think that's the name....and let me tell you that drink alone will make me go back!   For an appetizer, we started off with the 3 selection, 2 different cheese and prosciutto. Pretty delish! For dinner, I decided to order the scallops and the husband ordered the Chicken with Mac and Cheese. We decided to do a half order of the Bolognese Taglietelli! (I love that they can do half order for you). My scallops were good, but nothing to run home and Yelp about, the chicken and mac and cheese were definitely a better choice between the two. The pasta was delicious, but kind of tasted like chow fun (dry style). I liked how they had big chunks of lamb, but its definitely more Asian influenced, still delicious! We were too full with dinner to order some dessert, but I know we will be back!   Service was good, the place was packed for a Saturday night and I can't wait to get the Tropical Paradise! YUM!!!!

CXGABS-QcPmjxpajicpy8A.text: I can't get enough of the honey truffle chicken. I also enjoy the pretzel bread. The ambience and service is superb. Five stars consistently!

fUuiqppnJ7AGxuBPyjI-Yw.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!! It's was my second time here everything has been delicious. My friends and I sat at the bar to have dinner and the bartender, Yvonne, was a complete pleasure! She gave great food recommendations. The grilled octopus, braised lamb bolognese, and cod entree. Only downfall...the weather. I've been waiting to come here and enjoy the beautiful outdoor patio. Oh well, I'll just have to come back again!!

-AjkKq9UCto8dDMHnoB0CA.text: Exceptional in food quality, taste and ambience.   The Dinner-  Moscow Mule-Plenty of vodka, spiced with candied ginger and lime.   Appetizer- Cheese and Meat Assortment; Venison, Prosciutto, goat and cow cheese options.   The half chicken with honey truffle sauce- Light yet robust, with ''Mac and Cheese'  Dessert- Lemon Cheesecake, Spiced Pumpkin Brulee and Tiramisu Cappuccino.   The Lemon citrus notes blended perfect with the cheesecake creating a noticeable and pleasant accent with the creamy texture of cheesecake.   Tiramisu Cappuccino- Thick whipped texture. Very Rich. I recommend sharing.   Spiced Pumpkin Brulee- Solid dependable Creme' Brulee.  The service was attentive and the ambience is unique and tasteful.   Vintner Grill was difficult to find hidden inside an office suite complex. Trust your map. Its tucked away right off the main road. Experience was enjoyable and the food memorable.

sV1zyuuyC2j2F9MVajZ03A.text: Atmosphere was nice however the waiter continuously tried to up charge us and the food was sub par. Not to mention they "accidentally" poured our table Fiji and then stated they might charge us for it after we said it was ok to leave. Again service and food not worth the trip or money.

2WMyAhn2b1AqVxJaLV7kDw.text: Food doesn't get any better then this. Food it spot on and can't wait to come back. Food is fresh, especially the octopus.

BhsVOjh2z1feDxGH_yMdow.text: Nice place to take a date.Excellent service and the foods delicious.I didn't find it too pricey but that's a matter of opinion.

i1wV2PlFaQKOdmzQzmlTtg.text: Visited for the first time for dinner.... food was excellent.....service matches.... going to try lunch next time.... strongly recommend

nPRBe57O_EL4P6rx4dWhEg.text: I ADORE this place. I've eaten in the restaurant and in the bar/lounge area.   The food is amazing. The atmosphere is amazing. The selection is on point. The cocktails and wine selection are delightful.   They have this amazing patio, but I suggest making reservations for it, because it's a bitch to get a table out there with out them.  They have an amazing cheese and meat/ charcuterie selection that I highly recommend you choosing from for your appetizer.  Sometimes we just go for the charcuterie and cocktails!   This place is not particularly easy to find and when you do find it you think that perhaps you're in the wrong place. Don't let that fool you! Just because it's in a business park doesn't mean anything except it's a hidden gem!

TV_phbFpC1-hHXefebMesg.text: OMG this place has the BEST food! They even have a meat and cheese menu and amazing wine list. Will be back ASAP! And the service was great too!

LhMhJqGgGIWMQhrMnz1pXQ.text: 4.5 stars  Review is for the Restaurant Week 2011 menu:  This was the first time I was at Vintner Grill even though it's only about a mile from where I live.  I decided to give the place a try with its Restaurant Week menu and I was not disappointed.  Course 1 was crispy calamari with a lemon and curry aioli and some haricot verts.  The calamari was cooked perfectly and I liked that besides rings they had tentacles mixed in.  The lemon and curry aioli was a very tasty dipping sauce.  5/5  Course 2 was veal scaloppini with crimini mushrooms, lemon, marsala and capellini with olive oil.  The marsala sauce was superb in its richness and the crimini mushrooms added god flavor.  The capellini was a bit bland.  It needed some salt and for my taste a bit of grated cheese to bring out the richness of the olive oil.  4.5/5  Course 3 was a dessert of a gorgonzola panna cotta with a cherry compote and some sesame tuile.  The panna cotta was very light as it should be and had a mild flavor.  The cherry compote paired well with the lightness of the panna cotta.  The tuile was placed across the plate in the panna cotta.  Presentation was quite nice.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated.  I appreciate the fact that they start dinner service at 4.  I had a reservation for 4:30 as I needed to eat, run home and put my shorts back on, and head to a play at Spring Mountain Ranch State Park.  Service was excellent.  My server was polite and efficient.  The music loop was more for gray hairs like me.  The place was quiet, but it was early and there weren't many diners yet.  I do wish we could dispense with the TVs at the bar, but this is Las Vegas and almost any bar needs one or more TVs.

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy calamari.

8PIQLga40xw4Qsh0mGbd3A.text: The food here is delicious, but I would recommend picking it up instead of dining at this establishment. I have experienced rude and generally poor service from the wait staff here the past two times I've eaten here. The service at this place ruins the dining experience completely, thus the one star rating.  Both times I ate there with my girlfriend, who happens to be very attractive. (Forgive me for having good taste, not only when it comes to food). The first time we went, we sat down and waited about 10 minutes for a menu. Our supposed waiter was nowhere to be found by the hostess until we pointed him out to her- he was attending to a large party, taking his time, making jokes and completely ignoring us- he would periodically walk by our table, checking out my girlfriend and not saying anything. Just walking by silently staring. I noticed this at least 3 times- it was creepy and annoying.  Our order was taken by a 'temp server' who promised the actual server would take over- he didn't. Our food was placed on the table by two different servers/bussers. Out 'server' came by at the last minute to 'check' on us, as if he had been waiting on us the entire time, but that was toward the end of the meal- evidently to ensure we tipped him well as we were almost finished dining.   At the time he stopped by my girlfriend, an avid instagrammer was taking a picture of her food. (I don't partake in such activities but who am I to judge?) He made some corny joke about her taking a picture of him and framing it on her wall to which I replied 'I think we're good'. The whole experience was very confusing, awkward, and unprofessional.   We decided to try this place out one more time yesterday, went in with an open mind, hoping for a better dining experience with a different waiter. Even though our waiter was different, the experience was even worse. I don't know if our waiter had something going on personally, or maybe we didn't 'fit in' because we were wearing casual clothing and were younger than everyone else in the place, (it was about 95  degrees on a Monday afternoon- no way I'm not wearing shorts) but he was very rude as he approached us, didn't smile once, and took our order as if he would've rather been anywhere in the world but in front of us doing what he is being paid to do- mumbling and generally half-assing his way through taking our order.   When I asked if I could substitute brown rice instead of mac and cheese he snapped at me saying that 'we don't have brown rice', and didn't offer any suggestions, until I asked him to suggest what other alternatives they had.  I should also mention that both me and my girlfriend are very polite people and both greeted him nicely and were polite the entire time.  Only after I sternly told him that we were in a hurry and to put a rush on the order, did he start acting more polite.   Once again, great food, horrible service. But maybe you'll be fine if you're older and wearing a collared shirt.

xXs1L3VMyoQ8yYLwoVJeaA.text: You know you're going to have an enjoyable meal as soon as you walk in.  The decor is very nice, everyone is fashionably dressed, and the place has a lively, but understated vibe.  To start off, the wine and cocktail selection was very good.  The beer selection was good, but offering a little more variety in the craft beers would be a good thing.  We ordered a variety of appetizers. A couple of flat breaks, the cured meat and cheese plate, octopus, etc.  Everything was top notch.    I have to ding them a bit for my entree.  I ordered the halibut and it was over cooked and dry.  I would have sent it back, but I was full from the appetizers, and wouldn't have eaten very much of it.  Plus, everything else was really good, so I just went with the flow.  The best part of this place is the atmosphere.  The food is of course important, but there's good food all over the place.  The atmosphere, and customer focus sets them apart.  The details seemed to be thought out from spacing between tables, to the set up of the bar and the art work on the walls.  One other thing - it's a good value.  The prices are pretty good for what you get.  If you tried to get something similar on the strip, it would cost you triple.

rVSwYlsKRqagogXp5eTh3g.text: My boyfriend & I went here for our second date. We decided to go back to celebrate our one year anniversary (two years ago). We sat outside on the patio and had a fantastic meal. We made a reservation to celebrate our three year anniversary on Sat, 7/23.  Our reservation was for 7pm. We arrived about 6:40 and had a cocktail at the bar (our bartender Mark was fantastic). We went back to the hostess at 7:10 to be seated on the patio as we had requested when we made the reservation, only to be told it was closed for a private party. It would have been nice if they had contacted us to let us know but okay, not a huge deal. The hostess wanted to seat us at a two top but we asked for something where we could sit next to each other (that was a big part of the reason why we requested patio seating). She said she'd have to check with the manager. We went to sit on a couch by the hostess stand while we waited and she told us that we could not sit there because it was reserved (even though there was no one around). After ~5 minutes, the manager said he'd have something ready for us in 20 minutes. At this point, my boyfriend wanted to leave but I convinced him to stay. Since we could not sit on the couches, we went back to the one open seat at the bar and Mark asked what happened. We explained and he offered to comp a round of drinks (thank you Mark!) We were about to order the lamb meatballs when the hostess told us our table was ready. We took our drinks to our table and immediately asked our server Michael for the lamb meatballs. He said they can't serve bar menu items in the dining room. I understand that but we were only at the bar because our reservation was messed up. He said he could check with his manager and we asked him to. He came back - the manager said no.   Luckily, things went nowhere but up from there - the cheese plate was fantastic, the wine pairings were decent, the lamb bolognese was delicious and they wrote Happy Anniversary on the plate (our server grabbed the first dessert they brought out and promptly returned with the decorated plate).   All that being said, we were seriously considering hosting our engagement party here and while the food is fantastic, I really hesitate to go back based on the way our evening started off.

jFfodD35X7ey5Mz5-CMVYg.text: I love the food here. I've had my graduation party here. We go here all the time.   My mother wanted to go here specifically for the sea bass they were offering for a special Mother's Day menu she was emailed by the restaurant themselves. So we made a reservation. We arrived. And no sea bass.   The prix fixe menu was only for lunch, they said. Yet no where in the email did it specify times.  "We couldn't tell people NOT to order the sea bass to save it for dinner," the manager said with a condescending tone. Yet he offered no consolation.   I understand that you can run out of popular items on a busy day such as today, but as a manager you need to own up to your restaurant's mistakes and not pass it off ("that was our marketing team...").

5BIJpVVIsUkREeLdW508Rw.text: I came here for a large dinner with a fixed menu so I'm going to give this restaurant the benefit of the doubt when I say that that's probably why our food wasn't great.  The one highlight was definitely the Moscow Mule cocktail which wasn't part of the set menu. Delicious!   To start they brought out bread that was completely cold I'm not sure if this is normal or not. We had some hummus and pita which was ok. Cesar salad was ok but not very flavorful. I had the corn ravioli which I thought was oddly thick in terms of the pasta itself almost as if it wasn't cooked properly. The sauce and inside of the ravioli was also not impressive. My boyfriend had the halibut which was pretty dry and fishy and the couscous underneath wasn't great either. For dessert we had a chocolate lava cake which oddly didn't taste very strongly of chocolate.   I don't really want to come back and try this place without a set menu just because this experience was pretty disappointing and I know this place is pricey.

4O4QsxAQBigJU010jT_tbA.text: Every time we go we go we get exceptional service and the food is always top notch, fantastic wine list for all price ranges. We are locals and this is a place we frequent a lot. Dining experience and room is perfect for dates or enjoy night out

RFu5UQoDbODy8uuew5lULQ.text: We walked out of Giada's because of dismal service; drove across town to Vintner Grill and was greeted  and welcomed as usual by a lovely hostess, No reservations?  No problem!!  Service excellent, Sea bass was perfectly prepared as well as the beef medallions.  Lemon cheesecake was whipped and relish! Hot, fresh coffee to wash it down.   Our waiter Scott knew everything about everything Vintner and selected an amazing trio of cheese, Purple Haze, pecorino infused with truffle and a triple creamy soft cheese.  A+ . Our blanc was chilled perfectly and while the servers were attentive, they were never intrusive, merely checking silently to see that all was well..and this is why this restaurant is our all-time favorite!!

Nm-com7pW0K1ZuvXqseG0Q.text: I was fortunate enough to come here by attending a coworkers bridal shower and I absolutely love this restaurant. Food was delicious and the ambiance was amazing. The service was top notch and I can't wait to go again, possibly for date night! It is reasonably priced which is a great thing in this economy!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

8Q1lb6-aNRMV6_hT5sb4qw.text: This place is really outstanding and knows exactly what great customer service is all about - which I find to be very rare these days!  My fiance and I checked out VG as we were in search of a wedding/reception venue. We were graciously let in to the restaurant earlier than they opened by the manager and given an impromptu tour. The place is very elegant and the food was just delicious. Chicken is really hard to nail to perfection but Vintner Grill did it accompanied with two delicious sides. We were blown away by the food, both of our entrees and appetizers, and were pleasantly surprised with a discount on our bill for considering them as a venue. After discussing the food, venue, and great hospitality we received, we decided to book VG for our wedding and reception. I was given Leisha's contact information, who is in charge of the events there. She was incredibly easy to get in contact with, kind, and very prompt in all of her responses. Shortly after booking VG, my fiance learned that we have to move to Denver in just a couple of months without any prior notice therefore, forcing us to make different wedding arrangements. I am very disappointed that we will not have our wedding there because I know for a fact in my dealings with them that the wedding would have been flawless perfection from start to finish. I recommend this place to anybody for ANYTHING! Whether it just be a meal to an event, you will surely be satisfied with their amazing customer service skills, ambiance, and food selection. Thank you VG!

VFh8Ghi7taGHryI4fRwEZg.text: I tried the vegan piccata dish and it was LOVELY!!! They were pretty busy and the service was a little slow, bar was extremely backed up I guess, and they were out of an appetizer we wanted. I would definitely go back for that dish again and hope the service would be a little smoother.

fzvyMlJ4Hj70rGK5yFVVkg.text: I've been coming here for years. Unfortunately, the food has gotten progressively worse throughout the years. The honey-truffle chicken is one of my go-to's and in the past year it's been a hit-or-miss. I just had it twice in a month, both were sub-par. However, this was the last draw. So bad, I only ate my sides. Typically, it's beautifully broasted to a crisp. Quite amazing when it's spot on. I did let my server know, and he politely smiled.  We ordered dessert, which I enjoyed the sabonyon; it's a nice, light fruit dessert. The check was then brought and I realized I was still charged for the entree. I did eat the sides, so whatever. Surprisingly I never got an apology, the manager nor Chef came out, nothing. I guess being told their chicken was gross and inedible is par for course? Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sabonyon dessert, with champagne and fresh fruit

rcF4WnRRCNH6T6pPJPCqmA.text: Absolutely stuffy service. No guidance. No warmth. So disappointing.  No customer centric attitude at all from our server. Ambiance impeccably sophisticated. Food.delish!!

LrIkyMHrgzNGPDK32PCUMQ.text: I don't typically write negative reviews on restaurants but I was turned off by the service here. I've had better at Yardhouse.    My biggest issue was with our server who 1. When asked about the specials on the menu replied with "everything is good here, we're the best restaurant in Vegas. Do you need a minute? ".  He seemed to get frustrated when I asked him questions about the menu 2. When asked about the cocktails, looked at my business partner and said "wow I feel bad for you". And 3. Upon finishing dinner asked "are you guys on a first date?" All of these replies were either awkward or inappropriate.    The food was ok. The prosciutto flatbread was delicious but the sea bass was just ok in my opinion. It seemed to be overcooked and had a fishier taste than it normal.  Cocktails were good. I had the aviation. Definitely very boozy but yummy just the same.   If the service were better here, I'd consider rating this place a 3.5.

lLSMvZfqrDFwQyGk1Ue2Gw.text: Alright, I know most of you don't live in Vegas, but if you do, or visit, holy moly. If I still ate meat I would scarf everything on their menu except the nasty beet salad. (They're probably great if you like beets. I don't.) Vintner Grill ( vglasvegas.com ) has an amazing wine and cocktail list, holiday specialties, an amazing charcuterie selection of both meats and cheeses from soft to hard cured, Bread selection is awesome- "Anyone know where the bread guy is?" Seriously their selection they offer is everything from Tuscan olive bread, white cheddar/ bacon rolls, pretzel rolls, cranberry bacon "cigars", white chocolate, and then when you order cheese (you can order up to five), you get dried fruits (figs, apricots, cherries), giant crostini, and different compotes (so far apple/cinnamon and 2 others) depending on the cheeses. (Remember, we don't eat meat, but there is a whole list of meats you can add to the charcuterie plate.) Didn't get it last time, because we already knew we were going to be full, but their white bean hummus is DELICIOUS. I always get the vegan portabella mushroom piccata with spaghetti squash alla oglio. So far our friend has tried the salmon, sea bass, and beef tenderloin with fire roasted asparagus. All of their pasta is made in house too. Oh, and if you like butternut squash soup, go for it if they have it. YUMMY. (Never ate them, but I eyed the Diver Scallops at a table 2 over, and YEAH. Wow.) My FIL had the fire roasted crab cakes, and scarfed them like he'd never eaten, ever. For heaven's sake, they make their own truffle ricotta soft cheese. The staff is so accommodating, and will add things, switch things out if need be, bring extras. I LOVE this restaurant. This place is amazing. We roll out food preggers, and I heard at least 6 people say the same thing walking out. Yeah, I have good holidays. This is the 5th time we've been there and I would go back today.

dQAeBtaBT89LleTeGP9zJA.text: The west side is surprising competitive for upscale dining. Vintner has survived the test of time. A bit of a tricky location if it's your first time but once you find it, enjoy the cozy, intimate vibe with old movies and a never empty bar. Usually a game on the two bar TVs and solid wine selection by the glass/bottle. The food is upscale comfort... salads, pastas, flatbreads, chicken, steak, etc.   Service is friendly, ambience is good, food is tasty. Hard to complain much. Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

plmuoGNN5oQVXwTHdACSow.text: I haven't been to this location in a while and the last time I did may be my last time dining there. They were out of the best bread in the basket, the pretzel bread. We got the cheese and meat plate which is boring because they never switch it up and it's the same selection everytime. There are so many better cheeses out there, like every cheese from Napa and they switch it up every once and a while! The truffle ricotta and black truffle salami didn't have enough truffle essence and was subpar. I've tried many items from their menu, scallops, lamb rack, sea bass, lobster, filet mignon and they're not items that would keep me going back for. There's so many better options to dine at now, no need to go back here anymore.

rSPDpQvinNi9IneScocICw.text: What a spectacular restaurant.  This restaurant is surrounded by business offices so I would have never thought of going here until a business contact suggested that we go here for lunch.     After walking past their picturesque outdoor area, I walked into a beautiful restaurant.  It's a pricey restaurant but the food, service and ambiance was excellent!  I ordered the following:   - Treviso Caesar Salad Wrapped in Prosciutto ($10): excellent!!! the dressing was delicious and I love prosciutto!!!  the romaine lettuce was upper crispy.   - Crispy Free-Range Half Chicken ($22): Delicious!!! when they said Crispy, they are not kidding!!!  It came with mac n cheese and broccolini.  This dish was excellent!!   When I'm in Las Vegas again for work, I'm going to convince all my business contacts to go here for lunch and dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quail egg for my Caesar salad.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken, delicious!!!
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken lunch. heaven on a plate!

cbfNBv8X9yZcl2ZrfjQy3w.text: This place is located amongst a series of office buildings and it's tucked away. It's essentially a hidden gem in Vegas.  I had the Atlantic salmon. It was cooked to perfection. The wait staff was pleasant. The decor was chic and the ambiance was upbeat with a chill vibe.  I will be returning in the future .

JjDQgBvxfvjYi5WxkeZHjw.text: This is my new favorite restaurant. The food was spectacular! Every single small part of each dish has a purpose and lends to the final flavor of the dish. The cheeseboard was well thought out, being served with various dried fruit and sauces but my favorite, by far, is the apricot mustard. The flavor is out of this world and it elevates anything you put it on. I had the chicken, served with broccolini and macaroni and cheese. Everything was hot, perfectly seasoned, crispy and delicious. The portions were quite large and I left with enough for lunch the next day. The service was unmatched. It feels like everyone employed by Vintner Grill loves their job. The restaurant itself is elegant, clean and thoughtfully decorated.  I will definitely be returning and look forward to trying the many items on their menu.

z4ojGsbwILJ08P9-AE_I1w.text: I've never been in a restaurant where my slow waiter basically told me to wait and be patient ! In an unpleasant tone! What? Did I hear that right? I never believed I heard those words but all of us did! There are so many ways to tell your customers to wait in a polite manner but Reynaldo chose not too.! Rude! Unpleasant! Arrogant! You don't treat your customers that way. I watched this waiter served the other 2 tables near us perfectly. He filled the glasses of water when it's low, served bread and even served the desserts before us when in fact those people came in later than us. Are we getting discriminated? And not only that the waiters are slow, rude and unpleasant. The curtain besides us is really filthy too!   This place needs to train their staff well and change the curtains. The food is ok. Desserts are mediocre. I wanted to rate zero star!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filthy curtains!
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3GJlBjkSK03MEarVQxvvnQ.text: Amazing food, steak was Devine! Desert was even better! Service was amazing. We had a rather large group and they didn't miss a beat!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uBw7bUWuDr1sYFBKL4Cz6g.text: Always amazing. The pecorino casa di Bosco is one of the best cheeses I've had in Vegas. On the bar menu: the crab cake and the bruschetta are phenomenally fresh. On the dinner menu- everyone should try the lamb bolognese. I have to mention the truffle pecorino one more time. Even when I'm not super hungry, I can always count on shaved black truffles in a smooth pecorino atop fresh bread with fresh jam and a dried fruit to lift my mood. The service is excellent. Highest quality bar menu in Vegas by far. Plus it's actually a satisfying meal. It's not one of those overpriced wannabe-foodie-restaurant/bars, you will leave vintners satisfied
