ybLruqKK7JzNumyDg85jJg.text: This was my second time dining at the Vitner Grill. Our waiter was Jeffery who did an amazing job serving us. The food was amazing, however our party of four was rushed to vacate after 1 hour and 50 minutes by the manager due to another reservation arriving in 10 minutes. He hovered around the area talking to Jeffery before coming over to ask us how everything was (CODE FOR WE NEED THE TABLE LETS MOVE ON PEOPLE)  I will NEVER dine here again. We have eaten all over Las Vegas at other fine dining establishments that don't operate in this fashion. Should've gone to T-Bones!!!

hZuKM4Mye7xpruzq1A1XOA.text: Service could have been better, free bread was ok, not warm but the butter is soft enough,  we had the lobster ravioli , DELICIOUS,  I had the sea bass , very very very salty, so so , we had the upside down apple pie cake, i think it was , so so , overall good I quess , service for sure should have been better,  this Is a must try place,  but won't be going back anytime soon

ykJiWyMVnwLDPix6bGLKDw.text: Great place for lunch if you're in the area.  Came here for lunch and dessert and sat inside. I had salmon and salad. I also saved room for two desserts.   Customer service was outstanding. I'll be back.  Very beautifully decorated and I love the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside patio
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

bf5XJa-7CDlUDw8GwaWTVw.text: I come here with my family on special occasions and I like it because I notice that the staff treats my family really well, my grandpa has a hard time walking and we always have someone happy to help him. I like the variety of breads they serve before the meal, I usually get some type of seafood, last time I got crab cakes and sea bass which were very good and fresh.

d0OgDE5ur4qzDsqELiUKWQ.text: I had dinner on May 13th, Mother's Day. We were a table of 5 which was really meant for 4.( yes I had a reservation) I am taking off stars not because of the food or the small table. The food is usually good.  I can not tell you how many times the staff came through our pathway DRAGGING chairs and tables past us for late reservation. It was so distracting and loud it was all I could do to walk out!! Very unprofessional and disruptive. I made my reservation at least 4 weeks in advance, yet these diners were put above my family's Mother's Day. Shame on the management. They need to show more respect.

oID63e8ZVs_7So8bqGxWUA.text: 3rd night in town and someone recommended this place. Made reservations and once we got there i was promptly seated. This place is in a commercial buildings more like offices so it can be a little hard to find but once we saw the valet umbrella we knew it was right there lol. To start we got crab cakes, chessboard, and olgrilled octopus everything was very good. Main dish i got the chilean seabass it was delicious, it cane with veggies and dessert was ok because i dont remembered what i ordered lol. I had a couple of cocktails and service was also very friendly and helpful on recommendations for dishes.

kedDNBew5ZPc1C9D52aKqg.text: I'm not sure what took us so long to dine @VG but I'm sure glad we did! We went to VG friday night and what a hidden treat! We arrived and had a cocktail@ the comfortable bar,with a friendly staff.The wines by the glass are of the plenty and my partner had a cucumber gimletand he love it!! He could'nt stop talking about it! The room has a zen feeling to it and you sink into the surroundings! We started with a wonderful selection of cheeses,a goat cheese the chef whipped up that day,a Wis. blue and a firm sharp cheese WOW! Paul Ellis help us with wine to par up,Paul is a wiz when it comes to vino! The wine list is put together to cover everyones taste and pocket book. They have 50 under 50 as part of the list with alot of great surprises! The breads are are a dream, we had a green olive and bacon cranberry YEA!!! We had a beet salad w/ roasted hazelnuts,spinach and a yummy dressing,to be followed by a seared halibut and Alaskan King Crab rissotto! We ended on a sweet note with the house made cheese cake. The whole staff  makes you feel welcome and our night out was FABULOUS! Thank VG we can't wait to return! We'll see you all in August for our 5th Annv.!!!

llzloh_6LSZLmN9WCu521g.text: This place is awesome! So cozy and comfortable but still with an upscale touch.  40's style decor with black and white classic movies playing on a couple screens.  The patio is beautiful as well with a kind of mediterranean feel.  It's totally hidden in an office building which makes it an even better find! The food is awesome as well! If you like cheese they have a whole cheese list on the front! This place is so yummy! Their menu comes on a clipboard so they can change it often to what is fresh at the time. The calamari app is awesome with the curry dipping sauce! Yum! I had the steak before with asparagus and it was really good.  I've actually never had anything from there that wasn't fantastic.  I dont know who said the service wasn't good, because their service is excellent.  Always very professional and on top of things and knew their menu.  My water was never empty.  Definitely a great place for great food, conversation, or a first date bc the atmosphere is so comfortable! No complaints!

UlbbMW3SGh4EhiyZZkezaw.text: had a great time food was excellent.  had prices that were affordable, its a great place to go relax after a long day at the office or to take your better half out for a nice evening.  also them having gaming made it all the better!

ne-ddq91lyeDp99tN-eDgA.text: We have been there a number of times and the food has been consistently good. My wife loves the calamari. The wait staff is responsive and very professional. They employ a valet service with has very friendly staff. We went last night and had a VERY BAD EXPERIENCE. We ordered martini's which were made with a citron vodka rather than what we ordered. One of the wait staff came by and asked if we needed the drinks remade, which we did. We waited for awhile and I walked up to the bar to see what the problem was. The bartender exhibited a VERY bad attitude. She was busy cleaning something and I seemed to be a distraction. She could not have made a mistake we had to be wrong. The waiter was apologetic but seemed incompetent and failed to follow up to be sure we got our drinks. We spoke with the manager who came across like a total idiot. He just nodded and did not respond.  All that was necessary was for someone to quickly re make our drinks and not to have me make the trip to the bar. Even after I made the trip it would have been Ok if the bartender had just apologized and taken care of it. The customer may not always be right but they are still the customer. I have vowed not to return and let all my friends and acquaintances know just how bad the service was.

WTt0kt1FtAV0gTyD0ZtJWA.text: very romantic, had the lamb for the entree wch was cooked  and served to perfection, and accentuated by the fresh mint it came with, my fave was the crab ravioli wch i got as an appetizer, (seafood is my nirvana). tonight my date chose the tenderloin wch i almost got (he chose medium well, yuch i think he just ruined his steak, oh well) replete with asparagus and a side of potatoes. we were both too full for desert after sharing everything.  if you're on the west side in summerlin and are able to make reservations, check out this establishment. it's fine dining (slightly less than strip prices, but worth it), great table service, and romantic from my vantage point! p.s. you can also eat outdoors under the night sky a REAL sky not forum shops fake sky, it's absolutely breathtaking and maaarvelous!!!

E6AUk9t3H7YQctXqldgzHw.text: We have been driving through this area and found Vintner Grill on Yelp. We were very pleased with what we found. The restaurant is a little off the road, but it was so worth looking for! It was so romantic! We were seated on the bench with nice decorative pillows and in front of big flat screen TVs. We  watched romantic old movies while dining. We shared a wonderful bottle of chardonnay, and then were presented with a scrumptious bread selection. I always judge the restaurant by its bread. This bread bucket was out of this world - olive bread, white chocolate bread, cranberry pecan bread. So flavourful, so fresh, so delicious! Excellent! Then we ordered a Caesar salad for sharing, and they split it for us and served it on two plates elegantly presented. Then we had fresh fish for main course and it was excellent. Superb. We ended our meal with maple creme brulee - I never tasted a cream brulee that tasted this good.  This restaurant is one of the very best restaurants in Las Vegas area and I bet in the whole state of Nevada. Kudos, Vintner Grill! You made our night very special. We highly recommend.

m4nieaykCIY-NBHRceULBA.text: It's a Sunday night, and my parents are in town to visit. My brother had suggested this restaurant since my mom really likes seafood. I honestly never heard of this restaurant even though it was on Food Network or something like that. The restaurant is hidden in some business center, but usually the good restauants are a bit hidden. Once we got inside, we were seated right away. The decor is nice and mellow which is my kind of place. We started off with the spicy chicken flat bread. It wasn't bad but it wasn't amazing. The calamari had a nice mustard sauce that wasn't over powering. The crab cakes were just ok.   Though my mom likes seafood, she decided to order the roasted half chicken. She described the chicken as having an amazing crust. It was very crispy while the meat was still juicy. I had ordered the halibut with spinch and cous cous. Like the chicken, the fish had a very nice crust while still maintaining its tenderness. The only downside is that the cous cous out shined the main dish. It had the perfect amount of seasoning and softness. The tomato halves added a sweetness and slight tart to the cous cous. You have to eat the halibut with the cous cous for the additional flavor, but the cous cous could be eaten alone. In fact, I ate all the cous cous and left my half of the fish. All in all, the restaurant wasn't bad. Nothing Truely wowed me, but I can't say anything bad.

3MSGIHthcO2O8-xNbRooeQ.text: Alas, if it weren't so far out of the way for me and if it weren't so pricey, Vintner Grill would be one of my favorite place in Las Vegas to go to. That being said, I prefer Lotus of Siam's wine list, as well as Himalayan Cuisine's superb beer selection, but Vintner Grill does have some great beers and wines as well. The food is always consistently good and I tend to stick with the mesquite grill selections such as the colorado rack of lamb. Much better than most casino joints though, and usually worth the drive up to Summerlin.

nEeeBWRmkl69dB2LQm6c1w.text: The first time I went for dinner was just okay.  I love the decor and the staff seemed very attentive.  I had ordered the Calamari as an appetizer which I felt was bland.  However, we also ordered crab-cakes as an appetizer which were great.  My entree was the lobster cannoli which was too rich for my taste.  But my boyfriend ordered something like a fillet steak with mashed potatoes and asparagus and it was delicious.  I prefer lunch for the lesser price and great patio dining.  But like everything in Las Vegas this seems not so pricey.  Our dinner w/ 2 glasses of wine was around $180.  And the lunch with my friend was around $75.

6ZAF0naziEZbn_nk4ykhkg.text: Saw this restaurant reviewed by Rachael Ray on one of her tasty travel shows and decided to check it out for dinner. The decor on the show looked amazing, and it did not disappoint in person. Really beautiful interior as well as patio. That is what the 3 stars are for..everything else was a big disappointment. We asked to be seated outside, and the hostess led us to a table that was completely in the dark..no candle, no nothing...I don't normally pay $25 for an entree that I can't even see. We asked to be moved to a different table and waited a few minutes while they set it up. Little bit better, but still needed a flashlight in order to read the menu. My husband and I shared a 3 cheese plate & Moroccan spare ribs to start...both were just average..nothing special. While we were still eating the cheese plate, the food runner brought out our main courses..seriously?? We had them sent back to the kitchen, but then started to worry that they would just be sitting under a heat lamp, so we asked that they be brought out again. Our server did let us know that the entrees were being remade, and that did appear to be True when they were eventually brought back out again.  That helped the situation a bit, but no apologies were ever made about the terrible timing. My husband had the scallops with risotto and I had the crab ravioli...we both enjoyed the scallops, but the crab ravioli was very average...what was really irritating about this dish was that it was featured on the Rachael Ray show and it had crab meat on top as well as inside the ravioli...not on mine, however. Ugh. If you are going to feature a dish, shouldn't you try to make it the same every time, not just when it's shown on tv?? All in all, decor is fabulous, food ok, and service terrible. I would maybe go here again for a drink, but that's about it.

5NqPqTx5TpswqghBsjGWgQ.text: Atmosphere is fantastic, dinner was exquisite and Jeff was the best!

WY6h_OeLKoVfOK7viIiQZA.text: Vitner Grill is one of my favorite off-strip restaurants. It's classy decor, beautiful outside patio, service and quality of food is amazing.   I love when the staff comes by with the tray of bread and I get to pick my favorites: brioche, pretzel bread and white chocolate bread. The butter tray with the oil in it is delicious... I always look forward to the bread.   I always order the calamari, the dipping sauce is so yummy!   And I always used to order the Halibut with couscous, but when I went recently I was sad to see that the halibut now comes with leeks and muscles. Not really my cup of tea... I really miss the cous cous recipe with the lemon spinach orzo, so I hope they will consider bringing that back!   However, I did order the turkey burger with avocado, cheese and bacon... It was so delicious! Something I normally wouldn't order, but it was so yummy. I skipped the bun, though because it seemed a little big.   For dessert, their tiramisu is my favorite. It's big enough to share, and when I was pregnant I would kill the whole thing on my own.   Whenever my friends or family is in town and I want to impress them, I bring them here!

Iimy3ewsZkLKQ9NEsQ9e5g.text: I've given this place a try on 3 different occasions since it seems to get such great reviews.  The first time  I went, I ordered the tenderloin, medium cooked.  They overcooked the steak the first shot, so I sent it back.  The second shot was WAY undercooked, but I didn't send it back again.  The second time I went for lunch, I ordered the steak sandwich.  I ordered it medium, yet once again it was undercooked.  I didn't send it back because the people I was with kept on telling me how good a restaurant it was, and so I didn't send it back because I didn't want them to look bad..  So instead, I choked down my undercooked steak sandwich.  This last time I ordered the scallops.  They did not taste fresh at all.  Over $30 for 3 fishy tasting scallops????  This place has a stuffy atmosphere and horrible food.  I will never go back.

2ew_9USui9az3YduiJEmpg.text: This restaurant has great service and a nice ambiance. They always take great cars of me here. The bouillabaisse is wonderful and every cut of meat I've had has been cooked to perfection. I also recommend sitting outside weather permitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5nQNRhQtD-eR73ey17PpsA.text: Ate here recently and wasn't disappointed!  Food and service were both great.   I highly recommend the beet salad. It's fresh and delicious. If you visit during the fall I recommend the butternut squash soup which is perfect! I think it's a seasonal soup so be sure to try it if you go in the fall or winter time.  The sea bass is my favorite dish I have tried there! I would go back just for that dish!  Flat breads are also good! They are like a pizza and would make a great meal if paired with a salad.  Delicious food and friendly staff. I highly recommend this restaurant! :)

MlaBIcF7cx13KfqjT0FnTg.text: This tucked away local fine dining spot was a pleasant delight when a friend invited me for dinner. It has a secret feel because it is a bit difficult to find, but just go into the corner on the left in the parking lot and you will see it. Such an unusual gem to see in Summerlin; there were checkered floors and an old movie playing from a projector. Definitely a chic atmosphere and a variety of meals (basic starters, wood-fired flatbreads, pasta&risotto, entrees, prime wood-grill).    Food was delicious, but more importantly: they claim to have one of the largest selections of cheeses in Las Vegas. Along with hand-selected and house cured meats. Need I say more? *wiping drool off* Since it's not "acceptable" to bathe in a tub of cheese, this might be the next best thing. Order a bunch of fancy smelly cheese that will make you feel like you're in France. Since I was with a party of people I tried an assortment of dishes, all being flavorful.   The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because the service was slow and they took a long time to accommodate extra people that joined, despite it being a quick and easy fix.    Good news for those farther from Summerlin, they opened one on the Strip! They are also open for lunch.

P3ChiAEYPSlJqSgiK_DmKg.text: Been here twice for a company dinner.  First time calling to make reervations. whoever answered the phone was so cold with her greetings!  Answering with 'nope' and perky 'yes'!  For a customer service town, I do not find that acceptable! At least find it in your voice that you are eager to be working at a fine dining restaurant.  I will try calling this place again to see if maybe it was just that person that answered the phone.  I was really disappointed as I be been bragging about this restaurant to my family,  but I will try to call again, if not, sayonara!

jwuxH1w_M47FOS5j5JB_9A.text: You really can't say anything bad about Vintner Grill.  We've been going there for over 10 years.  It's one of the birthday or anniversary spots in the rotation.  Food and service are always on point.  There are some newer places in Summerlin that are as good, if not better now and are definitely more reasonable than Vintner Grill.     So I think Vintner needs to step it up some and come strong with some new menu items.  The menu has been pretty consistent since we've been going there for many years.   A change of pace and cost that is more in line with some of the other fine dining establishments in Summerlin would serve them well.  Notice that the review is still 5 stars though, because it is a fine restaurant and there is something to be said about consistency.  I would just like to see them take some chances and spruce up the menu some.

9iVgmGkpxweGSe6O9IxZag.text: Vintner Grill is hit or miss. If you want to go to a chic date night place with your lady or gent, then this is a nice option in Summerlin. If you want to play some video poker, get some appetizers and drink some premium liquor, then you may or may not like Vintner. Depending on who is working at the bar, they can comp decent drinks every 20-30 minutes, no matter if you are playing with $100 or $20. The food is decent, but portion sizes could be better for the price. I'll still keep coming back for the atmosphere.

EmfFFxwf9B_uHqA0RQuplQ.text: I came here a long time ago when the place first opened.  It was super crowded, they didn't have it together, and we avoided it ever since.  We finally decided to give it another try.  We didn't have reservations, which apparently are necessary.  But they do have bar tables which are first come, first served.  So that worked out well.  Service was horrendously slow.  This had a lot to do with the fact that the bar area was serviced by cocktail servers in tiny black dresses and impossible high heels.  These poor women could only move in tiny little steps.  I was seriously concerned for their safety.  Also, there were some single diners, who seemed to be regulars, who were getting a lot more attention.  We never got bread service, which kind of sucked.  Everyone else in the bar seemed to. The bussers took our bread plates away after the first course anyway. The servers and bussers seemed frazzled for some reason. Finally, the bar was slow as hell and just strange.  We ordered two glasses of wine.  We saw them getting poured into tiny carafes.  Then they sat on the bar for a few minutes.  Then one of the carafes got poured out into the sink.  Another carafe was filled.  Then the carafes sat on the bar again for a minute or two. Then finally the whole carafes were poured into glasses and served to us.  Huh? Our second glasses of wine did not go through this process.  So I don't know what the hell was going on.  And the bartenders need to realize that they aren't invisible.  Stop screwing around. Especially when we want our damn drinks. If they were trying to get the wine to breathe, that ain't gonna do it.    Food was hit or miss.  The highlights were the vegetable chopped salad and the black truffle salami on the carne menu.  The vegetable chopped salad was really unique with lots of tasty vegetables and a nice parmesan cheese.  The black truffle salami was so creamy and truffley.  Gotta track that sucker down at Whole Foods!  We also tried proscuitto and another salami which were just ok.  But it is nice that they offer a make-your-own characuterie plate option.  They offered a variety of cheeses, too.  The risotto was meh.  Not very flavorful.  And the lamb terrine was searing hot so it took a while to even be edible.  Once it cooled down, it was ok.  Nothing great.  The north side of the bar had video poker machines, which I don't recall seeing on my first visit here.  No one was playing and, from what I observed, the machines just annoyed the people who wanted to eat and drink.  Video poker kind of makes sense given that this is owned by the same group as the Roadrunner taverns.  It kind of ruins the ambience, though.  Then again, most of the furniture and decorations seems IKEAish to me.  Something I could try again, maybe with a reservation and servers wearing proper footwear, but I won't be chomping at the bit to come here either.

Qts0aEhd8LTS19Ni57Gy0A.text: This place is awesome. The calamari is Sooooo good along with the sauce they serve it with. The warm assorted bread !!!  We also ate a chicken curry salad !!! Super tasty!!! The Bell pepper soup is just a right touch of spicy and tasty !!!!The service  is amazing ! Atmosphere is chic modern!!! Please stop by and give this place a taste!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Po39cJMuX5r8H7Cscto0dQ.text: Was meeting a friend and he suggested Vintners. Upon arriving I was a bit thrown off by it being located in a business park but was completely surprised by the atmosphere and decor of the place. The restaurant is so chic and and upscale that you forget you are literally in a business park.   We were given the specials of the night but apparently the "specials" have always been there lol. not sure why its even a special at all if has been. We started off with clams and crab cakes, The clams came with a beautiful broth that paired amazingly well with the clams. Then we had the halibut with couscous and seabass with vegetables. Both entrees... delicious :) The fish were beautifully cooked. The portions were just the right amount leaving us with enough to take home. but the best part of the night. The Dessert! Had the panna cotta.... wow! just melts in your mouth so good.  I would definitely come back here and bring my boyfriend as i can see this becoming a date night for us :)

-dXeL5UN7RWEURYQc8OnrA.text: Been waiting to try this place... Finally had dinner there tonight and it was everything and more from what I expected. We had the duck flatbread and white bean hummus to start, both amazing and good portions. We had a few bites of each and boxed the rest up so we could enjoy our meals. I had the halibut and my husband had the lamb bolognese. Once again, both amazing and good portions, boxed our leftovers so we could squeeze desert in. We had the lemon cheese cake. AMAZING. We def went over board on ordering bc we couldn't make any decisions and we thought the portions were going to be small, but they weren't. I think the pricing is reasonable for what you get and the atmosphere. Which by the way is beautiful! I want to go back and try their lunch. Oh and our servers name was Stephen, he was great and helped us make some decisions.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cheese cake
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb bolognese
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut

rM7ut94RNdUFCZ3nz3xDdw.text: This place is nice and the food is good, especially the chicken dish (I forgot the name of it). There are two things that I want to mention. 1st is the menu design, it looks like an essay, I was like @_@. The 2nd is the size of the salad because it is the size for the individual not family size and the price is $13, I would say it is a little expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1BqfqrQuPKzuhIAHYdA9Bw.text: Oh Hannah M... Lord knows everyone respects the opinion of someone who thinks choker necklaces are still in style and whose 5 star reviews include nail salons and a lip botox injection. But alas, those of us who appreciate the culinary arts can dine at Vintner with confidence that the right decision was made. This was my girlfriend and I's first visit, though I've been looking forward to it for a while as anyone I know who appreciates food has raved about it- and for all the right reasons.  Location is admittedly strange, but once you're inside, you'd have no idea the restaurant is in an office park. My girlfriend ordered the Truth Serum cocktail which I'm looking forward to *attempting* to recreate. The bread, meat, and cheese plate was possibly my favorite part of the meal. If anything, I'll come back just for that. We had the calamari as an appetizer. Good, not great. My girlfriend ordered the Crab Ravioli and I the Veal Capellini, both of which were excellent. We both also thoroughly enjoyed our desserts.   I've seen a few people complain about service here which comes off a little.... pretentious. If you want to be waited on hand and foot and treated like a snoody tourist, then go have dinner on the strip. But if you want to be treated like a local and gather a sense of belonging to the Summerlin community, go to Vintner and treat your wait staff with the same friendly attitude that you would your neighbor. If you don't get that same down to earth, familiar attitude back, then leave your 'vindicating' 1 star review and don't return. The rest of us will enjoy it.

7hVyECdSp1Ksb_BNSCnDcg.text: I had not been here since 07 and it was fabulous then and still is. I cannot wait for summer so we can enjoy the beautiful patio seating.    Food was delicious and perfect portion size.  We had crab cakes to start... light and tasty. Row 11 pinot nior smooth and flavorful. The salmon melted in my mouth.  It was a busy night and service was good.   Seating was cozy and personal perfect for our first date

matYGhQqwCpNjxOyGXkpJg.text: I love this restaurant.  Love the atmosphere and the food.  My only complaint is they use bleach to clean, and I can always smell it when I arrive.

Z4iwewGjfRlbZKYpuM8Pjg.text: Great meal and great service. Everything about the evening was lovely, food was delicious and the wine selection was extensive. We had a lovely time and Irvin took great care of us! Would love to come back!

Hj1mZJ6eL8r4KytcMocshg.text: Well, I always like to go for lunch at Vintner's Grill.  And up until now I haven't had any complaints in the years we have been going there.  Today, my lunch arrived with a side of cole slaw that looked and tasted like it had been made at least 4 or 5 days ago.  I mentioned  this to the waiter who said he would tell the chef.   Well, the waiter went in and out of the kitchen at least four times until we were finished with the rest of our meal.  When he took our entree plates away, I asked him what the chef had said.  He said that the chef had told him they had used the cole slaw that they  "had left".    I was never offer a different side dish, and needless to say there was no accommodation on the bill.   I am really disappointed in the kitchen for serving this terrible ( and I hope not tainted) side dish.  I am also disappointed in the management for not training their wait staff to be better at handling problems.  If you can't trust the food...I see no reason for going back

5ewcdFBpFWAteFsV3-kBWw.text: My wife and I made reservation for our 3 years wedding anniversary and no regrets they sure made my wedding anniversary special. As soon as we sat down, they sent us champagne to congrat us . It made our night together extra special .  Thank you VG for your great food, beautiful restaurant, and amazing staff and managers.   Thank you Gabriel and Edgar.

GAfu3WjDA5a2Y2Q0Pz0nmQ.text: First time here, went on a Thursday and enjoyed live music with dinner/drinks. We opted for the Som Favorite wine flight with 3 selection charcuterie - server picked our second cheese and it was the best of the night! For entrees, the crab ravioli and scallops were some of the best I've ever had. Truly, the ambiance, service and quality of food sets this place apart. I can't wait to return for lunch and see the patio outside!!

Ne9ZoPIklaSbuB4VN9spCA.text: Vintner is one of those restaurants that I wish I could give extra stars. My husband and I had an excellent dinner here for our anniversary.   We had no problem getting a table with a 6:00 reservation. We started with drinks, a blackberry mix drink for my husband and a flight of wine for me. I liked that I was able to get a flight of wine that had two whites and two reds for variety. Then the bread basket arrived and I wished I had room to try everything. The green olive bread was my favorite of the two I did try.  The cheese selection is very impressive so we had to get a cheese board. Since my husband is a picky eater we just went with asiago, smoked cheddar, and chorizo as our options. Wow, far from boring. Everything was delicious and they serve some other fun items with the cheeses that were really good. This is the point at which my husband declared Vintner a winner and said we didn't need anything else.  It only got better when the entrees arrived. Both of our meals were out of this world. I had the crab ravioli which had great flavor and the portion was perfect. My husband had the scallops with corn risotto. The whole dish was bursting with amazing flavors. Everything was cooked to perfection.   At this point we knew we had to have dessert. So, we wrapped up with the lemon meyer cheesecake. I'm not usually a cheesecake fan, but the lemon gave the cheesecake a nice flavor. The berry topping and whipped cream were delicious as well.  We have already decided that we need to make the trip across town for this restaurant again. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab ravioli.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese plate with asiago, smoked cheddar and chorizo. Also includes apricot mustard and raspberry jam.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon cheesecake.

4oPUVMYv_CktmBW4_hAwPQ.text: My Aunt, Cousin and I just returned from Vintner Grill and I wanted to review this while everything was still fresh in my memory! Such a wonderful lunch to celebrate our birthdays! The decor and the food are fantastic! We started out with champagne cocktails which perfectly set the tone for our meal. We ordered the calamari which was very light in breading which we really enjoyed- so much so that we ordered another! It came with a deliciously lemony curry aioli. Auntie had the crab cake and salad, Cousin had the jumbo lump crab ravioli and I ordered the lamb bolognese tagliatelle. We were all very pleased with our entrees! I think the most surprising aspect of this restaurant is the price point.  For such a beautiful and highly acclaimed restaurant the entrees were extremely reasonable.  Half orders were not skimpy and I think most of the prices were around $12-16.  They also offered a Power Lunch prix fix option for $25. Great job Vintner Grill- we can't wait to go back!

kgll8uigCzZa2KawVv1FFQ.text: Always an amazing meal the staff is kind courteous and knowledgeable and treat you like family I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting or local to Vegas. They were kind enough to deal with my dietary restrictions due to my recent surgery took everything in stride. They also gave us one of the best recommendations of small vintage ones that we've ever had.

6ov3KW2LgZI692NwlduTDg.text: Another great Summerlin restaurant! Fantastic ambience, food and service. Very nice area.

M-tUiI1Pvz2aq_JujLEoDg.text: This place is definitely a gem in Las Vegas. I went with my boss and work crew for dinner one fine May evening. The service was lovely and although my boss is a regular there, I really do believe the service would be excellent all the time. The assortment of breads was lovely while we sipped our wine and I loved the unique options on the menu. I had scallops and corn risotto and my mouth waters just remembering it. The presentation was clean and the dish was memorably flavorful.   What I loved and hope to take advantage of next time is the outdoor cabanas. There are wonderful areas to enjoy happy hour with friends or evening drinks when it's nice out. While we sat inside, the ambiance is still nice with low lighting, but a nice atmosphere, not stuffy, that still makes you feel like you can enjoy yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ok, I&#39;m salivating just thinking about this again. Scallops on a corn risotto. Delicious!

9c6CfnqHGoSSOzGojo5ksQ.text: Slow at writing this review. We tried this place in February for an anniversary. Loved the vibe here, Great Gatsby meets Miami, love it. How can you not like old Black and White movies on the wall? Our waiter was awesome, the food incredible (halibut and lamb dishes) and the anniversary dessert...yummo!!! Romance is definitely the star at this place. Going back for Christmas Eve.

UhrvHBln0ReMMtGz4noXIA.text: This place is amazing but...for me this has been a place I repeatedly refer friends from out of town and my wife and I hold in high regard...but tonight we were let down by the service and service only.  This is a 5 star restaurant, do not mistake that. I am certain that your will have a great experience.  The truffle ricotta is awesome and not to be passed.  I enjoy this place...it is one of the, if not the best place in Vegas for outdoor/patio dining...but after a 20 min wait for any contact and I had to get up to ask for a cocktail and delays throughout the night (including paying the check). We brought a special friend from out of town and the delays were great as we got to talk but when at a very high end place I am walking through the front door to pay my check...this is kinda silly.  But don't let me steer you wrong.  The wine list is awesome...down to the splits, the cheese list is fantastic both in depth and breadth....but we were met with, "I got stuck behind a big party" and we were assured that it would not be a problem from the begging but was not the case...overall, awesome food, one of the best in town that let us down...please don't let this be a trend.

XXvw4AzvnQCvKLD6K3DkWA.text: One of my absolute favorite spots in town! My fiance' & I had our first date there! We enjoyed the degustation menu o. Valentine's Day and it was superb. Our server, Michale I believe, went way above and beyond for us. (I was on chemo and started feeling unwell so he got everything boxed up including dessert and even helped my fiance get me to the car!) We love this place!

SHWb_CJCDxqT4Cbv1w1FHA.text: First off, i will say that it is a beautiful restaurant. That being said, i was very disappointed after all the shining reviews. We spent roughly  $100 a plate, and my Salmon was dry, the Treviso salad was flavorless, with the exception of being bitter...I was very saddened being that i was excited about coming for a week.

1Ne12k78GXCtTBbjf1CLsw.text: I went here last night with a huge group of girlfriends to celebrate some birthdays.    We made reservations because we did have a large party and upon everyones arrival, we were seated immediately.    The service was excellent!  Our server Johnathan, was very attentive.  Constantly checking on us, refilling wine and water without being asked and clearing plates as they emptied, without being overbearing.  And he was a great sport about taking pictures for us too!  The food:  We ordered a number of dishes and had it served family style so we could all try a little of everything.  Appetizers - We probably could have done without some of the salads we ordered, one of the salads didn't seem dressed.  The Calamari was good but the 4 cheese flat bread (with the goat cheese) was extremely overwhelming.    Main Dishes - DELICIOUS!  The steak was perfectly cook and the sides were spot on.  We also ordered 2 fish dishes that were excellent!  The Halibut was by far my favorite.  The only disappoint was the crab ravioli.  And I felt that the pasta with the lamb was mediocre.  Dessert - CREME BRULE YUM!  and the Shell on the Chocolate Tart was absolute PERFECTION!  The Strawberry Shortcake was not good.   The other 2 desserts disappeared so quickly, I never got to try them, which means they must have been delicious.  Overall, it was a great experience.

JNJooEPEdtm8PEUd9OihEg.text: Kept hearing about it, I was impressed.  The service is great and so is the food.  Upscale, I wouldn't wear shorts or a hat.

UaVDFXgE7NphxNvZU4pWwA.text: We celebrated our Dad's birthday there this past weekend.  The food and cocktails were fantastic, and our server, Jeff, was wonderful!  His professionalism, humor and attention to detail were second to none.

UquGS6o6f4tvFrmbP-72Mw.text: The original wine and dine in Summerlin.   This upscale restaurant is the perfect place to close the million dollar deal or a great date night. Is not out of place to see lambos in the valet area.   The menu is updated and seasonal. My favorite was the Chilean bass, and I am not a fish guy! So that says a lot.   The tables are white linen and the lighting is soft.   They have beautiful outdoor eating area ass well.

6JggwES7HkIbbY71ptLEQQ.text: Outstanding Florida-like decor, service and food. Tops!! We love the crab cakes, lamb bolognese, bouillabaisse with soooo much seafood and a nice ending of apple cake.

EEmAh8LSdEA2cEAm3ECv7Q.text: Ok holy moly!! The food here is on another level!  I was blown away. Started with the Bastille drink which if you like whiskey ORDER IT! As a starter had a selection of cheeses and prosciutto. The lavender sheeps milk was my fav! Also did the grilled octopus  FLAVORGASM! For my main I did the seafood risotto. Ok the scallops literally made me weak in the knees. The texture of the risotto was prefect! So creamy and scrumptious. Yes I got dessert! I mean it would be rude not to. Did the blueberry cobbler. Wasn't over the moon as I thought I had a bit too many blueberries but the cobbler itself could send me to cloud 9. All in all this place is ACE! My only reason why I didn't give it five stars is trying to find the location is definitely a bit of a challenge. Food wise

sIeQKWTgoSV2OsHLgWP11g.text: I can't say enough great things about Vintner Grill. Every time I dine there it is spectacular.   This weekend, I had my wedding there. I could not have asked for more. It was a Saturday lunch time ceremony. We did it all there, it was perfect. Everyone was very impressed!  One of my friends that was there claims the she "has to have her 50th birthday party at Vintner Grill". The rest can't wait to go back.

enoMz3yNYSWFNT2OHJIiLg.text: I was so looking forward to coming here after a 3 year hiatus. (No fault of theirs, I moved across town) however, I can't even tell you if the food was still as good as it was when this was my favorite restaurant. We were ignored by the hostess for 5 minutes after waking in, even though the manager had time to greet his friends but not assist his hostess. When we were seated, we waited another 6 minutes (I know precisely because I was already irritated with waiting and started my stopwatch on my phone bc I was curious how this was going to go). Finally a busser brought menus, 3 more minutes and the server change over and asked if we wanted water. Not drinks, water. At this point we were not sure if we even wanted to stay, it was that long between contact with our server and his return. It was a little busy, but he managed to attend tables on both sides of us and still walk by us without a word. When the busser tried to bring us bottled water when we had asked for tap, we sent it back and another 5 minutes elapsed as we waited for someone to come, rectify the situation or even acknowledge our existence. Finally fed up, we simply walked out. The hostess wished us a good night as though she had no idea that she had just seated us 15 minutes before. I was thoroughly disappointed. I brought my fiance thinking we might come here for our reception. Turned out that the service wasnt good enough for dinner, much less good enough for our wedding day. Such a shame.

ZUJrEt7NxO6eKCrvidPf1w.text: Here for a work lunch, I was excited to finally get a chance to try Vintner Grill.  We arrived before the lunch crowd and were seated quickly. The restaurant is adorable and I enjoyed the table settings quite a bit. We started with bread service and everyone recommended the pretzel bread but I can never turn down olive bread so I went with that.   I ordered the lunch portion of halibut and it was delicious. Superbly cooked and I could have easily devoured the full portion if I had ordered it.   While I had attempted to eat relatively healthy for lunch, we decided to splurge for dessert and I couldn't say no trying all the options we ordered. We ordered the Turkish coffee cheesecake with pistachio gelato and honey, lemon & raspberry panna cotta and banana strudel. The cheesecake and panna cotta were the stars of the show. They were both so delicious and silky, I had to try my best to resist taking too many samples.   Our lunch was great and the service lived up to our expectations as well. I look forward to coming back again soon for lunch and possibly to try their dinner options as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry and lemon panna cotta, banana strudel and Turkish coffee cheesecake with pistachio gelato and honey.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut with couscous and orzo

Zc2f8S3K1-MUJoTbnZhHwA.text: Food was great, service was great, but definitely a very high end, high price, tiny portions establishment!  Came here for lunch one day and ordered a whole bunch of stuff since we were starving! We ordered the crab cake, lettuce wrap and the tomato heirloom salad for appetizers. All 3 were delicious, made with fresh ingredients and beautifully presented. For our entrees, we got the Lamb Bolganese and the goat cheese flatbread. The flat bread was just ok, but the Lamb Bolganese was absolutely delicious! The lamb was seasoned well, and cooked just right. For dessert, we got the apple upsidedown cake which was ok, and the house made pistachio gelato.   Service was very attentive, and to be expected at such a high end restaurant. The whole restaurant feels very clean but contemporary. Bathrooms are very clean and nice. Parking is super easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio gelato
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple upside down cake
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatbread

Qd25Rlns9a34Wfs164x5Ug.text: We were about to go to our fave standby Soho Japanese, but decided to branch out since we were in Summerlin. Upon arriving at the door of VG, we were immediately overcome with a distinct air of Country Club Douchiness. We almost turned around but decided to keep an open mind...and so glad we did! Sat at the bar and Ryan was our server/bartender. He informed us that he could make any cocktail and on top of that make any cocktail we wanted but better. He was not kidding. This guy was a master mixologist! So happy we didn't have to go Downtown or to the Strip  (and pay ridic prices) to have these kind of amazing cocktails.  Prices were reasonable ($13-ish for drinks,) considering the high quality of food and drink. I mean, we also love the cocktails at Jaleo but $20 for a drink is just absurd. We also had a charcuterie and chesse plate ($21) as well as a top notch aged NY strip which Ryan had split for us ($40.)  It's a shame that as non-Red Rock Country Club types we don't feel totally comfortable here. However, considering the ultra high caliber of food and drink, we'll be back. Sitting at the bar is definitely the way to go to enjoy Ryan's spectacular mixology and bypass the crowd and stuffy vibe. This place really deserves 5 stars for food/drinks/service,  but we took one star off for douchiness.

a_uePLVUUZHmhJlCXgRfOA.text: I decided to write a review on this place since I haven't written one in a while. We came here on a Sunday night and had a 5:30 dinner reservation. The front hostess seemed a bit snooty who looked like she doesn't really like her job. Anyways, I must say the decor in this place is quite nice! Old Hollywood classic decor... I felt like I was at a restaurant somewhere in Palm Springs. We ended up ordering crab cakes and the beet salad for appetizers. For the main course, I had the beef medallions with basmati rice, peas, & mushroom sauce. Everything was very delicious and would definitely come back.

Ydq18MlINaoJoXQMeM-7Bg.text: Good local restaurant that I was recommended by Red Rock valet guy.

DIXR_n-uoVdCjtpJl7iCLA.text: Beautiful atmosphere. Great access. Food is great and consistent. A locals favorite.

i5r3JUibwtTM44k6zz6vQQ.text: Not impressed.  I went to the Vinter Grill with my girlfriend and her family.  We called ahead to tell them we had two dinners that were vegan (me and my girlfriend), and they said they would accommodate us.  When we got there I asked the host to confirm the chef knew we were vegan.  He looked at me like he had no idea what I was talking about and told me to tell the waitress myself.  When I did tell the waitress she looked at me like she had never heard of the word vegan and said she didn't know what that meant.  Great.  So, I explained it to her and she said she would ask the kitchen.  Long story short the chef took some pizza dough and some noodles and made a marinara sauce with some veggies, put half on the pizza and half on the noodles and gave it to us.  So little care and thought from a place so highly rated.  I will not go back.

fJOfYWNOe8vzHt9tR-p41A.text: Four and a half stars.  I have a GF who lives in Vegas and she suggested we meet at Vintner Grill for dinner.  It's about 20 minutes from the Strip and I probably wouldn't have stumbled across it if it was not for her.  The restaurant's in an office building.  Sort of strange but nothing too out of the ordinary.  The inside is beautiful.  The decor is modern, decorated in whites, greens and blacks.    We were a party of six and sat at a round table.  We shared an order of hummus, a meat and cheese plate and crab cakes as appetizers.  They were all pretty good, though I still think the best crab cakes are at Mastro's in Beverly Hills.  For my entree, I had grilled sea scallops and a bed of corn risotto topped with shaved white truffles.  The scallops and risotto were delicious, though I must admit that truffles are lost on me.  They're very expensive and for the life of me, I can't taste why.  I also stole a couple bites of my BF's new york steak, which was flavorful and perfectly cooked.    The service was wonderful.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  He was knowledgeable about the menu and answered every question.    After a less than memorable dinner at Bouchon the night before, we were very pleasantly surprised by our meal at Vintner Grill.  I'll definitely go there again the next time we're in town.

NOJItg_rdkvbQ1w901gxuQ.text: Atmosphere is really nice.  Video poker machines in a place like this?  Food is OK.  People throwing mega stars here is just wrong.  It's a good place.  It is more of a convenient place for locals than a destination.  Nothing wrong with it.  Really good.  Enjoy.  Just no reason to be giddy nor should there be to be relevant.

HbWEYVabRkBrw9Nvq9W5-g.text: I went here last night and let me say wow! The decor is beautiful and homey. I loved that they play old movies as well. I sat at the bar and the bartender Jose was adorable and attentive. I ordered a black dragon also known as a blackberry mojito. He made it especially to my liking (less sugar). I also had the tiramisu and let me say by far the best tiramisu I have ever had in my life. I hear the food is amazing and I look forward to trying it soon!

f40mTeFboylkCPIGcvoIbQ.text: Went to Vitner for a lunch meeting.  First impression was the location is strange and a little hard to find.  It is connected to an office building inside a professional park, not where you'd typically find a restaurant.  However, if you work in one of the many office buildings nearby, it is probably very convenienct.   The food was ok - not bad by any stretch but a little overpriced.   The atmosphere is very upscale and we saw a few local Vegas celebrities eating lunch at the same time.

-ciE4ziR9J0UfQwJnt1NlQ.text: I have a habit of taking my wife to a real ritzy restaurant on her birthday, she likes to treat it like a national holiday. So after looking around for a new place to try out, I settled on this very nice restaurant. That was kind of the problem, it was just nice.  I don't know, I have nothing bad to say. The calamari app was good, The different breads were ok. We got completely confused by the cheese menu. I ordered a NY Steak and my wife got the Halibut. Both were good but not spectacular. The decor is REALLY impressive (especially for an office park). Prices were a little cheaper than expected which was appreciated.   I do have to say that the service was exeptional though, our drinks were always refilled and we never noticed anyone do it. We hate when the servers are always hovering and this woman was not like that at all...a real pro  I guess we just left after a nice enough dinner but we've had much better and much worse.  OH! and a friend turned me on to cucumber gimlets here...get one...y'know, or 7.

9zmvjLrOpzHj-8K-Y2yvFg.text: Great food! I love the atmosphere at this place. The bartenders are always great and super friendly

esiQtCGYSRMSK3lYSoFg8A.text: Went there with friends. Fantastic! Great food, drinks, service and decor! If you like great bread, look no furthur! And a great place to go if you plan on staying for a few hours..the chairs are super comfortable!

2CXxIRwWezBmmJNTme6Fng.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. My favorite is the scallops. I like their wine selection, too. If I could go there more, I would. The valet is very nice,

N0YjjeJIt-usarsdx4hWAw.text: I've been here multiple times for lunch and dinner.  Every time the food has been fantastic and service has been great.  I really love the decor and ambiance of this place.  Also a huge bonus is that it's so close to home.  It easily holds it's own against any place on the strip.

mGwyBHQZ_bP7kRFvIqI-ag.text: This place goes down as the worst service I've experienced in Las Vegas. My entree arrived before I was done with my salad. I had to have the server set it across the table only to be cold when I finally got to it.  I ordered a bottle of wine and the server said she would put it on ice. when I wanted more wine I didn't see my server. She was very busy as she was the only server in the bar area, they definitely needed 2. I went to the bar to inquire, no one knew anything about it, when I finally got the servers attention I mentioned my dissatisfaction. She proceeded to glare at me and ask if I wanted anything else, I said " only the bill". She dropped it off with no apology or comment and had charged me full price for a dinner that I didn't finish. When I mentioned to the manager the poor service I had received and the fact that had been charged full price for wine and food I hadn't finished he gave me his card and said he would make it up to me on my next visit, I asked him what this meant "Are you going to buy me dinner next time?". He replied "Do you want me to?" I didn't feel I should have to ask I left and lost $70.00 on a meal I didn't finish. lesson learned, I won't go back

bGUEd3dArxtSDmomUF4CpQ.text: Great place for a special dinner.  I recommend the Halibut if it is on the menu. My boyfriend ordered the rack of lamb and it was great but believe it or not, you can probably get just as good of a rack of lamb at Outback and for way less.  The wine was superb and their tiramisu was awesome.  Service was great too, they were on-point with everything.

il782xFm9-gcKsNInPpaGg.text: I've been here numerous times. The food is always great. Delicious white bean hummus! The decor and atmosphere are very cool. My only negative is that while the service is friendly it's always slow. I'd definitely check this place out if you haven't but its best to go in planning on a slow-paced, leisurely meal.

OSi1ucwFuXwQVLUy7Hf5rw.text: had a reservation. sat right down. wanted a better table though - right next to the door. waited a long time for calamari and it was not good. duck ravioli was ok. presentation could be better. chicken with Mac and cheese was pretty good. server assistants were attentive. hostess should smile once in awhile

-qqDSonpLibT1alhYRVPHQ.text: Had dinner there with two friends who live nearby and who had suggested we go there.  Just an amazing place!  Virtually everything we had was wonderful.  Cheese plate, salads, Halibut done to perfection, dessert and espresso to top off the meal plus perfect service.  Go here when you can.

3Wx4kuskpzUTt6dJEuFS-A.text: Want to eat with the locals?  Then go to this restaurant to have an upscale meal without the uber tourism of the Strip.  Our service was impeccable from the time we walked in  the door. For apps, we had the hummus, a must for the vegetarian at the table, the crab cakes and the calamari.  For an entree, I had the mushroom  risotto.  The server suggested it as a side but there is plenty to eat as a meal. It was wonderful! By the way, they make an amazing raspberry Arnold Palmer.  We were so full, we could not indulge the desserts, so save room because it looked amazing!  The next time, I am in Vegas, I am going to skip all the chef named restaurants on the Strip and head further out to the suburbs (9 miles) for fine dining, a relaxing atmosphere and no sounds of slot machines outside the door.   Note: It is located in a office area, so look for the big "V" sign off the road on the right and then turn right at the next street and then another right and drive through the parking lot to the back area for the entrance. ( of course the locals want to keep this gem a secret!)

lJk1jd1Eow06byY3L58IrA.text: My fiance and I took our friends to dine here for a double date and it was absolutely delicious. The Gm, Patrick is super friendly and made sure our experience was top notch! Our server was Michael Deville, he played a great role in our dining experience also! So yes we were pleased with the staff. He answered all of our questions thoroughly and professionally. Now on to the food! We started with calamari and grilled octopus,  both were really good, but I did favor the grilled octopus more. It was tender and perfectly grilled and I will order that appetizer again. Next was the prociouto wrapped ceasars salad served with boiled a quail egg, presentation was beautifully plated and yes you can share that between two people. Three of us had the Best bone in ribeye I've ever cut into and it came with a healthy serving of potatoes! Let me get to the LAMB though! I guess it's from Australia and most definitely one of the best lamb chops I've ever had.. medium rare is the way to go!  No joke.. If you're a lamb chop lover like me,  it's a must!  You won't be disappointed ... sorry had absolutely no room for dessert,  but I'll keep you posted on my next visit; )...

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Show stopper Lamb chop! Will be one of my most ordered entrées!
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the Best ribeye in town! Medium rare for sure!
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prociouto wrapped ceasar with a boiled quail egg..

pkW7iu_iG3Ri5EXQg2vZJA.text: I tried to not do this on a public setting but there was no listed email for feedback. 1st, I've been going to vintner since 2006. In the last year, everything has changed for the worst. I most recently went in for a light drink and a meal at the bar. Yvette treated me very well. Cue to the end of my meal. Patrick the manager was at the bar drinking and decided to butt into a conversation I was having with another patron at the bar. Patrick was rude. Insulted me. And made me feel ashamed of myself. I spent $150 on my meal for myself but he decided to berate me on my female opinion because he disagreed on something in a conversation between me and another patron unrelated to him. I have never felt so disrespected in my life. As a young professional Vegas female, I will ensure all professional women know that only men are respected at this restaurant or women who are taken care of by their men. Do not come here if you are an independent woman who just wants a nice meal. I am so disappointed. Especially because everything was great until the drunken manager came around. Sorry I will be taking my $150 elsewhere next time. I'm sure you all really don't care about that though. Thank you Patrick, for making me feel stuck in the 1950s despite my hard work. You have definitely lost me and I will continue to report this behavior to everyone I know. And by the way he said "bye Felicia" to me which may be effective for a 12 year old but definitely ensures this professional woman will never come back.

DqffxDnyoyoEiguL4CukkQ.text: What a non-Vegas jewel.  Buried in a corporate complex.  Hands down one of the best patios in Vegas, complete with white linen tents, turkish lamps and a bonfire pit.   Patio is reservations only after 8:30pm, (probably earlier in winter, so get there early if you're walking in).  The service is upscale (they match dinner napkins to the ladies attire in a lovely subtle way), which mean waiters can be snooty occasionally, but most are quite personable and answer questions sans-attitude.  The frommage course is not to be missed...a delicious assortment with exquisite drizzles.     By the time I get to main course, I'm usually buzzed and stuffed w/cheese...and there ends my review.  Lovely atmosphere, white furnishings, silent films playing in some of the cubbies, and an accessible bar area with additional bar table seating.  So great for a quick classy drink, or a leisurely 4 course meal.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese course to die for...

dmXS96RnJTo5ueVuTRJPuA.text: If you're looking for great food and a classy environment that's not so pricey as some of the  shitty overpriced food at the strip, come here!! I've been coming here for a while and I'm never disappointed. Always consistent great food. Lamb bolognese is to die for.

aoNAe-gCLZBW7addwo30uw.text: Had dinner tonight as a family and was blown away.  Did not expect much for an offstrip place but was blown away for the quality of the food and service.  The decor and music was perfect. Nate King Cole style.   We could actually have a conversation,  imagine that.  Parking is close and free!   The food highlights were the octopus appetizer, the cauliflower and crab soup but the Mediterranean Sea bass was the show stopper.  We finished with the mango desert and chocolate pie. I brought 2 bottles of wine and corkage was $30 a bottle.  Total bill for dinner for 4 with starters and appetizers then seafood entree and desert along with a $60 corkage fee came to $300.   Amazing value.   But the service made it so much fun.  Sento was our server and she is so warm and easy to connect with.   Her wine service was professional and she brought the Chardonnay temp down with the ice bucket which I appreciate.   Sento and her team were excellent.   I will be back!

YUXwVzLgHnIo7CNN35rKJg.text: Vintner was our last dinner in Vegas and it turned out to be a very enjoyable one. It was recommended to us by a couple we met while dining at Parma.  The restaurant has a beautiful outdoor area with cabanas and seating-very South Beach. The interior is sleek, modern and tastefully done with shades of green and ivory.  Our evening didn't start of well due to the slow service. It took half an hour to get bread for 2 starving people (us).  The bread assortment is delicious once you get it, and that quailed us down a bit.  We ordered a nice French Burgundy to go with dinner. Appetizers: Burrata Insalata and the seared crab cakes- both very good. Entree: I had a seared fish which was perfectly executed, maybe halibut or branzino, can't recall. Dessert consisted of a panna cotta and a trifle. Each one was excellent. Once we got over the initial service hi cup, we did enjoy our meal at Vintner's. If they could raise the service level a notch, they would be 4 stars. Still, I would return if the opportunity does arise.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dEBZN_B47kLAwUKkuC-Vyw.text: Exquisite ! Christmas dinner! Filet maybe one of the best steaks ever! Waiter Irvin was top notch. Cheese selection is decadent.

jJC3rdLFx4olENMahD5yjA.text: Service is pretty terrible 90% of the time. But, the food is decent and I do love that patio. I'm a sucker for the outdoor seating, even if I want to punch my lifeless server in the throat.

RQxBKPVHQXPqhDC-RqS50g.text: Definitely good for faye night.  When weather permits should eat on patio.  Love their pasta with lamb.  Great cheese plates.

W6uWbKYHhc1fmn213_vM1w.text: Hadn't been here in a long time because of poor service and experience last time. Prior to that we were pretty regular (once a month).   Tonight was our anniversary. Weather was great so we sat outside. I've always thought they have a great atmosphere inside and out.   Tonight the service was excellent (other than when making reservation asking if celebrating an event and totally forgetting once we were there). I think service is the most important thing. The right people and you'll love the place. Last time when we had an issue and management handled it poorly. It was obvious they didn't care to make things right when a server slipped and spilled oil all over me. Accidents happen. How they're handled is what's important. Ignoring the spilled oil, the server last time was awful on top of error.  They really deserve more than 2 stars, but I'm still annoyed from what happened years ago and from a general feeling of non caring overall.   To be fair the food was very good. Had ravioli with crabmeat which was very good, an excellent New York strip and generally it's a cut that isn't so great so I was impressed. A very good beet salad as well as a pork rhubarb and watermelon appetizer. Our waiter was excellent. I just like to go to places where the people working seem happy to have your business. If staff reads this and contacts me I'll explain my issue with you. I'm not going to waste tempers time going into it.   Thanks otherwise, but there are so many restaurants if I don't hear it's really improved we'll stick with some others.

hhZ3lSOqRgtjHgbc39rL7A.text: Hands down the best food in Las Vegas. The bread and desserts are awesome.

l7DZoungrfcvmNH1c1dptA.text: My first visit would've been a 3.5 but visit 2 was 2.5 so 3 it is. Overpriced and over pompous for the food quality.  Nothing stands out as great.  Certainly some solid options but nothing that wows.

I3iWQfW9fS36p206ej_tYg.text: Quick service and awesome list of drinks. The food and mixed cocktails are delicious and the place has such a nice vibe. It's refreshing to see such a classy place to dine and have a drink. I've been there a few times now and have absolutely no complaints. Vitner Grill is clean, classy and great with customer service.

M_KczVxjgADkf86jTzxE3g.text: Vinter Grill is one of my new favorite local restaurants! We need more restaurants like this in Summerlin area.  The staff is professional and provide excellent service. The food was tasty; much better than I had expected. Will definitely go back for more!

9UkSBVNijg3fpWZsWTzBvw.text: We love Vintner Grill.    The food is always excellent and we love the meat and cheese selection.  I have noticed that we get better service when we're dressed up (we made an emergency divert to VG one night when we couldn't get to our reservation on the Strip--everyone was dressed more casually than if we had planned on VG), but the service is still very good.    The decor is classy and inviting, the noise level is slightly higher than you'd expect, but I attribute that to people enjoying their dinner companions' company and the food.    You really can't go wrong with any of the dishes here.

b_LDxrornybGnMJDlSTT7g.text: Philadelphia Story playing in the background really set the tone for what would be a delightful dining experience. The seared scallops with saffron risotto were scrumptious. The apple upside down cake for dessert was the True star of the show. But beware, both mine and my friend's portions were petite. If you are starving, this may not be a great choice. If you want a simple,  elegant setting for your next date or social gathering,  I would definitely recommend. The service was perfection.

R34tfalFmynWI0K4OgrZmQ.text: Love the feel of the Place and the food Was excellent, a must for locals and   non locals

-IuqKeIHy8nkJaJwjaN9kA.text: Vitner grill is a very interesting place. It is in a location that can best be sumarized by saying..."where in the hell?"  That being said the place was doing just fine, biz wise, on a tuesday night.  I really like this place: it is funky without being weird. I love the distressed floors and the uniuqe decor. That being said it was really dark in there.  What really shines at this restaurant is the food. We started with a wonderful bottle of reisling( Dr Loosen?) which was very reasonably priced. We paired that with cheeses( their cheese selection is really really good...think purple haze( mild goats milk cheese with fennel and lavender from my neck of the woods Nor Cal), wonderufl blue cheese, cheedar, and other stinky cheeses. We had with this some wonderful proscutio, sliced duck breast(omg), crustini and some spreads that combined in an amazing way.  We also had a pizza/ flat bread for our appetizer that was just out of this world: carmelized onions, bits of proscutio, goat cheese that was a symphony of flavor.  Entrees were even better: I had the honey truffle glazed organic chicken that was one of the best I have ever had. I subbed out the mac and cheese for the tuscan potatoes and these mothers were just amazing.   My dining partners had the petite file which looked and tasted great, and the salmon tangine...which also looked and smelled divine.  This was all paired with a simple mondavi pinot noir which cost $30...what a bargain.  Desserts were also spot on. The tiramasu was a large portion of chocolate lady fingers( not traditional but very very good) soaked in a wonderful liquour with the usual additions. The apple crisp was also just a smash.  I highly recommend this out of the way jem.Service was also very attentive. Oh I forgot to mention their bread selections at the beggining were just drop dead amazing. chocolate walnut, etc..and the butter was very very creative.  Check it out!

tL9w6mGhcw7e1qsipqGFRg.text: Pleasantly surprised with this place!  What ambiance!  Old black and white movies playing silently on a glass drop as you walk in, the music is relaxing, Frank Sinatra etc, The inside decor is classy and the outdoor presence is amazing.  Food was great, service great.  I will be dining here frequently.  A place to relax, superb!

ZkWN9WUmkCEvrNk9IUfCcw.text: Went in on Saturday night with Hunter (my daughter) and had an awesome time! Our server Irvin recommended the halibut and we both loved it, he made us laugh and made sure we were taken care of, we'll definitely be back.  I'm a single mom and don't get a chance to go out much, it was a special night for both of us

SgLSaHYtQKy7HMPK4wO1aw.text: So here are the facts, keep in mind my reservation was set a week in advance for my 1 year anniversary, it took 30 minutes to merely get sat, 30 more minutes to get my first cocktail and starter, and then another 45 minutes after that to get my entree. All the while the large groups of 5 or more are getting sat instantly, served in minutes and catered to. We were ignored and put on the back burner because there were only 2 of us and are a younger couple.    I'm tired of going to a restaurant held in high regard and when we get treated like crap we get to hear excuses like, "well, your table is saved the group before you is just hanging out though and we are double booked tonight". (Snobby hostess that needs a reprimand for her terrible people skills and attitude.) Or, "I'm sorry that everything is taking so long, we are just backed up and I'm not too sure why" (Waiter trying hard to cover up for managers neglecting their patrons.) This is an acclaimed restaurant but can't keep on top of their shit on a Saturday in December? Is that a joke?   My experience was completely unacceptable and I will never ever suggest anyone to go here simply based on principle.    Thanks for ruining my anniversary.

9xyvmeEZwjIMEeWHa2_wuA.text: The food was above average I would definitely visit again. The portion size was great. I am a big eater and I was feeling very satisfied when I was done. Saw a lot of attractive ladies there too.  I should give them negative 10 stars for taking away the delicious $5 breakfast burrito's on weekends. Shame on them for that!!! They were awesome.

gXgwWM1CyL7K0naPMw5UJw.text: Nope, you're not in the Hamptons, your in a business park in Summerlin. Vitner's Grill is soooo pretty, the kind of pretty that calls one hither while simultaneuosly arousing rebellion. Like the need to stare at the cutest girl in class, only to pull her braids when she's not looking. So too should Vintner's be admired and dissed simultaneously.         So don't let the swank deter you, have fun with it. Enjoy the crisp and well-thought out decor that gives a nouveu nod to Nantucket. Dress well, but do expose a few of your tattoo's to let em know the counter-culture has arrived and wants a damn good table.There's that yank of the braids I was talking about.  FYI, The Summerlin set responds quickly to any threat that there neighborhood may be infultrated by upstarts. For great service, it pays to walk in with a little edgyness. Like hanging some golden nunchuks from your designer bag, etc    Now, back to food   VG boasts a balanced wine list, with many good Napa Valley choices, albeit small pours. Wood fired pizza with artisanal cheese was on point. We also enjoyed the butter and olive oil chilled on a marble slab to accompany the bread service and a dynamite salad. I tend toward the subject matter found in a renaissance still life; cheese, wine, bread, fruit, olives~ cannot  speak to meat options on menu, but what veg we had was quite good and very fresh.  VT is a nice option if you wish to avoid the strip, but are seeking some Luxe ambiance for business or pleasure. Nice place for plen-air dining on torch-lit patio. Salut!

vU43T8sJN2fTYuDKBFHxZw.text: My girlfriend turned me on to this place.  Been here a couple times now.  Been great every time.  The food is excellent and so is the ambiance.  Would've never thought a place in an office building would be this cool and swanky.  The prices are reasonable too.  Will be back for more.

riuoPS4eM4nn5HGViRa-8A.text: I had a nice meal here the other night.  Service was very good.  Sea scallops were delicious.  Reasonably priced wine list.

lXqjl8Q91wn4R80ks8tZkA.text: After hearing critics' praise on this new restaurant via the local radio, I came into Vintner Grill with high expectations. I really wanted to love this place. After finally experiencing it, however, I left scratching my head as to what the hype was all about. Did I miss the kool aid on the way in? In all honesty, the food was not terrible. But for the price, it also didn't wow me. The food was so uneventful I even forgot what I had. I ordered the calamari as an appetizer and the seared scallops for my entree.   On a positive note, the decor of the place is quite elegant. It's a great place to people watch as dinner is a packed house and the folks who come in here appear dressed to the nines. As for the food, I'm gonna keep on moving.

Eu4TAMVjpjLCLMlr1eWRmQ.text: A little tucked away in a business area but a great place for dinner and drinks both indoor and outside.

7MAUYp00ICZUK14WBYlfxg.text: So it is 5 stars when Josh(Im pretty sure it is Josh) is our waiter and 4 when he is not.  He is far more personable than the last waiter who messed up my birthday dessert.    The food is really good!  As someone who is sticking to seafood and veggies, they have plenty on the menu. The chef changes the menu with the seasons so if you eat there a few times a season you will find new and tasty treats.    The decor is really beautiful and they play old movies without sound.  It makes for nice background visuals.    If you reserve on open table I think there is only one table they seat you at and it is next to the server stand.  You might want to call if this annoys you. It does put you in Josh's section so that's the plus side.    They also make tasty drinks and stock Laphroaig.  The last waiter (not Josh) put ice in my scotch, since I did not ask for it on the rocks it was annoying.  However it is a cardinal sin to waste scotch.    I love that it is not in a casino and that it is quite low key.   I wish they hosted a Casablanca night.

meQB9OPTmy8MJyA-WhA3vA.text: Best Chicken Ever   On a typical Thursday evening at 7:00, Vintner Grill was slammed. I first noticed the noise as I entered the well-hidden Summerlin spot. The restaurant was LOUD. Not loud with music, rather conversation. Since much of the restaurant is fitted in wood, the sound really carries; Vintner Grill is not a great date spot, though it does suit groups very well. It resembles many innocuous bistros you might find on the streets of Chicago, Manhattan, or any other large metropolitan area.   THE FOOD:  I was a bit let down by the food. Vintner Grill is generally received well by guests, and came highly regarded to me by a coworker.   I had a few selections from the cheese and Charcuterie menu which were good. The Petit Basque is a deliciously balanced, semi-soft cheese I highly recommend.   I also had the calamari with a curried aioli, the Moroccan spiced lamb spareribs, and the honey truffled half-chicken. The calamari was flash fried, but a little too flashy. It was undercooked, and chewy. Calamari is a super easy dish to cook; it was disheartening to have such bad calamari at what some would call a fine dining establishment. The spare ribs were perfectly charred on the outside and seasoned well. Be aware that lamb spare ribs are a fatty cut before ordering. This is a good thing for people in the know.   The chicken was OUT OF THIS WORLD DELICIOUS! The skin was perfectly crispy without being overcooked. The meat was succulent and tender, but the flavor is what makes this literally THE BEST CHICKEN I HAVE EVER EATEN. The flavors married to form a symphony of pleasure. This chicken will put a smile on your face once the first nuance of flavor is detected by your taste buds.   I can't agree with most reviewers on Vintner Grill, but I can tell you that the 1/2 chicken is a 5 Star dish, and reason enough to give this spot a go.

RI2NYUV1_YldUWyysc3b8Q.text: Out of all the restaurants in Vegas, this is one of my favorites! It's such a great, hidden locals spot. Beautiful decor inside, amazing patio with fire pits outside, every bite of food and taste of a drink I have had here are absolutely wonderful. With all of this gushing I WISH I could give this spot 5 stars - however...   They have an apple brandy that I love and the past few times we've visited they've served it in a grappa glass, which is very small at the top and doesn't allow for the nose to smell, which is a big part of drinking the brandy. We asked the waiter why it wasn't served in a brandy glass (this happened twice by the way). The first time the waiter said that they are very fragile glasses and most are broken, and the ones that weren't broken were being used. The second time the waiter told us that the glasses were expensive, most had been broken, and the owner didn't want to buy more of them. These two times were the last two times we've been, and I'm very dissapointed. It's a simple thing - BUY SOME BRANDY GLASSES PLEASE. This seems like a small thing to comment on, but it is just so out of the ordinary for what we expect when going to Vintner Grill.

rdUNBR8d9qb0wcRMdneydQ.text: A real treat!  Everything I have tried on the menu is high quality and very delicious and they work hard on maintaining an eclectic and broad ranged wine program, which I really enjoy.  Great decor, relaxed casual yet elegant atmosphere and a spectacular patio!

nMO-JYinfQQsmKXqk0ePyw.text: Love this place...I like that it is strangley situated in a business center, and I drove around like a fool before finding it. I first spotted the outside patio area, it was very Miami, white curtains flowing, comfy patio furniture, there was a wedding party there and it looked so fashionable, like out of a magazine. The inside decor was a mixture of contemporary/modern Pottery Barn-esque with a splash of beach feel, I liked the little nooks built into the wall, it was like just a little bit of Morocco thrown in as well. Ok onto the food, the first time I went there I did a cheese board and some wine, they have a great cheese selection and I really enjoyed my order.
