Second time I had split 2 entrees with my friend so we could try both, we ordered the halibut with cous cous, spinach, toasted orzo, lemon gremolata and sweet tomatoes, I politely asked if they could hold the butter, and the server was very nice, didn't give me a hard time, this dish was wonderful, halibut was cooked to perfection, definitely recommend, the show stopper though was the bouillabaisse with mussels, clams, shrimp, snapper, calamari, scallops and saffron broth. This was so delicious, comparable to cioppino, but the saffron broth gave it a different twist. The calamari was outstanding. Service was outstanding, our server was very attentive, my water glass was never empty, they continually came around to give you more bread, oh the bread....awesome bread basket....carb addicts dream. The is a place I wouldn't hesitate to take out of towners or recommend to locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse. Amazing.

tSV0ts9c-oPuf1_Xz7qlCA.text: One of locals best kept secrets. If your looking to get away from the strip and jump into a south beach Florida atmosphere then head to this place.  Many local celebrities can be seen here on any given day, and for good reason. Great place to enjoy some wine and cheeses or enjoy some of the wonderful pasta dishes, the wild boar and tagliatelle pasta is amazing. Service is impeccable. Must make reservations!!!  Great for groups and the outside area is beautiful.

FjSgD1xC7sekAHCXwCvNFw.text: Vintners rules.  The room is beautiful.  Reminds me of a chic, Southern plantation with the white beadboard ceiling and checked, wood floors.  Great wine and cheese selection.  I love the bouillabaisse.  I get it every time.  Yum!  Only gripe is that the menu doesn't change very often and I'm not a fan of the poker machines at the bar, my preferred place to sit.

P0WPjtN-CyYboy_zTFvVKg.text: so first of all this place is really hard to find. its in an office building complex. and the food i recieved was not worth the money paid.

A5oV28wOn8rfADxzXoXvRA.text: This restaurant is a good main-stay for the Summerlin area. I love the lamb or boar bolognese is very very good. Thursday nights are a little more upbeat as they have a DJ playing music. It is hidden in a business park but they offer valet parking. The wait staff is excellent. Very friendly. Will be back on my visits to Vegas.

eKcEJ8-sOZuUmyMke8w1-w.text: First of all, I will credit Rachael Ray for featuring Vintner Grill on Tasty Travels, making me obsess about this place for weeks before actually having the chance to get in here. I had prepared myself for the stark realization that the place may be just a victim of huge hype....BUT I WAS PROVED INCREDIBLY WRONG  The exterior of Vintner Grill makes that place unassuming. In fact, I thought I had the wrong directions until I could see a white gazebo peeking over the wall.  I, as a male, will NEVER use this word to describe anything ever again but the interior was absolutely LUXURIOUS: plush white, accents or red here and there, straight up beautiful. Usually, one would feel uncomfortable but for some reason the decor made me feel...home-y.  The service was great for having a full house. I got a table to myself at 7:30pm, awesome right? My drink was never left unattended. And my waitress was talkative considering the dinner rush crowd.  Lastly, *drumroll* THE FOOD!! *TA-DAH!!* To start things off, I had the margherita flatbread and finished with dry aged ribeye. It was truly a religious experience, the tomatoes and avocado oil made my palate want more instantly. The ribeye could easily rival Craftsteak or Del Frisco, it had a medium/med-high earthiness but not overpowering. I have to admit that I am very partial to blue cheese so the polenta made me extremely happy.  Everyone MUST try Vintner Grille. Another jewel tucked off strip in Summerlin.

y87lukNLNHGiFPJ9Q2E92A.text: Vintner Grill was like a restaurant from a fairytale, where everything was seriously perfect and amazing in every way.   My good friend and I actually had an hour to kill because of our later reservation time and we had nothing else to do but get there early. However, it was an amazing hour well spent because we got to try all the DELICIOUS drinks the bartenders made and enjoyed the beautiful scenery outside. I LOVED the whole romantic ambiance set up, with the numerous lanterns hanging from the branches and christmas lights strung all around. It really felt like I was in a fairy tale and I was getting happier every minute with each sip of deliciously-made martinis that I was drinking ;)  And then to go on to the FOOD....... My mouth is already salivating thinking about the yumminess that was brought out by our very friendly waitress. I remember falling in love with the butternut squash ravioli, braised lamb, and even the bread they brought out! Every single bread in the basket was unique and delicious, just like a box of chocolates! :D For the main entree, I ordered the bouillabaisse, which was filled with fresh seafood and the broth was super flavorful.   I loved loved this place. If I could give you an extra star, I definitely would! I noticed it definitely got crowded around dinner time, so I recommend making a reservation!

Fz2MwWhHY0L8xm9_ShedKw.text: I had the best experience I could have imagined.  I think my host's name was Stephen and he did an amazing job at sharing the thoughts of what would be best based on our preferences, the man definitely knew the menu top to bottom and was very knowledgable about all the questions that I had.

soSG3Ag9cXz8qT0IAw0NAg.text: Frankly, the food was terrific; delicious, lovely combinations of flavors and textures, nice presentation on all the dishes we tried.  We were seated outside in the gorgeous patio area where the ambience is just perfect for a summer evening.   However, we were completely ignored and waited 25 minutes after being seated before a server appeared at our table, and that was only after my husband got up from the table and complained to the guy in charge of seating guests.  Finally we got some water!  The service we received throughout the evening made us feel as though we were simply an inconvenient after-thought.  Such a shame.  But at least the food was good!

N4PnFEyzogS3BsWJLkmj8g.text: I keep forgetting to review this restaurant.  We love this place. Quality food. Great staff.  Their cheese selection is top notch. Their wine selection is also great.  Cocktails from the bar are always good.The food is always excellent.  Last night the wife had the crab ravioli and I had the ribeye. Both were very tasty. Another superb Vegas restaurant that's not on the strip.

26ewsWwqKf9k0Sw-hype0g.text: I really enjoy coming here for lunch.  This is probably my 10th time here and it never seems to disappoint.  I recently came for lunch with a few of my other mom friends.  We tried the steak, calamari, lamb pasta, and also the salad.  The waiter  was very attentive and as we were waiting for all our guests to arrive, he was never pushy on rushing us us with orders and during the time waiting, he kept making sure we had plenty of water.    The decor always looks very upscale and clean. The waiters all dress very nicely and there is a good business lunch crowd.  I enjoyed my lamb pasta and the parking was also plenty around.   If you need a place to take a client or have a nice dinner lunch date, here is the place to go. The wine list is also amazing and they have delicious cocktails as well.   in my book

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cLzEIHGe1WEFbspv7o16eA.text: Vintner Grill is one of my staple date-night places. My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and even spent NYE here.   Pros: The food is so good! I suggest the meat and cheese platters. I've had the bouillabaisse and the lamb pasta - both are great. The waiters are nice and offer good wine pairings if you ask for them. The service is generally pretty quick, but this is a place to take in the ambience and have a slow meal.  Cons: The prices are a little steep.   I'll be back again soon!

3ZregTvkkb6yxkpGDNV72Q.text: Not what it used to be...that's how our family of eight would describe our last celebratory meal. My grandfather turned 93 and we wanted to treat him to a special meal and experience. Sadly the service and food was not up to par. Our consistently great experience went downhill. We all drove from Henderson and were looking forward to dinner. Our server seemed less than interested in waiting his tables (not just ours), and when a couple dishes were sent back for being cold (instead of hot fresh) and one dish completely missed that should have warranted a concern for both waiter and management. 3 stars for the beautiful atmosphere and amazing bread and butter which never disappoints. The $400 bill should have been a fantastic experience for us all.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Walkway
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entry

0wz4lOACPOljkd1FJ7NAAw.text: Had lunch st the bar 2 days ago- Jose was awesome!  Such a great experience and the food was so yummy Highly recommend Vintners

Kd0P7JXFHcIeds3Ho_TIPA.text: This restaurant is not new by any means but when Matthew Silverman left, as the head chef, to open Hexx on the strip they quit serving a lot of things including their signature crabcakes! Well they are back! Point of my review! The new kitchen has certainly stepped up their game since and those crabcakes are back! Every single dish that this establishment puts out is beyond amazing and completely fresh in ingredients. On this visit, we started with one of their soups, which are incredible, and of course the crabcakes. Then we moved on to the entrees that we chose which were the half chicken dish with broccoli rabe and their signature Mac n cheese. Unfortunately, they used to put a fresh bread crumb on top of the mac & cheese and now they are just melting cheese on top of that and that was not to our liking because it was just way too much cheese! The other entree was the crab raviolis and they were fabulous! Not pictured here was one of their amazing salads, all are delicious! If you haven't been here for a while, I highly suggest you go back and visit again!

5OLLc2ZesAN121BLTGd0Og.text: Made a reservation on open table for a 5pm on Sunday with a specific request for outdoor table because of the good weather and our toddler that could enjoy the weather and sit in the outdoor environment instead of the crowded room. Was waiting for 40 min there for our table when they had clearly a bigger table empty but didn't want to give it up. Hungry baby and 40 min later we had to leave when manager didn't even try to help and couldn't even order some food for the toddler while waiting.

eMq5MWbH_e9jjaA67RwUSw.text: Amazing food! Amazing Venue! Great Service!  I highly recommend if you are around Summerlin area or if you are not!  Something different and in a nice location! I would just recommend for the ladies to bring a jacket the air conditioning is no joke !

KGI61wsj1hk86U2KZ3Bx-Q.text: Smells like old money when you walk in, but that is vastly separated by the lounge area and the white line table cloth area. Rest assured, I bellied up to the bar in my low cut top and heels, straight from the airport.  I contemplated this menu for about a whole aviation worth. Went back and forth on, do I get a charcuterie board (but I'm solo), is the flatbed too big, will a salad plus food be too much, but I want cheese, the lounge menu is cheap, crab cakes have greens, etc etc. I settled on a Caesar salad (it has procuitto-charcuterie board solved) and small lounge menu flatbread.  Caesar was good. Required cutting and not a lot of dressing, but good. Probably not worth anything more than $10. Flatbread was almost too hot to eat, but totally worth $8. It was a good 8"+ diameter and yummy. Came with peppers and parmesan.  The drinks were quite nice. Bartenders were attentive and kind. I'd come back, but probably always just sit at the bar.  People were dressed quite nice on a Wednesday and parking seems obscure with "visitor" and non visitor spots. I just used a visitor spot.

XUPbmLY2pQFcgZ_f2zBc2A.text: MlmWonderful lunch with my ladies and impeccable service from Ray.    The calamari was spectacular. The little thin slices of lemon, lightly battered and fried, perfectly seasoned, was a refreshing surprise.   We enjoyed the wine flight which Ray paired with a fantastic charcuterie.  What a lovely way to spend a afternoon.

M9qIx3J74WSsZ4YSTjcdSQ.text: Absolutely BRILLIANT. I was surprised by this place. I've driven by for years living in the area and never really noticed it was a restaurant but trust me it is a hidden gem. The halibut was spectacular, the lamb was to die for, the cheeses very addictive, and the apple upside down cake was soo good I wanted to order another one to take home lol. I will definitely be back for more

ZBkl1Y47pJbXQ0goPZEirg.text: We are new to Summerlin area and a friend recommended Vintner Grill... Wow, was the food ever delicious and restaurant very romantic. Highly recommend this restaurant!  We also met the GM, Thomas Bachner, who helped make our experience wonderful.     We have definitely found our new fav in the Las Vegas area and look forward to our next local romantic dinner getaway!

9OeQDlYnayQXAC02l7plTA.text: Wow! Have driven by this place for years. Had a few friends recommend it... finally popped in for dinner. Great ambiance, 5-star taste... and super-friendly crew, Jeff and Guillermo. I will be back. Soon.

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear salad w gorgonzola

EOkBg77tD39RlcBNqU2TZQ.text: I drive past this place every day and had no idea such a beautiful place was right in my backyard. The style of this restaurant was very unique and I was impressed with every little detail, from the old black and white movie in the background to the beautiful wooden bar to the gorgeous outdoor patio.   We were seated at a half booth table for 4. The booth portion was set up perfectly for a beautiful date night with pillows nestled under a detailed arch. We were brought a bread plate where we got to choose from a variety of homemade breads. The cranberry bacon and olive breads were the winners for our table, and the butter olive oil spread was a great addition.   For dinner we started with the pear salad. I usually don't like salads but this was pretty good and I ate the whole thing. Perfectly timed, just as we finished the salad the next plates came to the table. I ordered the seafood risotto and and can't stress how great the taste was! The seafood was all perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. I was a little disappointed there was only one scallop, but it was made up for the amount of other assorted seafood on the dish. My friend ordered the tenderloin and again it was delicious! It was a little more rare in the middle than either of preferred but the rest of it was perfectly medium rare. Lastly we got the cheesecake for desert, and it was a great way to end a great meal!  As beautiful as the restaurant is and delicious the food was, the staff didn't seem to want to be there, or at least didn't care when it came to interacting with us. They were fast and knowledgeable about the menu but it seemed like a chore when they had to talk with us. The waitress hardly acknowledged me the entire meal other than to ask what I wanted to eat. Such as she asked my friend if she wanted a drink and then left without asking me, and this trend continued for the rest of the night.    Overall the place was still great and being so close to home, it will probably be my new local place to celebrate special events, just hopefully next time we get one of the great waiters everyone else seems to have gotten.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenderloin

KlyWELpFCAeooLYPGThobA.text: Nice place. Located in a strange place but food was delicious. I ordered the lamb chops and my husband ordered the ribeye. Both very tasty.

wpA8FRM_p2tbZW98Fy20_Q.text: If you are looking for a place to have a special dinner, or just really enjoy food that is prepared well, Vintner Grill is the place to go. The food here not only tasted great, but was plated beautifully. The service was prompt and friendly. The chef has a great selection of choices that should appeal to most people and they are very amenable to making any needed dietary changes.  My husband and I were there as part of a larger group, so we shared the octopus, hummus and the calamari appetizers. All were tasty, although my favorite was the octopus, because the octopus wasn't chewy and had a lovely roasted flavor.  For dinner, my husband had the crab ravioli and I had the sea bass, but I don't think there is a bad choice on the menu. His crab ravioli were filled with lump crab meat and the sauce that went with my sea bass complemented the flavor of the fish nicely. We shared the carrot cake for dessert and it was a combination of carrot cake and cheesecake that was just sweet enough to finish off our meal.

TSEhoAF6Ms0m6NRTTv1Tcw.text: The restaurant was beautiful! Attended for a friend's birthday. I felt it was a little overpriced and definitely in a hidden location so it was very hard to find. The service was okay, not horrible but not the best either. The food was good and I enjoyed what I ordered but sadly I  probably won't be dining here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UaIzv3C_BbbR4RmfJVwP_w.text: Used to love this place! Last last time we went we were very disappointed! They messed up all of our orders. My steak was undercooked. I asked to add onions and mushrooms to my steak nothing was added and BESIDES  that fact the waiter started to argue with me saying I never said that ( when all of our table heard How I asked for it and even laughed at it saying oh she love onions) . When we booked a table they said it will be a live music and AGAIN there was NOTHING! No live music( as promised) food wasn't good! And service WAS HORRIBLE! Not coming here anymore and NOT recommending this place to anyone! This is a good EXAMPLE OF HOW GOOD RESTAURANTS WHEN THEY GET POPULAR STOP CARING ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICES AND QUALITY OF FOOD!

Y6KxaiJG-K9T4c2yuJt9Bw.text: Ate at the bar. Love their bread with butter and Evoo. Ordered the usual, the lamb bolognese. Didn't taste as good as I remembered. Pasta was overcooked and needed a touch more seasoning. Customer service good. Food okay, price point was fine as well. Just hope quality doesn't come down the next time I dined here.

1MZuKcLSZmGSZUmC6_Lihg.text: Over all a great meal and I enjoyed the ambiance. The service was excellent and the meal was outstanding. The menu has a variety of great dishes. This truly is a gem.  This would have been a five star review had the sugar been on a wooden stick and not in a sugar caddy.

v7trPVL_f-SD_I59qh9e3w.text: This is an unassuming spot in an office park, as several people mentioned.  I was surprised to see a valet parking option there on a Wednesday night.  When you walk into the restaurant, it's like walking into another world.  The space is very elegant and modern and feels nothing like an office park.  There is also a nice patio area with fire pits. We ordered the charcuterie board, and a beet salad.  These were both very tasty and nicely presented.  The bread was also very good - I tried a cranberry bacon roll and a raisin walnut roll.  I had the Scallops with coriander-peppercorn crust, sweet potato hash, harissa honey and blood orange sauce for my entree.  The scallops were delicious, but I found the sauce to be a bit too sweet.  I had a bite of someone else's sea bass, which was very good.  Those who ordered the lamb bolognese and the veal piccata cleaned their plates completely.  Will need to try those next time.  The service is excellent and very attentive.  Definitely will be back to this hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops with coriander-peppercorn crust, sweet potato hash, harissa honey and blood orange sauce.

h2sYa2l8ukLmtmgjeYH9Fg.text: O M G - Favorite place in Summerlin. Very hidden. Brunch on Sundays is yummy. Mimosas are a plus. Very cute & trendy decor. Love the all white. Service is always on point. This place is on the higher $$ side. If you are on a budget. This is not for you. Thanks guys.

Ck_b1AaFbc_sb-WiExl96Q.text: This was a beautiful atmosphere and the food was amazing. Bread tray with the basil butter is going to make it hard for me to go back to regular butter. I had the mushroom risotto with jumbo shrimp...yum. All the fish dishes looked amazing so will have to have the halibut next time!

5UAJ_Q_Iiql8I0PyHJFCjQ.text: This is one of Summerlin's best kept secrets.  It's hidden off in an office park, so it's hard to locate unless you know about it.  I tried several dishes but my favorite is the Mediterranean Sea Bass and the cheese plate.  Any cheese is delicious here...  The waitstaff and ambiance is great.  Every time I have a visitor come in from out of town this is one of the first place I take them.  They love it!!!

PByMa5IqY9V73D35d08w2Q.text: By far one of my favorite restaurants not only in Vegas but anywhere in the world!! ABSOLUTELY delicious. Great service. Great atmosphere. A bit pricey but not really for what you get and the memories you will make here. The cheese platters make my mouth water and I'll come back here no matter where I go on earth to eat!! Great place great people great food. Consistent. Amazing!! Bravo.

--FbRLO-6R3fB4YNlAlomA.text: This is one of the best restaurant in Summerlin!   The location is weird. Let's all admit that. The office park is a weird place for a restaurant but it's an amazing place to discover.   The food is exceptional. The drinks are amazing. The wine selection is outstanding.   This is my number one pick for holidays or special occasions.

ineK6M4WamXlXm7b1numWQ.text: One of the most amazing meals my husband and I have ever had. We are down in this area from the San Francisco Bay Area and saw a review on this romantic restaurant. The Valentine Prix Fix Special dinner was unbelievable, lobster and filet along with a caviar appetizer and crab cakes that melted in your mouth. Served with a glass of brut and a dessert of strawberry tart served with whipped cream and two large chocolate dipped strawberries. A great value at $120. For two!!! Be sure to sit in Aaron's station, he is the BEST waiter we have ever had hands down. If you go here and follow my review please write one of your own

Y4vMCdZFABJ4kDn2zgNBSA.text: Excellent sea bass, salmon, chees plates, wine choice. outstanding service .. bread are Soo yummy it is free !! 6 different kinds !! My favorite table are #43 only 4 booth in testament

W3NruwZ71d18Ltu5VHjO4Q.text: My BF surprised me with NYE dinner here. We had reservations for 8:45pm. We showed up early and weren't seated until almost 30 mins after our reservation. I get that reservations aren't precise, but the wait kind of defeated the point of making a reservation. And we only got updates when we went up and asked. So that was a little bit frustrating.  Once we were seated, the service was great, especially considering the crowd. The atmosphere is awesome. I loved the decor. Light and open, but still romantic and nice. It felt very NYC to me.  I appreciated that they had both a prix fixe menu as well as the regular menu offerings. We opted to basically create our own shared 3-course meal. We did the calamari, followed by the crabcakes, followed by the beef tenderloin. And they were very nice about splitting the plates for us.  The calamari was fabulous. Great breading. The lemon curry dipping sauce was phenom! The added curry was so unique and went splendidly with the calamari. Thank you Yelp reviews for the recommendation on the calamari - it most definitely did not disappoint. (5 stars)  The crabcakes were good, but not memorable. I liked that they were small and extra crispy on top. Aside from that, though, I've had better. (3.5 stars)  The beef tenderloin was superb. Tender and juicy and cooked just right. And the peppercorn sauce was done just right and was the perfect compliment to the meat. The asparagus was good. The brie mashed potatoes were amazing! (5 stars)  All in all, it was a great meal. We never felt rushed and we enjoyed each course. I would most definitely eat here again.
