Zgv0Nq7g2F6r9F2_mdFrBQ.text: Absolutely love this gem!!! Fabulous service, lovely atmosphere, l love the garden cabana's during the spring & fall season and the food has been consistently delicious!!! I highly recommend!

QsqjrjMoO4yTHhrhSmMq7w.text: Really wanted to try this place out, came in 925, no acknowledgment for 5-7 minutes only to be approached at 931pm "the kitchen is closed" hours on line states close at 10pm... change your hours of operation if you stop operating at 930pm...

Uigc5W4IuWZvgdh-moj8sA.text: Fantastic service and excellent food! We went there and Jeff was our waiter. He was excellent and we will be asking for him by name. He went above and beyond for our table. We like to come here for special occasions and for business lunches. Highly recommend this gem.

qcWxHn5Mwv0GyhPSD9-1rw.text: I invited a group of colleagues here after work for happy hour following a stressful day. We sat in the lounge and had to specifically ask for the lounge menu with tapas portions and discounted wines, which is a pet peeve. I shouldn't have to be "in the know" to get your menu, either offer it or don't. The service was lackluster throughout but the food quality was good enough that I'm planning a group visit here with some wine-loving friends.   Lounge menu is limited but has a good variety, and we tried most of it. As for wines, I had a decent merlot and a great African red, which paired well with my meal. The mushroom bruschetta was so good that we shared two orders. Other standouts include the grilled octopus and the porchetta, though the latter wasn't quite what we were expecting. The crab cakes, margherita flatbread, and sausage skewers were just okay. Their meat, cheese, and wines seem to be what is most popular here.  Our server wasn't around much and when he was, affected an overly friendly touchy-feely persona that was off putting. After having to hunt down the lounge menu, we were brought one copy for a table of four. My boss was billed for the wrong wine, to the tune of double the price, and the resolution was poorly handled and implied she was at fault. Needless to say, no one I invited wants to go back, which reflects poorly on me and now requires me to recruit an entirely different friend group to revisit despite genuinely wanting to try more of their menu.

V0oPCIRw5AgBIoNeoRCFHg.text: Is it just me or has the service really gone down hill here?   The server we had just didn't seem to care at all, nor did the assistant manager show concern for the poor service we had.  I will not be going back here until they change the staff.

eJfDIlpQk1TKDehVAbnMzg.text: I just wanted to Thank YOU for making my daughters wedding absolutely magical   I am so grateful to the FANTASTIC Vitner Grill... with special kudos to Leisha!  Leisha really understood "the look and feel" of the wedding celebration that The Bride & Groom were hoping to accomplish at the Vitner Grill.  Due to Leisha's professionalism, experience and superior attention to detail, EVERY SINGLE PERSON who attended said that they had the best time ever, everything was beautiful and the food was delicious!!  The ambience far surpassed our expectations and above ALL Leisha's experienced suggestions, and attentive team of professionals made this a fairytale-like-evening one that will long be remembered. On behalf of the Bride & Groom, their family and friends we THANK YOU and the entire staff of *Vitner Grill!

uHR7pyaSJRQzmxOw-Y9gBw.text: Lovely experience and the desserts were out of this world. Never had a Creme brulee hit me in my feels as theirs does. Tiramisu is A+. Our server, Scott, was well versed with the menu and had great recommendations. We really enjoyed the bread selection and probably went overboard.  Great ambiance. The outdoor seating is quite lovely.

__4_GFDPqLmo5JKCnderng.text: A True example of excellent dining. Swanky and cool and you can tell a lot of locals are here...The dining room reminds me of the country club I belonged to growing up but, definitely a little more casual. Some guys had jackets on, a few had shorts? Maybe it's a Vegas thing and it's okay, I guess? The entire staff is on point and waiting for your next move and they are motivated by great service...Super attentive.   It was my 5 year wedding anniversary so the night was already set to be flawless... It was.   Great and unique choices, even down to their version of a Caesar Salad...you'll want to try it for sure. I took the dive and ordered the New York strip and was VERY happy I did... cooked to perfection and although I had very little room left for desert, I saw the 'Chefs Selection' pass by a few times... Strawberry Shortcake, a huge favorite of mine so, I took the plunge and again... perfection.   Get off the strip and get out to Summerlin and you'll be happy you did when you have dinner at The Vintner.

BLgy9dYgEgFDNQ42_F4HQQ.text: Ubered it here from our strip hotel to get away from the strip!   So glad we researched for a local's restaurant away from the madness that we love about Vegas.  Our server was so knowledgeable about wine, he even designed the Sommelier Wine Tasting Flight #3.   The Bouillabaisse entree was awesome.  My wife had the tuna tartar as an entree, which was perfect.  Our dessert was perfect as well, paired with a glass of Justin Cab Sauv.   Couldn't have had a better celebration dinner!

qVIzMuIsqtoreLtSHQHDGA.text: What an amazing experience. It was more than a meal. I felt like royalty. Our party of nine dined there on Mother's Day. The selection was great and the service was outstanding. Both my water glass and my coffee cup stayed full. The food arrived hot, was beautifully arranged and tasted wonderful. I'm looking forward to going again.

Ui7Iqp4MJYxLYIUs75BhBw.text: Tonight my family and I went to Vintner Grill and it was by far the best dining experience my family has ever experienced. Our server was Marcelo and he took amazing care of us. The service was excellent and the presentation was beautiful. Everything we ate from appetizers to desserts was delicious. We will go back every time we visit Las Vegas. If you go to or live in Las Vegas Vintner Grill is a must.  It is not on the strip but it is well worth the drive. Thank you everyone.

wBEGKKmK13xbsP7Z85avCA.text: We had our office Holiday Party here; it was terrific.  The atmosphere was quiet and fun and the food was amazing.  Waiter was funny, courteous, and responsive.  Overall a great time; we'll definitely be back!

wySkOjXEOJncgMSio6u44Q.text: Expensive, but awesome! Food is so so so good!  We love this place.

FWz61Muj9xpnJU1HDmUboA.text: Food.. service..bartender.. excellent.. a True gorgeous..spectacular menu.. they put a spin on classics with just the right amount of unique  flavorings..nothiing too over powering.. we had crab cakes..veal scallopini.. half roasted chicken.. mac and cheese.. our bartender Mark serves up the very best hand made to perfection martinis and manhattans..  elegant surroundings . exceptional food with a very affordable cost.. not expensive at all.. A local treasure in this desert. Thank you Vitnar grill...  deb and bob

mcuB6aTQ9bSIdyUZSRkqdQ.text: We came here for a birthday dinner tonight and we were a party of 16 - the waiter seemed inconvenienced the second we sat down. Some of us wanted to order appetizers while others wanted to wait, so our waiter wouldn't let us order at our leisure. He says "wait until everyone is ready to order their appetizers" and walked away. WHAT??  I thought it was a joke. He asked my wife if she wanted a drink and when she declined he began walking away - I had to get his attention to place my drink order when I was sitting right next to her. He was just very rude the entire night, didn't take care of us by any means and we were a relaxed group just enjoying conversation with each other throughout the night. We were pretty easy to please, yet this guy fell very short. He never apologized to us and continued to be rude down to the last second of our stay. I was actually looking forward to eating here tonight and it was such a let down. The terrible service made the food extremely forgettable. Not worth it.

g1rdHNqRe0z_U-si_e7-XA.text: Well we tried it again hoping for good service and a great meal. Well we are 3 for 3. I have come here 3 times and all 3 times service stinks. There are no less than 15 food servers etc strolling around and we had to get up and ask 3 times for bread and then instead of them asking if we would like another round of drinks we had to grab someone to ask them if we could possible get another drink. This appears to be the norm as each of my visits were the very same. I guess we thought we might get a different outcome this time. No luck. This place is not cheap and service should be right there. Our $48 rib eye was pan fried and when asked for it medium well it came extremely red. We had to send it back and share the chicken which was pretty good. Our waitress was very gracious and tried her best to help remedy the situation. She was very sweet and helpful. Needless to say we will not be back. We refuse to spend good money and be totally stressed out.

b27Nzmm9dG6OlWFZSMiLZA.text: You would never know this place is here . It's mixed in with a bunch of office type building hiding around back man am I glad we were with the Vegas kid and he knew about this place . The meal was great start to finish. They have a meat and cheese plate that you can pick 5 items 3 cheese and 2 meats we did a white truffle ricotta a white cheddar cheese and provolone and for the cured meats we did a venison salami and of course some prosciutto they also give you a few spreads and some dried fruit to go along with it . They also give you a choice of dinner rolls they bake fresh . I had the bacon and cranberry (highly recommend ) and the black olive which was great as well. I had the Caesar salad as well and for my main course I had the Veal It was fantastic . My only knock on this place has nothing to do with the food or the service but there was a table very close to us with a couple on a "date " and they were all over each other and she kept calling him "Daddy" it happens so much that every time we heard her say it we all took a drink !

nNhtQK8rb8_zlvX8Y4ZmSQ.text: This place deserves 5 stars if it wasn't for their rude asshole of a manager Michael. Not only did we call to make a reservation, but he answered the phone rude and upset I was even trying to come in. I had one more question to ask over the phone, which was going to be if we could request a booth, but before I knew it he HUNG UP ON ME. When my boyfriend and I arrived, he was at the front podium didn't greet me and and took me to the first table he saw and said "here". I asked if we could sit at a booth where there were other people sitting around, and he huffed and said no it's not set. But the table next to it was so I pointed it out and he huffed and grunted and directed us in that table and just threw down the menus at that table and walked away. For a restaurant of this kind I could never imagine being treated this way. This guy needs to get fired. What if it was my bday or anniversary. No employee should ever treat your customers that way. Unprofessional.

SPgfyUzEm4WSm8gKGWFUkA.text: Located in an inconspicuous office park in Summerlin, Vintner Grill has been a favorite dinner spot of mine for a few years now. Looking at the address and being familiar with most restaurant locations in Vegas off of the strip, one would assume the entrance is facing directly onto Charleston Blvd, but you would be mistaken. Once you finally locate the entry amongst your standard setup of covered office parking spaces in the back, you enter a space rich with modern design and accessories. It might be a tad cluttered, but I really like the space and have always loved everything I've eaten for dinner. This is the first time I've been there for lunch, and jumped on the chance when I saw a burger on the menu. But did it stand up as well as the dinners I've eaten?  The short answer is no. As I said I've really never had any complaints about anything I've had for dinner, but I found several things wrong with this burger. First off, the bun to meat ratio was a bit too high, just more bun than I needed. It didn't help that it was quite dry and really distracted me from the meat...which in turn is a good thing, because even though I ordered it medium-rare as I always do, it was way over cooked. The burger was still surprisingly juicy even with it being more cooked than I'd like, yet by the time I got to the last few bites it was very dry. Overall the meat had little flavor to it, but the char flavor it did have on the outside was quite good. The bacon had a really great smoky flavor, and was cooked properly to have a nice crunch to it. The 'homemade' pickles also had great flavor, but were a bit lost in this burger.  The fries were another disappointment. Typically everything included with my meals at Vintner down to the sides are always great, yet these fries had very little flavor and just seemed a bit too uninspired. I would have expected a black truffle touch or something to them, but no such luck.  Overall the burger did have good flavor, but the dry bun and boring fries didn't help the overall experience too much. While I wouldn't necessarily recommend going here for the burger, I would definitely recommend Vintner Grill any time as a great date spot or just to have a nice dinner.

CQRxwdvWT3vug7a7L6bAsQ.text: This place is a hidden gem.  The decor is stunning, service is gr8 and food is fantastic.  I like  the meat and cheese plates, the  pasta, the pork dish in the covered pan, fish, steak, appetizers and desserts.  The bar has a wide selection of top shelf beverages.  Sure it's hard to find.  Thank goodness or it would be packed.  Gr8 for power lunch, romantic rendez vous, celebrations or happy hour cruising.  Dress up a bit and bring your appetite.

lu-ppsm8luTgc24IjZhO7g.text: My husband and I had dinner at Vintner Grill on Saturday night with four friends.  As usual it was over the top fabulous!  It was our friends first time.  We hit a home run on everything we ordered.  The service was impeccable.  It is truffle season and we started with some pasta with truffles as an appetizer and it was amazing, almost orgasmic really.  Followed by the salads which were all yummy, we tried three different salads including the beet salad and the butter lettuce with brie. I had scallops which were to die for and my husband had the Veal Scallopini.  He said it practically melted in his mouth.  We finished up with a variety of desserts but the tiramisu was the favorite, light and creamy and delicious. Thanks for a great evening...then we were off to Clinton Holmes at Smith Center.

VE0a6hcrcDgzOx8BQ3ZG-A.text: Thanks Yelpers for leading me to this hidden gem of a restaurant. In fact it's literally hidden among office buildings and I would never have been able to find it if it wasn't for the reviews.  I made reservations for Christmas dinner and was surprised to find the place was happening that night. I've never gone out for Christmas dinner before, so I was worried that it was going to be super dead. As soon as we were seated, a server came around with a tray full of bread. There were a bunch of different kinds, pretzel, brioche, olive, wheat and my favorite cranberry bacon. The breads were served with rosemary and sun dried tomato infused oils and salted butter. My only complaint was that the breads were not warm and the server only came around once. Not that I needed any more bread, but had they come again, I probably would have taken one (or many) more of the bacon cranberry.  My mom and I decided to make a meal out of several apps. We started out with the butter lettuce salad and calamari. The butter lettuce salad was very good with a triangle of gooey fried brie. I thought the calamari was okay - not the best I've ever had, but I liked the curry aioli. Next up was the pumpkin gnocchi. The gnocchi itself was a bit sweet, but was offset nicely by the salty prosciutto and crunchy hazelnuts. We managed to only eat half of our flatbread with caramelized leeks, roasted garlic and chili. It made nice left overs for the next day. My grandma had the bouillabaisse which was full of mussels, shrimps, and scallops. I'm not a big seafood eater, but I this was delicious and the broth was so good sopped up with the pesto toasts.  We were pretty stuffed, but had to try dessert. The 3 of us split a huge tiramisu served in a mug. It was probably one of the best tiramisus I've ever had - not too sweet. We barely managed to make a dent in it!  The service was excellent and we were well taken care of all night. Prices were pretty reasonable too.  It's nice to find a great restaurant away from the craziness of the strip.

mHTls5QagT7qD6qcXK-g5g.text: My husband and I love the ambiance of the restaurant. We come here at least 2-3x a month.  Servers are great. Most specially Danny!! He's very friendly, knowledgeable, and very efficient. Knows everything about the menu and we love it!!!. However the hostess was not attentive and unfriendly. I made a reservation through an outside source and she did not confirmed nor check me in so I can get points on my reservation. She did not great us or smile once we arrived. I still give it 4 starts because of the food and the servers!

6D1titOMXQK5Tknop4BRVg.text: Maybe I was just there on a bad night.  It wasn't bad enough that I'm never going back but it definitely didn't live up to the dining experience I was expecting.    Plusses:  Great bar menu, drinks and service.  I'm definitely going back there for drinks.  (Awesome people watching)  Minuses:  Dinner was so-so.  My biggest complaint was the pace of service.  I love a well paced meal but I also like a little attention.  We'd go for 30 minutes at a time without even so much as water top off.  When your water class sits empty (and you've paid for the Voss), that's a sign that they aren't interested.  BTW, I would have pored it myself but they keep the bottles off the table.  They have DJ on Thursday evenings.  Which actually is kind of cool but I wasn't prepared for it and it got a little loader than I was expecting for a "romantic" dining experience.

ei6bswRaBZKJkl0JdkFZxw.text: i guess this place has been here for awhile and i never heard of it.  We had another Christmas dinner here and i really enjoyed my meal.  I had the scallops and risotto.  i am such a sucker for risotto. Huge scallops cooked perfectly.  This place is in a business complex which was sort of weird but the enjoyed the food and the atmosphere was nice.

P5lr9atC47ShUTzUX36mPw.text: I heard rave reviews of this restaurant and being a culinary student I thought it would be fun to go check it out.   I'll start with the good, because it's very limited. The ambiance was lovely. The restaurant is beautifully designed. It screams elegance and luxury. Our main waiter was very attentive and the service flowed smoothly apart from the water catastrophe of 2013...   For some reason the assisting waiter boggled the water 10+ times. We ordered a bottle of sparkling and a bottle of still. He poured people the wrong kind of water over and over again, even at times mixing two types of water. Of course, it was just water, but it distracted from the experience.   On to the food.. what a nightmare!   Rookie mistakes were prevalent from the moment I ordered my salad. I ordered the Treviso Caesar Salad wrapped in Prosciutto with egg and regianno. It was 5-6 awkwardly wrapped, soggy pieces of romaine so soaked in dressing it could have been comparable to a soup. Taking any basic Garde Manger class will teach you that if there's salad dressing left on the plate, or in the bowl, there is too much. I also don't appreciate being served huge, awkward to eat pieces of food. There is nothing elegant about trying to slice up soggy lettuce and scoop it into your mouth. Food should be easy to eat, bottom line. I also have a sneaking suspicion the eggs were canned, hard boiled quail eggs. They had that rubbery feel that's unique to canned eggs. In a fine dining establishment that is just unacceptable.   On to the entrees..   Before I rip my entree apart I want to point something out. It's St. Patrick's day and the restaurant was running a special.. Kobe Corned Beef.. there are so many things wrong with that I don't even know where to begin. Kobe beef is appealing because of the smooth texture and heavy marbling. That's what makes Kobe beef special! Corned beef is generally made from brisket, which has a low fat content and requires long, slow cooking to break the meat down and make it tender. It is boiled, in water so all of the fat cooks out of the meat. Why would someone ever take Kobe beef, and completely ruin it? Think about what you're paying for people! I've seen this done on menus several times, people see "Kobe beef" and immediately go to "expensive" in their head. Well, it is VERY expensive, and you're paying for someone to complete ruin everything that makes it great. My father ordered it and it was extremely dry and unpleasant.   I ordered the beef tenderloin with peppercorn sauce, brie mashed potatoes, and asparagus. When I got my plate the first thing I noticed is that the plate was cold, when you plate sauce underneath a protein on a cold plate, the sauce gets cold. Hot meat, cold sauce. Horrible mouth feel. The tenderloin itself was unimpressive and a little on the dry side. The seasoning was off and I found myself needing salt. The worst foul on the plate however had to be the mashed potatoes. They we lumpy, not creamy, clearly the potatoes did not cook long enough or you wouldn't get that "chunky" feel in your mouth. They also should have been strained. This isn't a small family restaurant, this is a fine dining establishment. At $40 a portion, they need to take the extra time to elevate every aspect of a dish!   My brother ordered the sirloin, it was topped with some sort of compound butter. I didn't taste it, but I saw the plate. The massive glob of butter was sitting on top of the meat completely solid. The point of topping meat with any sort of butter is for it to melt and create almost a sauce and a flavoring element to enrich the beef.   All in all I have to say this is one of the worst fine dining experiences I've ever had. The food is mediocre and tries to hard to be "special" by using ingredients and cuts that are expensive. It doesn't matter how expensive the cut of meat was if you ruin it, and it certainly doesn't matter if you top a salad with truffle oil that lends nothing to the dish. I would not eat at this restaurant again. It is a complete joke and I'm sure it will still do just fine. The fancy atmosphere and menu ingredients will always lure in the yuppies who think they're some sort of culinary authority. Think about what you're paying for and demand better.

zYI4p-rXSu_yLWGPQOcAuQ.text: Very upscale establishment. A little hard to find but a gem nonetheless. Walking into the restaurant there was a very lovely patio that would be very romantic if on a date. I went in alone as I am here on business. I was seated on a very cozy bench along the wall facing out. There were couples all over so I felt just a little out of place. The waitress took very good care of me keeping a watchful eye if I made any indication that I was in need or missing anything. I ordered Veal Scallopini and it arrived very quickly. The presentation and taste were amazing. A little pricey with one glass of wine and just an entree was $45. With this being Vegas and so many places to choose from I am only giving this 4 stars. Definitely a date or business to impress type of restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Scallopini

tKLKnxWPj_N_19Ud97zKIg.text: Went here for my 4th year anniversary back in September. It was also Restaurant week, so it was a good deal. It was kind of hot outside (my fault, I wanted to overlook the pretty decor!) We sat in a cabana like area with cute green pillows. So pretty!!!  For starters, we ordered some foreign beer (the server recommended to the Boyfriend, since it was the highest alcohol content they had) and their specialty drink (for me).   Our entree(s) were a chicken and some pasta dish. The apps were hummus and crispy pita chips. The boyfriend ordered calamari too. We both shared everything.  The food was alright... it was good, but nothing that seemed to stand out except their appetizers..but I really liked their plating though.  I think the only good thing about the restaurant, is the decor. To me it would be exceptional as a wedding rehearsal dinner or spending it with a special loved one.   Overall, great ambiance, "food could be better", also the waiter was knowledgeable and attentive.

fRJ7sXskuIJkm9b4iu2Sdg.text: Was a great recommendation for my wires bday! never even heard of it living in green valley but was very surprised. cool decor and a good mellow atmosphere. Had a good beer menu for a fine dining restaurant (dogfish head) and the food was all great.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good restaurant and not dealing with the strip. A++++ wine menu.

Mcro2ZeRULTHIQDLe_Uc1w.text: Went here to celebrate my one-year wedding anniversary with my husband.  We had wanted to try this place for a long time, and it certainly didn't disappoint!   The quality of food for the price is simply unbelievable.  The food was just as good as any place on the Strip, and much less expensive!  Here's the skinny:  COCKTAILS: Martinis were nicely made, and the blue cheese stuffed olives are TO DIE FOR.   APPETIZER: I'm not much of a "fish" fan (though I love sushi/shellfish), but the ahi tuna appetizer was ah-may-zing.  Very fresh, seasoned well, and I could've literally licked the plate clean.  ENTREES: We decided to split two entrees: the crab stuffed ravioli and the veal scallopini.  As another yelper stated, the crab-stuffed ravioli was generously stuffed with crab.  I think, of the two entrees, this was probably my favorite, though the veal scallopini was pretty excellent as well.    WINE LIST: Simply out of this world!  There were so many options; you can definitely tell their sommelier knows his stuff.  There are options for smaller budgets, up to really large budgets.  We had a prosecco which was rather moderately priced, and it was delicious.    DECOR: Old Hollywood glam.  Reminds me of the Cosmo's decor in a lot of ways.  I loved the sleek white feel.  SERVICE: The service here has gotten some lackluster reviews.  Our service was great; the server was extremely attentive.  We weren't rushed in any way, and every time we needed something, he was right there to help.  The one complaint - which is why I gave this place four stars - is that other than a "Happy Anniversary" as we were leaving the place, our special occasion wasn't even acknowledged.

cbKkxIqL4unJgesgMZzRBQ.text: This is the gem hidden behind a business building.....the best food and cocktail and this restaurant never disappoint. I have been coming to this place because of the quality.you have a cheese and meat selection for an appetizer and when I say selection it varies from soft ,sem-isoft and hard cheese and they serve it with home made jam .and the main course never disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0P-WScPqG4J_EpBY_BvSvQ.text: The food was good but management did not move our party of four to a shaded table after several requests. We baked in the heat on Mothers Day! There were at least 3 shaded tables open. I made my reservation 3 weeks before Mothers Day. We went with our neighbors and we all live nearby. We have been to Vintner Grill many times by this was the worst Mothers Day. We sat there roasting and looking at other shaded tables. I still can't believe it!

xrzcKjYLO4fqmRw4kRN4aQ.text: A solid four rating!! If you read other yelp reviews, they are pretty accurate, the food is excellent!! The service is hit and miss.... Our latest visit was pretty good.... we didn't have reservations, and it was a Friday night, so I would have expected to wait for a table, but instead we were seated right away. It was a long time to get our drink order in.... like I said the service is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars. I had plenty of time to look at the menu, so we placed our order  at the same time as our drinks and I think that got the ball moving.  The cheese selections are excellent!! I personally love a good hard aged cheese. The prices are good the options are good so def don't pass up on trying a couple of selections. My husband and I shared a caesar salad... yummy!! He had the Osso Buco, I had the Short Rib Ravioli.. both were really really good!! Perfectly cooked, portions excellent!  If you know going in that the service might be a little difficult... then I think its easier to deal with.  Lets face it, if you are a foodie like me.... you are going for the food... and thats what this place has, good food!!

v3VRLoq3Px8waRd_cqzSJQ.text: One of my favorite places in town!  The setting is very sexy in the best of ways. If it's your first date take her here because she'll appreciate your style, and if you're looking for a special spot with someone you've known for a long time, she'll love it & it should guarantee a fun evening.   It's all white with black & silver touches and yes it's trendy but bottom line the food is great & the service is usually perfect. It's the perfect balance between feminine & masculine touches. I've been here many times & the only complaint I have is that sometimes the service can lack (when there's large parties). This has happened to us several times. What's great about the service here is that usually the waiter knows things are backed up & that's when a complimentary starter or dessert will pop up. It's always appreciated.   Let's get to the food. I've tried nearly everything & I love it, especially my mans NY strip that comes with crispy potatoes (crispy perfection) and balsamic reduction drizzled over everything. Hands down one of the best items on the menu. The portion is massive so ladies just have a few bites from your partner. I typically order the scallops which always change a little depending on what is in season (it's always delicious). And we never skip starting with the cheese. They have a wide selection and it always comes with a side of jam (this one happened to be apple cinnamon) amazing! Don't skip the cheese...  There's also a beautiful outdoor space that you should take advantage of when the evening weather is nice. It feels like you're in another world and its the perfect sunset dining moment.   If you haven't been here yet it's an absolute must. Make a reservation because evenings are always busy here.

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

GfJjsxQdSnJiUPEoIS4a1Q.text: I finally got to the Vintner Grill which I had been hearing about since moving to Las Vegas in June. What a fabulous place. My chicken salad was delicious. Breads were yummy, ambiance lovely and the price just perfectly fine!  What a great find. Parked in back lot for free. Just terrific. Cannot wait to go back. Loved the menu!!!!!!!!!!

b7jCJMO54SVNQt5Fck5fmw.text: This restaurant is in a very random location, while we were driving there I kept questioning if we had the right address... However, once we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The interior of the restaurant is very nicely furnished and the food was delicious.   The restaurant is very loud, so do be prepared for that. They also pack the table pretty tight.

fVTx66C4AoE_VsbLMvOnyw.text: Been going here since it opened! It's hard to beat this place for its food and character! Not a chain restaurant, and will blow you away with the menu and atmosphere. Try the calamari, the Bouillabaisse, or Steak Medallions, you won't be disappointed. A must stop in Summerlin.

QQSNx9ch_9VsNrgj4n2F8g.text: The ambience is absolutely fantastic and so is the service.  The food?  Marginal.  Everytime I come here, I couldn't remember what I had the last time...it's quite forgettable.  But last night's steak had me chewing on some cartilage. Tsk tsk!  They have a good selection of breads: white chocolate, pretzel, bacon and cranberry, olive, walnut and raisin, etc.  The hummus and crab cakes were good.  The desserts weren't as good as I hoped them to be.  I'd give VG 5 stars if they didn't serve food and wasn't a restaurant and rate them just based on interior design.  But unfortunately, this is not a furniture gallery.

EE5xnB5o9KppOdnfGT-Y8Q.text: Saturday evening. Had to ask the waiter who came to ask for our drinks order about menus. A table next to us who came 15 minutes after us was already eating even though we ordered before. one of the worst dining experience I ever had in a restaurant. Snobbish and rude!

cgLxMRHZhXKVZdwWoWXTyg.text: Just had my birthday dinner here party of 11! We had reservations and were seated immediately the service was excellent our server did a great job and the food was absolutely amazing!!! Can't wait to come back and try their lunch and dine on the patio.

U1-sPQJC9xbVSwCH_NXABg.text: This restaurant always impresses me. The waiters are very knowledgeable and attentive.   The salmon is amazing. I also had a meat and cheese appetizer which was great.

MIrMbOalqcYcEzZvwtJX-Q.text: A few years back,  Vintner Grill set the standard for elegance and sophistication in off-strip dining in Las Vegas.   What happened?  What was probably my 20th dinner there, last week the Consul of Chile and I met a friend from Spain, whom we felt confident would appreciate the introduction.   We were mistaken.  Apart from the 'open during construction' idea which would seem to think you dine out for food alone, the tables in the bar area were no longer clothed.  We immediately noticed that the surface of the table was thick with grease build-up, a sign of lax practices in cleanliness.  This is not the old Vintner!    Two salads ordered were quite good, if unimaginative.  Vintner was always had great risotto, but no longer, at least not according to my shrimp risotto.  The shrimp was of a 99-cent shrimp cocktail quality, with tails left on, just laying on top of the risotto, which itself was so salty as to be inedible.   Add to this the fact that the two gin and tonics I sent back were both flat.  When the waiter told me that was impossible the second time around, I asked for a chardonnay instead.  He asked "what kind?"  I replied to ask what they had, to which he said, "French or Californian."  So much for that whole "vintner" theme, huh?  His attitude told me I'd better choose one, shut up and return to my salt lick.  We had to flag the waiter several times, or have other waiters go find him.  Not pleasant.   I hope they pull it together.  It was a nice place before.  It won't be back until someone credible insists it has successfully risen again!

1WbRwl48o2cZbovlFubW1g.text: Atmosphere is, cozy and exclusive Service was good to a point..we asked for mint leaves with hot water which is not in the menu...  the server refused claiming they ran out.  he lied.I later on ordered to go, a cake and When home,I opened the box to find my cheesecake with fresh mint leaves as a garnish.   Food is ok For a romantic dinner it's a fun place. During spring and summer their outside is wonderful to sit at

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the place, the atmosphere, the service. food is 3.5 stars

tDLkL22AQ06fqQX3T3eXjw.text: Very good food, ambiance and service. I had the gazpacho soup and Vegan Portobello Mushroom Picatta. Both were delicious and had many different layers of taste. I truly enjoyed my meal. Our server was fantastic. Can't wait to go back. Thank you for having a delicious vegan option.

RKhkFqvzLNH9ORg6X9JcaQ.text: We'd like to thank Irving and everyone at vintners grill for the memorable and near perfect evening! Superb food, stellar service, overall fantastic experience. The chef made a special cut of fish to accommodate our special dietary needs, we will be back!

RH6C3GmbhcJ8mL3DGiVi-g.text: Irving was our waiter, and was extremely personable, knowledgeable, and provided us with an exquisite food experience and the service was spectacular. Highly recommend Vintner for anyone looking for a quality evening out.

S-arPbOdj_S65vrwkxLPdw.text: Amazing food! I have not had a bad meal anytime I've come here. They pay very close attention to detail and their service.

cPTN3mugzRiWdZs5Jyro8g.text: Happened to be on this part of town,  looked on Yelp for a place to eat and found this place which had good reviews.   The ambiance is Amazing, an upscale place with AWESOME food and music.   They have a great menu with cheese from all over with specialized meats along with some amazing salads.  We had a 3 cheeses and 2 meats which were pretty good.  We also ordered the Beretta Salad which was one of the best we have had.  We then topped it off with the bone in ribeye and WOW....  This ribeye was extremely well seasoned and the most tender ribeye you will find anywhere.  Talk about a ribeye that melts in your mouth...  Keith our server was the most attentative server I have had.  We are on a Paleo diet and Keith made sure we were not brought any bread and that all the items were within our dietary needs.  I HIGHLY recommend this place.  It is a little more pricey then the average  place but the food is SO MUCH more amazing then ANY place.    In the words of a friend who goes here pretty often, This place is the BOMB!!  You have to try this place at least once if not become a regular, I will be one.

9a6G_8npEZEIMONZpxrSSw.text: I had dinner with friends the other night. It's a very nice place but I'm giving a 2 star because of a server named Jeff. He told me to remove my phone off the table as he gave me my plate of food. I thought it was rude to speak to a customer that way. I should give a 1 star for that. The food was great especially the lamb so that added one more star. Just don't get Jeff as your server.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a must. The lamb was packed with tons of flavor. Not only that but they proceed to pack it with more flavor with the truffle cheese
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad, very artistic. Pretty good

69qx8Mrg8Q6cpYvROWBGpg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Summerlin. The food is always consistent. Highly recommend!

ZnDMpbNEzfofnf7A0pt8lg.text: This was an amazing experience. A truly hidden gem. The food was amazing and the service was impeccable. Thanks Jeff. I would rate this place 10 stars if I could.  I had the Sea bass and boy was it good. My wife had the rib eye and needless to say we shared a lot of our meal it was that good.  The desserts were amazing.  If you like coffee they serve the coffee using a French press, which brings out the flavor of the coffee.  This is a must dinner reservation  you won't be disappointed.

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass

8MTeNFbLrGFz7vDA8z61qg.text: First go - kind of mixed feelings.  The atmosphere is awesome and the service is absolutely top notch.   After an excellent glass of wine and some very yummy cheeses, we were shocked that we haven't eaten here sooner.   Then the entree's came out and they were very...mediocre at best.  It was this way for all four meals at our table.     When we asked some friends about their experience here, it was almost identical to ours: great everything except main courses.

u20gXARKtZ9fP8D4wC03_w.text: VG is an elegant restaurant that imposes that fresh feel the moment you enter. The relatively small footprint of the facility, which centers around a beautiful and inviting bar, provides an energy that tells you the experience will be attentive and to your satisfaction. There's an abundance of staff and the service and food on each occasion we have been, was top rate both in quality and quantity. You will not leave unfulfilled. Great wine list and flights as well as a full bar.  If there is a downside, the tables along the window cheat someone of a view of the beautiful restaurant but the service was so attentive there was never a moment during which I had to turn my head to find our server Bernie (excellent young man).

dOYAZtWrGBpxDdDPfN6kwQ.text: Fun vibe with some serious cocktails and a big menu for lunch and dinner. Overall, there's much to like - from service to a lot of their foods. Coming here with a party of five allowed me to try a number of things, and frequently, the food was very good. Occasionally, some dishes that didn't quite fulfill the promise.  The charcuterie provides a nice sampler that you customize yourself. We opted for a few cheeses only, and were satisfied. The server helped with his expertise. The crispy calamari with haricots vert, lemon and curry aioli is a solid bet for an appetizer, too. We asked for a little marinara or the like for some of our party. They accommodated us pretty much throughout the dinner with the occasional request. Special mention also to the oven roasted beets with baby spinach, lavender goat cheese, mango, hazelnuts and mustard vinaigrette. Flavorful and healthy, this app gives both a lighter option as well as some more complex flavors at work.   For mains: we generally liked the bouillabaisse with mussels, clams, shrimp, snapper, calamari, scallops and saffron broth. (Two at our table ordered it). A good amount of seafood, in a nicely flavored broth.   My own personal choice (the server declared it as one of their best dishes) was the prime bone in ribeye, (with roasted baby sweet potato, heirloom cauliflower, and braised marsala sauce with cippolini onion.) I did not think it was all that great. At 16 ounces with bone, it's certainly big. I ordered it medium rare, and it came much closer to rare. I considered sending it back. My biggest issue with the bone-in ribeye was that the meat itself had way too much gristle. I found this to be after eating about 1/3 of it. It was at times stringy and hard to chew. I ate about 1/2 or 2/3 and took the rest home. While the presentation was good, and some bites were great, my overall take is to not recommend it. Bone In Ribeye is perhaps my favorite steak, and I was not in love. The next time I'm at Vintner's, I would not order this.   There was also a special ravioli (or maybe it's on the menu, though no on their on-line menu). It was very rich, so consider that before ordering. We had a ravioli fanatic order it who felt overwhelmed. Granted she's barely a teenager, but still. Not your standard ravioli.  Do beware of the bread tray: It's way too good, and some folks will no doubt overdo it.   Desserts were very good. The room is gorgeous (if a bit loud). They had a jazz combo the night we went, and they were fantastic. The singer's name is Windy, and they played imaginative covers.  Parking is very easily in the lot. Vintner's is off the beaten track a little, but well worth visiting for an upscale meal, day or night.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vintner Grill
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone In Ribeye. Looks great, has some good flavor, but have definitely had better.

-s2YzlNHr_058DJUKttb3w.text: I have been here many times (after the bad server experience) for lunch with girl friends and all of them have been great experiences. Love how the menu changes seasonally. Usually there are a couple vegetarian options to choose from.  I love the bright modern decor.  I tried the Bianca flat bread, was very reasonably priced $8 for half portion, and half was big enough for me, that I had leftovers! My girlfriend tried the curried chicken salad and that's her long time favorite here, and always gets that.  Nice selection of breads to start, pretzel, olive, bacon and cheese. I love the seasoned butter. Our sever was great and overall was a fun lunch. Will return soon to check out the dinner menu. They have a nice cocktail and wine list.

78pYNgwbja5eH-vmF5QAHA.text: It's been a few years since I've been to Vintner's Grill. I came here a few years ago for a prior companies's holiday party. My friend and I decided to come to Vintner's Grill on a Thursday night. Reservations were made for 5:00 P.M.  Vintner's Grill is pretty easy to get to. You take the 215/Charleston. It's right off of Indigo road, inside a executive suite area.   There was a private party outside, looked like a wedding, and the members were seated in a private room inside. There was a lot of people here for a Thursday night, but my friend and I were seated towards the back corner with a table of two.  The service was absolutely amazing! I haven't had spectacular service like this in a long time. We were greeted immediately by three different waiters. We had drink menus offered with water. Our drink orders were immediately put in and then another waiter came by with a wide variety of selection of breads/butter. I ended up selecting the bacon/cheddar and potato pretzel bread. Both flavor profiles were very good. The bread was not dry or dated. It tasted fresh. The butter that was provided was a green/red type of butter. Both were good on each types of bread.  We then ordered off the main menu. My friend got a steak and I selected the crispy grilled chicken (no mustard), spicy broccoli, and the mac n cheese.   The crispy grilled chicken was cooked to perfection. It was not under-cooked nor dry. It was also quite a large chicken breast. The Mac N Cheese had a variety of cheese melted together. It was also served on a cast iron bowl. The spicy broccoli was a little too spicy for me. I couldn't eat it, but brought it back for left-overs for other family members to munch on.   For dessert, we selected the lava cake with vanilla ice cream, no berry compote. We waited a little bit for the dessert, but that would be normal if you were cooking a lava cake fresh. The lava cake tasted home-made. The chocolate wasn't over-powering. The Vanilla Ice Cream was the perfect touch to mix with the chocolate lava cake.  Vintner Grill is a upscale restaurant, but for the price you pay, the experience is worth it. It's classy restaurant, but the ambiance inside is relaxing and laid back. It was nice just to chill out and enjoy the low light ambiance, live band music playing. If you haven't been to Vintner's grill, you need to check it out, at least once!

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

beI3tUXfVtmdFrqFUTdFjA.text: This restaurant is fine dining done right. The service was top notch and the food was exceptional.  The server made numerous recommendations for wines and cheeses, which made for an exquisite meal.  I am a foodie and this cuisine ranks with some of the best I have dined at.

ggJtt0Yc0uLgjn7xh2TTuQ.text: Time for an update on dinner at Vintner Grill. Our party of 4 arrived a few minutes before the 6:30 PM reservation time and were immediately seated. Seating was a comfortable half booth. The dining room decor has not changed and looks as fresh as years ago. Service from Scott was on point and he was helpful in selecting our entree.  The complementary bread basket had a great assortment. The entrees of choice were Grilled Atlantic salmon with steamed yukon wedge potato and baby vegetables  Prime beef tenderloin, 8oz. with potato puree, grilled asparagus and red burgundy reduction was requested in place of the peppercorn sauce.   John Dory with spaghetti squash, asparagus and cherry tomatoes. A  nice firm piece of fish very similar to halibut  Dessert was a creamy cheese cake with raspberry sauce and just the right about of cream.  All of the entrees were prepared as requested and service was timely.  The dining room was on the upper edge of conversation friendly and with a lower noise level would make it five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Cake
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atlantic Salmon
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Beef Tenderloin - 8 oz

52rRc87tNLqZEoY7Yx49Lg.text: We came here with a few girl friends to have a few drinks and some laughs.  We originally made reservations for the patio to enjoy this perfect Vegas weather however there was an event that has booked out the entire patio section. We settled for a booth that easily and comfortably sat the 5 of us.  Our server was Tony and she was perfect for our group of friends! She was able to share a few laughs with us!  I will say this place is probably more for a luncheon or romantic dinner with your special someone. We weren't loud but when we did laugh it was fairly noticeable that fellow customers were not too happy and their stares were highly DISAPPROVING. None the less we continued our dinner and 2 drinks their Mac and cheese is a must try as well as their flatbreads: Bianca and Italian sausage!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Sausage Flatbread
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free - Range Half Chicken

PWnw0eBcCz_A9Dy0MoSj4w.text: This is one of the best restaurants on or off the strip. I have been here several times and I know the secret!!! Dont eat too much before your entree.   I remember my first trip here. The food was amazing and I couldnt get enough. Then when we came back we ordered so many appetizers and salads that by the time my meal came I was full and couldnt really enjoy my entree. While they were all great none of them wowed me like my entree.   My most recent visit I didnt order anything before my meal. I went straight for the bone in ribe eye. Yes it was just as delicious as I had remembered the first trip.  They have perfected the rib eye. Its very intimidating when you see this huge steak plated in front of you. It was the size of a disc golf frisbee.  I did save room for desert. Tiramisu. Delicious but I wish I had just eaten more of my steak.  cocktails here are always wet and satisfying.   You cant beat the ambiance. The location is unassuming in a commercial office building. But you know youve arrived as soon as you open the doors.   I can't wait to go back.

ch7PT2tZIFdCsrtMcehuFg.text: This local spot is a perfect for any occasion whether date night, friends outing or holidays, you won't be disappointed here. Their menu is amazing and the ambiance is so appealing. They have a beautiful patio built into the stone walls with cabanas. Their restaraunt is very large with old school movies playing and a bar that even has 5 machines if you're feeling lucky to play.  With all the Summerlin restaraunts to choose from, we always turn to this spot for a nice experience. We normally dine at the bar but recently they've redone their barstools and they're so high. It was uncomfortable to eat and I kept knocking my knee against the purse hook. The bartender did say they were new chairs and had been receiving some negative feedback about them from guests so maybe they'll lower their height in the future.   Regarding food, I always order their vegan piccata but its not 100% vegan. The menu says "Vegan Piccata" with butternut squash and Portobello mushroom but they use real butter. When I asked why does the menu read Vegan if its actually Vegetarian and the response was I don't know.  So since I have a lot of Vegan followers, this dish is abs delish but make sure to request no butter for their "Vegan Piccata".  Service is always amazing

r3ZwLf4Y9lSgIxo7wM3NnA.text: Our close friends surprised us with this special dinner at Vintners Grill. We were so excited, because we have been talking about this establishment for over a year! Now we've made it!! We started out with some delicious starters. Octopus and fingerling potatoes and roasted beets with goat cheese. Well I would have taken a picture of the dishes... but they were soooo good. The octopus was perfectly prepared, tender and full of flavor. The beets were equally an epicurean delight.   The main coarse arrives, steak and lamb. Ok where do I start. Both were prepared to perfection. But the lamb was out of this world delicious. Whether you come here on a special occasion as we did or just want to treat yourself to a fabulous dinner, you won't leave disappointed. The atmosphere and service are on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was Fantastic! Lol
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moroccan Spiced Lamb Spare Ribs
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shaved Ribeye Sirloin

4JEZI_IkFBLta3h0Qkv8Vg.text: If I could provide a 10* I would. This is an incredible hidden gem. Enjoyed the wine and cheese pairing and lamb Bologna's tonight. Geez. That home made pasta is exceptional. I'm so thrilled I moved within a 15 min drive of Vintner Grill. When friends and family would like to enjoy a gourmet outstanding meal in a nice venue, we'll go here. It's consistently exceptional.   I was going to take some of the lamb home but I enjoyed every bite. Sooo good.

2l5Akkvm2jorIdWboLS4KA.text: I love this restaurant.  The food is amazing.  I always go with the bouillabaisse.  It's so good and filled with seafood.  Some of the best I've ever had. Highly recommended.  They also have lots of different cheeses you can order before your meal.  Very nice restaurant.  Been coming here for years.

1l7Am_HbDBuBYaHRPpNNnQ.text: Never disappoints, classy, delectable food...what more can I ask for?   We come here often and I always love a good excuse to dress up for date night  Food; I had the beet salad which I'd give a 3/5 because the proportion of spinach to beets was too much and overpowering the beets and not enough goat cheese   I had the luxury of ordering the Bouillabaisse which I would give a 5/5 tonight and WOW, for a $33 soup I had high expectations which it fully delivered. It is a very large bowl of Scallops, Snapper, Calamari, Shrimp, and Mussels in a rich and buttery mouthwatering sauce. Would def order again but should have skipped the salad so I could have eaten all of the soup!   Service;  We were early with our reservation but we did have to wait at the table for 15min before being offered a beverage other than water. We weren't in a hurry but I started getting thirsty. The rest of the meal it was as good as it always is.   Ambiance;  Modern, rustic, elegant, trendy, posh, and glam all mixed together.

nADBew3ilID_A-YE3zAnuw.text: It was our first time trying this place and it definitely won't be our last. Drinks were excellently prepared. Atmosphere, if seated in the restaurant, is elegant yet relaxed. Charcuterie board was delicious with a wide selection of cheese and meats. Dinner was amazing. We had the half-chicken and veal. Both were extremely tasty and full of flavor. For dessert, we had the carrot/cheese cake hybrid and oh my goodness was it awesome. Service was very good and we'll absolutely make our way here again.

8tnpYw_HEDHA9wBCw6bfrg.text: Had a great time at Vintners grill! I never thought sitting at a bar would be so much fun, but Jose the bartender was great! Will 100% be back!
