d3zHBugVSpUyih-XOIwj5g.text: July 2012 we have been here about four times the past three years with various levels of success. This review will be on our most recent trip. There were four of us, one underage for drinking. This restaurant is truly a gift to the summerlin part of Vegas, only wish they could more consistently pull it off. Atmosphere: the appearance of the grill may be one of its greatest strengths. It's located in an office park but offers valet parking. Once you leave the parking lot ou enter what appears to be a green and black oasis with outside seating in three sided tents that make even 90 degree days possible outside. Inside, is the appearance of a lounge with sofa like booths and pillows scattered among them. The reality is that sitting in those booths is uncomfortable, pick a chair.  There is a large bar and bar table seating area when you enter. Service: We were greeted and seated quickly and our waiter quickly introduced himself. Immediately he was very familiar, wanting to call us by our first names and acting like we were buddies. This is not a style of service we desired, so this was an irritating factor that got increasingly irritating. When the waiter said to our underage diner, "go ahead and order a drink, I won't tell." we were less than happy, but he thought it was funny. Food:  we started with a combination cheese charcuterie platter and some cocktails. You select as many cheeses as you desire from a long and very interesting list divided by type of milk. This list is truly a strength. Then there is a selection of charcuterie including boar and elk. We tried both and they were good. The cheeses were all good. They are served with some dried fruit, crackers and honey.  The mains were all fine but way too much going on.  It was hard to decipher any particular flavor. I had the ravioli, which is a very small serving of several raviolis that are a bit hard in the edges. One of us had a dish with apricots where the apricots were clearly not ripe and had no flavor. In fact, we didn't believe they were apricots except that is what the menu said. They have several distinct cocktails but some good old fashioned cocktails would have been appreciated. When we left the waiter said, "can I call you bob" when he saw the credit card. Just too much familiarity. This is a restaurant with hits and misses. Stick to the simpler things for better chance of getting the hits.

djE5Co3kK_er-WNhkcqkQw.text: The restaurant was cute and decorated in a modern theme! But it was a Saturday night and they had over 80 reservations, the waiter rushed through every single thing he did, and didn't really listen to what we had to say. We were with a big party and being squished into a corner with other big parties. The food was great but wish the service would have been better.

AOJbxsq2veKqKlcttrPsWA.text: Service - 9 Atmosphere - 8 Food - 9 Vegetarian Friendly - 7 General Awesomeness - 8  I was really thrown off by this restaurant being in a business park, that and they offer a valet service that could require more walking than if you just parked yourself.  However, once you peel back the pretentious mask, this place is dynamite.  We had a really funny and helpful server, great wine selection, amazing cheeses and a gorgeous bar.  The night I was there offered no vegetarian entrees, so the chef put together a surprise for me, which was delightful. If you can look past the pompous cars in the valet and the 50 year olds in Ed Hardy gear, Vintner Grill is a real gem.

YjlrA7Cx36RyPcTvo41ypw.text: Vintner Grill is proof that not all restaurants worth going to are located on the Las Vegas Strip. This hidden gem in Summerlin is perhaps one of the best local restaurants that Las Vegas and Summerlin have to offer.  The restaurant is a bit hard to find and located in an office building complex that catches you by surprise. Once you find the location, you walk past the most pleasantly decorated patio before you walk into the very metropolitan styled restaurant.  For starters, the Moroccan spiced lamb spare ribs with apricot glaze and carrot-almond slaw is an absolute must. The lamb is cooked to a perfect medium rare (and you should never ask it to be otherwise) and jammed packed with succulent flavor.   The risotto here is my go to entree of choice. The pan seared diver scallops with shaved pecorino, heirloom tomato and sweet corn risotto is creamy, smooth, buttery, and everything you could possibly wish for. I found myself dissecting the perfectly cooked scallops into smaller and smaller pieces so I could savor the taste as long as I could.  The prime beef tenderloin with peppercorn sauce, brie potato puree and grilled asparagus is big enough to feed two and the brie potato puree rivals the steak itself as the high light of the dish.  To finish it off, any restaurant that can make a decent macaroni and cheese is all right in my book, and Vintner Grill offers a macaroni and cheese side dish that is absolutely to die for.  The tiramisu dessert comes in a giant cup but is never enough to satisfy.  The restaurant is oddly adaptable. It's a great place to have a business meeting, a great place to take your friends to socialize, and it's also a beautiful restaurant worthy of a date night with a significant other.  The martinis at the establishment utilize an amazing assortment of fruits and berries and are quite delicious. The blueberry drink they had on their clip board drink list was refreshing.

B4YhR1rPjD5BDA12h7CZAg.text: I have been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner.  First off the decor is awesome and is hands down the best part of the restaurant.  They have a nice patio for nice evenings or afternoons as well.    The bad, well not terrible but not that good, was the food.  I don't remember what I had except for some fancy burger for lunch that I didn't enjoy much.  I went with good friends and tried a few different things and just wasn't impressed, unmemorable I guess and I was just there about a month ago.  Actually I do remember the cheese platter we had and they have a large selection to choose from, the portions were real small, even for a cheese platter.  My girlfriend had a flatbread for lunch and is wasn't that remarkable either.     The service we had both times was not so good, lunch being pretty bad, no where near the service of rosemary's, not even close.  I guess if I am going to spend over a 150 bucks on dinner for two I want incredible food with excellent service, anything less and I am just disappointed.  I don't know whats up but both meals I had here just fell flat.    It seems like the owners set out to make the coolest restaurant off the strip, they did.  The place is real cool and they put effort into having a cool menu with elaborate descriptions.  Perhaps I just prefer having food that taste great, satisfies, and speaks for itself, I don't know.

d7rsLO75I87mJ2vQdH8BqA.text: Vintner Grill is so special to us as it's where my boyfriend & I went on our first date here. We decided to celebrate Valentine's Day there tonight and it was superb. We were greeted promptly & genuinely by a great host. Our server Bernardo (not quite sure of the spelling) went far above and beyond to make our experience memorable. He was pleasant, professional & friendly. He knew the menu thoroughly & made lovely suggestions. He was very enthusiastic and when I suddenly didn't feel well due to a recent round of chemo he immediately got us our check & arranged for dessert to go in a flash. His compassion and empathy was greatly appreciated as I was afraid I was going to have to head to the hospital. He genuinely wished me well and invited us back. The food was phenomenal as we went with a delicious cheese plate and the Valentine's Day surf & turf. Compliments to the chef! The amuse Bouche was extraordinary and my lobster tail & filet mignon were absolutely perfect. Our Busser was also very attentive and friendly. We will be back after my next round of chemo to celebrate & are hoping to have our engagement party there on their gorgeous patio! Well done to the team, especially our server whom went above and beyond for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S5yuYSDfbTl36e7UOTn8ZA.text: Wow-- I cannot believe I am writing an updated 1 star review to my previous 5 star. Let me start by saying that I booked my reservation through Open Table like I normally do. We were celebrating a birthday and I put a note in the message box for Vintners to see so I wouldn't have to do it at the restaurant. I asked twice before we were seated to make sure they checked me in.   When we were seated the waiter seemed nice enough. We placed our order which included a cheese plate, hummus and he calamari to start. Right away the waiter was trying to up sell us on every item. I felt like I was at a fast food restaurant. It was very strange. They have never done this here before. All apps were brought out at the same time. So much for enjoying the cheese plate with my nice bottle of Opus One. While we were eating the apps I asked the waiter to please check and make sure they had checked me in on my reservation. He assured me they had.  We then placed our order for dinner and the BF and I both ordered the bouillabaisse which has been amazing every time we have been here. Of course the waiter did his up sell and offered us a chance to add pasta to it. Sounded okay so we did it. When the bouillabaisse came out I could tell right away something was wrong. The scallops were raw, shrimp was raw and when I took a bite of a mussel it was cold and had the worst metal taste to it. That was it for me, I could not finish it. I could also not get that metal taste out of my mouth. The manager was at my table within seconds and asked me if everything was okay. I told him the problem and he took the dish away. The BF continued to pick at his. But eventually had to give up as his was raw too. Before we could tell the manager, the bus boy came by and took it away.  The waiter came by to let me know he had removed the entire dish from my bill. I would expect him to remove the entire dish since it was raw. He acted put out like he was dong me a favor. After he cleaned the table, I could tell that they did not see my note about the birthday so I asked for the check. They did not remove the BF's meal which I found to be rude. We paid the check and left. On my way out, I asked the hostess again if she had checked me in, she said yes. This really angered me, if they had checked me in, they would have noticed the birthday note.  When I got home I received an email from Open Table that Vintners had cancelled my reservation. You have got to be kidding me!! What a joke. I called the manager and basically he said all he could do was apologize. Apology not excepted.  Within an hour of getting home we both became very sick with food poisoning. All night long we were very sick and still not feeling well tonight. Vintners should be ashamed of themselves! We will never be returning. This place has really gone downhill.

OI2UxR2pAS_0rsX0pzGLIA.text: My husband and I went to the Vintner Grill for our second time last night. The food ad service always shine. Despite being a kind of fancy place, the portion sizes as pretty large. We had the crispy chicken and 16 oz ribeye. The chicken skin was crisp to perfection with a hint of sweetness from the honey; while the meat inside was still moist. The port reduction on the ribeye was a perfect light complement to this cut, which was cooked perfectly medium. I find that many restaurants get the internal doneness wrong. I will continue to suggest this restaurant to friends and return. My only regret about this place is that I didn't know they did weddings there before we got married. Who doesn't want an amazing meal on their special day?

UdQx__rMQxukqaQHMhsLYA.text: I went here for lunch today and I am definitely going back. To start, beautiful restaurant. The seats are comfortable, the ambiance is relaxing and fresh, and the service is impeccable. I started with a lovely tomato soup that came with a grilled toast place within the soup topped with goat cheese. Absolutely delicious. I had the halibut which came with a lovely couscous and orzo side that was absolutely delicious. The halibut was cooked perfectly and the size was perfect for lunch. I then had a zabaglione for dessert and it was really good, similar to strawberry shortcake in the best way. My friend started with a lovely salad and followed with a beautiful chicken breast with salad and summer vegetables. It too was incredibly good.  These were off of the power lunch menu, which we really liked. It allows you to have an appetizer followed by an entree and dessert, and all are just the right size to have you full by the time you're done. The portions are generous without being overbearing. The dishes are absolutely beautiful when they come to your table. The glass of Prosecco was just the perfect amount of sweetness without being overbearing. The prices are reasonable, and once again, the service is bar none one of the best in town. This restaurant is an absolute must if you have never been here and a place people will go to over and over again if they have. 5+ stars.

Pgy-ObG-dwNMSME2oeTbKQ.text: Been here twice and In love with the cheese plates. We ordered the salmon, hanger steak, salad with beets.

odreFt4qeuF6TFS0OVxwzA.text: Came here on mother's day for my mom.  Amazing foods and amazing waitress.  The host and floor manager was great, they made us felt very welcome.  Thanks to my friend Patrick for getting us a table.

yApvdRJhX9XyoXWyi8p_jA.text: Took my bf here for his bday last year and we were both amazed by everything in this place - interior, exterior, servers, ambiance, and most especially the FOOD! My bf loves his steak and he said this is the best steak he's ever had here in Vegas! Their wine selection is amazing as well! Bf loved everything about his food and this place! We are definitely going to be back!  PS you gotta try their bolognese! Like OMG MELTS IN YOUR MOUTH FOODGASM

IKedfrhUsTOG9iqKtGe9LA.text: I wish so badly the service was as good as the food!  We came here today to grab lunch during the work day and ended up sitting for what was a two and a half hour meal because the service was so slow.   We ordered the white bean hummus, a three cheese plate and three out of the four of us ordered a power lunch including Cesar salad, tomato burrata, cucumber soup,sea bass, lamb bolognese, the falafel Burger with sweet potato fries and Lemon cheesecake.   Everything was delicious, the sea bass was cooked perfectly and served with a sweet sauce and potatoes, the cheese plate was full of sharp flavors from the 6 year aged cheddar, the fontina and the mild ricotta while served with figs, apricots and a sweet strawberry spread, the hummus was creamy with garlic notes and topped with salty olives and cherry tomatoes and the lamb bolognese was a healthy portion of tender pieces of braised lamb and the pasta was cooked a perfect al dente.   Our complaints are that our drinks were never filled, we had to ask for refills three times, our bread was served without butter which when asked for showed up 5 minutes later, our plates were not cleared in good timing, each dish we ordered took entirely too long to come out, even the salads and when we asked for more bread and the check it took ten minutes to get each. These are the reasons we sat for two and a half hours. Completely unnecessary for a work lunch.   I enjoyed the the decor as it was clean, simple and beautiful. The food was all served in impressive artistic forms and the menu had a wide variety of wonderful dishes, comfort food and unique dishes.
