Q_Bt9p_KS_0mJUqDPY9Gvg.text: Wild mushroom  risotto, veal scallopini! Wonderfully subtle hints of seasoning.  Veal well portioned and prepared. Worth the dime...

6Qqwy4EvBTW5KR2wXmCHlA.text: This place is amazing, had a post Valentine dinner and I must say the experience,vibe and atmosphere was on point. Music was lovely to listen too. Our bartender jose made the adventure and experience more  memorable. Defitnetly will be back again. Thank you.

LEBOtEnADgrFSU3bY5DMKA.text: Food:  4 stars for presentation and quality, it's pretty spendy and the portions aren't that big so be prepared for a hefty check if you want to leave full  Wait staff:  SLOW, EXTREMELY SLOW.  At expensive restaurants they tend to take their time so you don't feel rushed, but our server was either overbooked or completely unaware I was trying to get his attention so we could order appetizers before our other guests showed up.  He appeared overwhelmed and focused on too many things at once.  Ambiance: (READ BELOW) Upscale yet Tacky at the same time.   Why this place gets a 2:  This is the first time I've been at an upscale restaurant where they play movies on giant screen TVs during dinner.  It was VERY ODD.  This was also my first time here and we had work guests with us so you'd think when they placed us at a table they'd ask us if we'd be alright with a giant TV to my back (Literally behind me).  No one was even watching the movie so I asked them to turn it off, so the server said he'd take care of it.  It never turned off.    Then I grabbed him again and asked him if they were going to turn it off, then he "apologized" and said we "always play movies during dinner" ... So not sure if this guy is dumb or he  just wanted to shut me up by telling me he'd turn it off the first time I asked him.     Long story short I had decent food but had to watch bright lights repeatedly bounce off my guests faces since they were facing the TV.  This essentially killed the entire dinner mood and we ate as fast as we could and left.  I won't be taking my clients here anymore.

xVhje04CnZ_rrhxU9Uh6Qg.text: Great bar and lounge area. In over 10 years have never had a bad brunch or dinner. Decent service, excellent food and service. Outside patio is great in spring and fall. If your in the area, must go!

oEqTWhnGfs68ZgSxKR71Xg.text: Mixed bag. Pros: setting is gorgeous and ambiance is great. Especially outdoor area. The bread is delicious. Cons: service was subpar. We were waiting for our check forever. The food was OK but not amazing.   We came to celebrate a special occasion. And it felt special to be there. Unfortunately, we will not be coming back.

ytYcPDsVmTdnsV39z5JnYg.text: Dine among sexy and the sexy cougars.  Off strip in the Summerlin, you won't see it from the main streets, just off Charleston & everyone's favorite to say street, Hualapai ("Wall-a-pie").  You'll be surprised how they've sandwiched a fine dining place within a corporate plaza and offices.  The food and service is top notch.  I've been a handful of times, catching happy hour to dining first class all-the-while mainly with Summerlin locals.  White leather, browns, greens, chandeliers sets the ambiance ablaze.  Plus, their is a blaze of fire with outdoor firepits in luxurious outdoor patio seating.  Recommended ============ 1.  Roasted Beet salad with lavender goat cheese, mango, hazelnuts and mustard vinaigrette dressing (5.0 stars, $10)  2.  Italian Sausage Flatbread with burrata cheese, roasted peppers, pesto sauce ($12, 4.5 stars)  3.  Wild Mushroom Risotto with preserved lemon, pepper, and shaved pecorino ($24, 4.5 stars)  4.  Braised Lamb Osso Bucco with couscous, shallots, and swiss chard ($32, 4.5 stars)  Conclusion ========= With service always pro, food great, this is a great off-strip place to save a few dollars without skimping on experience.  Shhhh...hidden secret.    Parking Tip: you can valet, or park a ten spots over and not have a problem in the lot.

QaqXN25W3eW9zJ--4CWvhQ.text: The prices and the quality of food have gotten better here since I've been three years ago. I've been here three days in one week and surprisingly happy that Vitner Grill is going strong. I've been here for lunch twice and dinner once last week.  The lunches are excellent and a good value. They have a three course Power Lunch for $25. They also have many entries and salads at half portions. I've had crab cake, seared tuna salad, pear salad, snapper, salmon, romescu sauce flat bread, and all of it has been great. The flash fried calamari was tasty but the ones on the bottom of the pile were soggy not crispy. The flash frying gives incredibly tender calamari at the price of having them crispy. I think they have one a solid tiramisu. Cheesecake is okay. The chocolate tart is good too. It's not as pretentious as some make it out to be. The decor is nice and upscale but if you're more comfortable in jeans, I'd go in jeans. It's mostly people dressed in business attire but I think it could be a Summerlin neighborhood joint as well. The staff isn't consistent. One day they didn't offer us bread. Another day they gave me a used white napkin. Another time, I was sitting at the bar, at the server asked what I wanted because he didn't think I was there to eat. He's right - not a lot of Koreans eating here, but still odd to ask a customer sitting at a bar waiting for the menu. On the other hand the staff were friendly.  I really contemplated giving them a 3 but I think it's more of a 4.

zKfujTtkdiYyqRDgjO7eEg.text: Second time going here (24th anniversary) first was 5 stars, this was a 2 star dinner unfortunately.  Cheese plate is the highlight, service was awkwardly slow, "the Aviator" drink is disgusting...they've lost their touch.  If you want good steaks and drinks, go down to Herbs & Rye on Sahara.

Efc9MjmXy389CFK9QGC_4A.text: This is a great place for people watching, especially if you want to grab a few cocktails and play spot the cougar on a prowl.  The ambiance and decor are very old school Vegas and the vibe is very Mad Men-esque. The design is simple with a gorgeous patio for outdoor dining and interior that boasts secluded booths with TVs playing old black and white motion pictures. We arrived on a Thursday night assuming it would be pretty mellow. WRONG. It was some company's appreciation party so the place was pretty packed. We were able to snag a table without having reservations. I would strongly recommend reservations just to be on the safe side. We were seated and shortly after the server came by and took our drink order. We started off with a bottle of Fiji and I had their G&T and my husband one of their martinis. The cocktail prices range from $10-$15, but are masterfully prepared. We started off with a 3 cheese plate and went solely based on our server's recommendations. We opted for a soft cheese, blue cheese, and a firm cheese selection. All of them were phenomenal. There is also a 5 cheese selection option for $25 if you'd like to sample more. The 3 cheese selection was plenty for the two of us to share. The platter is accompanied by warm brioche along with raisins and marmalade.  I chose their roasted pepper with crab soup as my starter dish. The flavor was extremely unique, but once my taste buds adjusted I thought it was wonderful. It was creamy, rich, and had a generous portion of crab. I opted for the lamb bolognese as my entree, husband went with the Mediterranean Sea Bass with heirloom potatoes. I appreciated the bolognese, but found the flavor to be a little too rich for my personal taste. The lamb and ricotta combination just made it overpowering and quickly filled me up. The sea bass was perfectly cooked. It was flaky and flavorful.  The service was to the point, offering some great suggestions. Initially i thought the server appeared aloof, but I think he was just swamped. He was happy to help with our cheese selections, and our water was constantly refilled. Their pacing and scheduling was on point. I'd like to come back here for lunch and try the cobb salad that my husband keeps raving about.  Overall, I think this is a great date spot that's sure to impress.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. G&amp;T cocktail
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediterranean Sea bass
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 cheese plate $15

Si_qfI327W5BLWYZspvt3Q.text: I don't understand the hype of this place... at, all.  The decor is 100% beautiful and the free bread is AMAZING! But that's where the compliments end.   I have eaten here about 10 times over the past decade and have yet to leave feeling full or happy. The prices are too high. The food choices are pretentious. The service is repeatedly bad, and that's literally every single time we've been here.   I really want to like it because so many other locals do, but I personally just don't get it. Sorry

uNP8Elw5bU7FlvYzY9dM9g.text: The last time I came here was many years ago so I was excited to come back with a new experience. To start off, the restaurant is pretty empty during the day so it was quiet.   The bread came out on a platter and the waiter would put the bread that you choose on your plate. I don't know why but I feel like the bread sets your first impression of the food. The waiter that served our bread had a stone cold face. He looked like he did not want to be there. Our bread was cold and hard. Tears of disappointment... The butter had crushed peppers and another with basil (I think) with oil. The butter had the consistency of chalk :(   Our waiter who took our order was bright and nice. He was glad to help us with our choices.   First off, I ordered the lamb bolognese. It was very heavy. The ratio of lamb to pasta was unbalanced. There was twice the amount of lamb to pasta. I ended up putting some lemon juice and it was a lot better.   The crab ravioli was cooked very well, but the filling was nehhh. The main component of the dish was the mushroom sauce.   This isn't the place I would want to spend a lot of money on ok food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb bolognese
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab ravioli
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

0d0hcgLepjPJP-q6KEVxog.text: We were pleasantly surprised at the beautiful interior and exterior of the restaurant. We had heard the food was good and it exceeded our expectations. We live one block away and will return again soon. It is a real neighborhood find!   They are handicapped accessible, which is important for my husband. Everyone was friendly and we had a lovely time on our belated anniversary celebration. I had put our anniversary in the online reservation I made through Open Table, but they did not acknowledge it when we were at dinner.

SAoQnVnoBbKNOcO9IDkQWw.text: Good Food, however, they will do everything in their power to boost the bill... These servers have been trained like car salesmen.. Pushy on add on's.  Slow to bring bread and covet the bread as if they would not want to miss out selling you an extra.  Brought guests one time and the waiter kept insisting on bringing out a Seafood Platter.  I mean insisting!!!  I had to finally speak up and be firm with him and say NO, Thank you!  You could see his anger...  The rest of the meal... He ignored us.  This use to be the Best... Not anymore.  Waiters disappear...they need to be nicer and give better service to their Bread and Butter.  Management must be the reason... I heard that they have their "RA RA RA meetings to figure out how to SELL YOU... Not SERVE YOU...  Listen up Management!  Your Patron's are smarter than you think!  Try having a meeting on good SERVICE.  Lots of great Restaurants out there...

ytw7UNMjPzc6BdlPj_lMcQ.text: Went last night for a dinner date and absolutely loved the Vintner Grill.  It is tucked away in a business center and from the outside looks pretty normal... then, upon walking inside it turns into a decadent world with beautiful decor and a pristine ambiance of light color and mellow serendipity.  The menu feature a fresh cheese, app/dinner, and wine page.... simple, yet copious flavors from every dish, attentive waiter and great atmosphere made this place a 5 of 5.  Dinner for two with a good bottle for about $100 isn't too bad at all.

zuMG4uv83mex__r1WTBSGw.text: I love this place. Its beautiful, food to die for and in general good service.

3cfq4pdQDYBfAISDIWo-Yg.text: You could totally miss this place if did not know what you were looking for. It looks like it is in an office building or work place. We had a friend take us for lunch a while back and I really had a bad experience. We came back recently for a group dinner and my experience changed. I always loved the decor, its very different, trendy, bold colors of green, white, black. We started with the calamari and hummus. The calamari came with a curry flavored dip which was very good. I don't like their menu because it's pages on a clipboard and you have 1 page of cheese, 1 page of food, and about 15 pages of wine. We tried a meat and cheese plate which seemed good although I'm not a big fan of that. For my entree, my bf ordered the boar pasta, and it had a very good flavor to it. I debated between the halibut and the bouillabaisse. I've never really had the bouillabaisse but I only wanted to try it because it said it had saffron in it. And it looked good with baby lobster, scallops, mussels, clams and calamari. The waitress said that dish was featured in wine magazine so of course I had to go with that dish. It was delicious, very light, and the seafood was all delicious.   My only complaint was the service was a tad bit slow when we were ordering but maybe that is because we kept ordering appetizers, the wine took awhile to order, (so the waitress and sommelier were busy taking these orders and setting our table with wine glasses and such).   We also had dessert and the portions were HUGE! It's enough for maybe 3 people to share. So we tried the strawberry shortcake, the chocolate eclairs which were soft, but i thought eclairs were crunchy, and the tiramisu. The tiramisu was my favorite although everyone else thought it was too sweet.

MytHaGPR2YW6Y0DXLmD7lw.text: Hideaway in Howard Hughes business center and I like that. The music was very good upbeat blues/jazz and the game was on =)  I think they let you sit at first for a little bit to take everything in, the hip atmosphere and the full capacity of the insiders who dine frequently.  The energy of the guests tell all and everyone seemed to be thoroughly enjoying their restaurant.  The breads were ok, a little too hard for my preference but what you put on the bread is what made it worth it.  The wine list is quality which I can very much appreciate since so many restaurants will carry unnecessary bottles that are not even well selected.  The flavors is what you come here for.  Risotto, scallops, NY steak etc. had memorable flavors.  The quality is very satisfying and I am eager to return soon.

ybyG4ES9lvXn9hedTc90kQ.text: Have heard from locals that I must try. I have only been for lunch but would like to come back for cocktails or dinner. The service and ambiance were great, but my food was average. Great scenery though, the patrons have made many plastic surgeons wealthy!

xoL3qqdC_fVNBaE_y_Po3Q.text: Beautiful decor and delightful food! This is, in my opinion, the best off-strip place for a great culinary experience. I love the artisanal cheeses and ever-changing menu. Reservations are often necessary and I always run into people I know there, so be prepared for that. If possible, request an outdoor cabana at least once. It is really peaceful. The trees strategically control the view and shelter from main street viewing.

Y0s5zX7_t9zVqaK_viVjGw.text: My boyfriend took me this restaurant for my 26th birthday. We were gonna do a typical steakhouse/seafood place, and instead he brought me here on a recommendation from his boss. Right when we got inside and looking at the plush couches and pillow style dining I knew we were in for something different. From the service, ambiance, food, cocktails, everything was perfect. The Moroccan spiced lamb was amazing. I had the Prime Beef tenderloin that was cooked and seasoned to perfection. My boyfriend had the halibut, which he really didn't like as much as my tenderloin. But besides that, everything was amazing. The service was fantastic and professional. not snooty. Definitely a must do for a special occasion or even just for a nice dinner once in a while!

v28e_QnZFQ_Zx3_ixJ4C8A.text: Before going to this restaurant, I read the yelp reviews that were pretty spot on. Yes, the location was hard to find. So thank you for the heads up. So for the good.  The best part for me was the ambiance and atmosphere of the restaurant itself. It was like being on the strip without being in a casino. It's really cool.  The only thing is that it has the snooty Summerlin vibe to it.  As for the food, the only stand out items to me were the wine and cheese. Everything else on the menu was pretty standard including their "specials" that are existing items on their menus.  For the bad. Well you guessed it, the SERVICE.  From the hostess to server. And we spent over $500 for dinner?!  In fairness, we went on a Friday night.  Then again, if you're going to charge $33 for a pork chop, then step up. Our waiter actually snapped at us when we asked him if we could order dinner. And this was after we had patiently waited for 30 minutes. Really? Even the staff have snooty attitudes?  So in conclusion, it wasn't the best or worst. I'd be willing to go again if I was forced (like a group dinner). But didn't make my "can't wait to go again list"

ncBjN2FxCBzv5znJRifYuA.text: Very unique decor, nice atmosphere, and courteous staff. The only (major) problem was that they served my requested medium-well steak more than well-done. Even when I asked them to redo it, it came back medium instead of medium-well. this reflects poor kitchen oversight and was quite disappointing. The breads were tasty but certainly baked many hours prior. I'd give it another try...

f_ssBOi5nomD2o_QDBkZmw.text: Quite the variety of appetizers and entrees.  One of the best filets I have ever eaten.  We went there on a Friday night and it was busy, of coarse.  I didn't have a reservation but I think they slipped us in.  The server was very knowledgeable about the cuisine and all-in-all liked everything.  Thanks Vintner!

Wou13STtJoFIMzy_w_hCug.text: The pan seared crab cakes are to die for.  The complimentary bread were awesome with so many choices, I wanted to eat them all.  The chocolate was my favorite.  Also, the bouillabaisse with mussels, clams, shrimp, snapper, calamari, scallops and saffron broth was awesome.  Don't remember what I ate for dessert, but was very delicious.

fbvlKvXUYDGj44FWHBX9qA.text: Just went with a group of people tonight and the food was amazing.  Server could have had a little more personality. The atmosphere was awesome and they have some great wines!

Wf17hMUmYj7P7Ba15-ifVw.text: I ate here Sunday evening with my boyfriend.  We started with a 5-piece meat and cheese platter that we let the waiter choose for us.  We loved both meats and the blue cheese was amazing!  I loved the marbling in the blue cheese- it was so pretty I almost did not want to eat it.  I didn't really enjoy the cheddar but I was not in a cheddar mood so that was OK.  After the meat and cheese I had a pear martini which was good.  I don't usually drink alcohol but for some reason wanted it because of the Bartlett that was in it- it had a sandy texture like when pears are very ripe.  My boyfriend drank fresh lemonade that he liked; I did not try it.  He then had sausage flatbread that had a pesto sauce underneath the cheese.  I had two appetizers instead of a meal- crab cakes and a salad with citrus vinegrette and fried brie.  The crab cakes were broiled so that was a plus, and the chopped peppers in it reminded me of crab cakes I had at HoneySalt once, but the downside to the crab cakes was no lump crabmeat.  Still good and couldn't complain- just am spoiled from living in Maryland I guess.  The salad had the perfect lettuce that I love and call "storybook lettuce" because it looks like such perfect lettuce it could have been in the Peter Rabbit book.  The citrus vinegrette was perfect with the hot weather.  I decided against dessert because nothing really caught my eye.  I'm sure they were great but I wanted something classic and not fruity or with peanut butter.  I can't wait to go back here.  It is very cute- green, white and brown decor, and I didn't quite see the outside but looked like a very cute setup.  Server was also good but a bit slow- with good reason because I saw him running to many tables so very forgivable and we were not in a rush.

fdmRDeNMDay1tVqIJ31yEg.text: Went there twice this week. Once for dinner with my husband, and once for lunch. We sat on the patio at a table under one of the cabanas. It was nice and relaxing. This is not a place you want to go when you are in a rush or on a quick lunch break. It takes a long time to savor the food and the atmosphere, and I think that's what the restaurant is going for. The food is excellent. For dinner I had the halibut which was excellent. For lunch I had the crab ravioli, also delicious. Everyone else's food looked amazing as well. A lovely atmosphere and very nice for a no rush lunch.

zLJZyk0sY8qvZJkZ-rIRHg.text: Really pretty room, but the night we ate there was so way-overly crowded that the ambiance was ruined.  They had a large wedding party jammed into the bar area and with the constant "tingtingting" of people hitting silverware on glassware as is customary at receptions, and the bride wandering around the dining room, we will not be back to this place.  Very expensive evening to be a unknowing guest at a wedding party.  Food was okay.  Cheese plate was spectacular.  Service was harried. YMMV.

GXQSGwy2zQkfCfy9iSNAPw.text: good food, staff very helpful and nice local spot.

kpB854_APD3xV3LJty3M9g.text: Joined yelp just to write about this spot. Went here for my 5th anniversary and it was amazing. Service was fantastic very attentive but not invasive. Food was great (get the halibut you won't regret it) and they also had a really great wine list! We ended up ordering one of my faves that I was excited to see they carried but they also have a 50 under $50 list that I was really impressed by. PS, they have a beautiful outdoor dining area that I wish I could replicate in my backyard. Very cool spot!

_Zyn1IRPmr8mcuR2-aGrAQ.text: The service was bad!!! My husband and I were seated by the host and that was the last of it. No one greeted us or offered us anything. We left after 5 minutes and informed the two gentlemen at the host station. The man asked which table we were seated at and that was the end of the conversation. No apology or nothing. However, great valet service...he was the only one gracious enough to apologize for the lack of service.

R6rhsCqTTUXkPOq9EXfRtw.text: I was a little hesitant about this place because of its location in an office building, but don't let the location fool you...this place is amazing.  Step into a chic atmosphere that mirrors some of the best restaurants in town.  The wait staff is amazing and very friendly.  The wine selection was impressive and the food was divine!  We had a party that was on the larger side and I'm usually very uneasy about this but this place definitely put me at ease.  We were also told that menu changes frequently so every visit promises to be a new culinary experience.

wJBdtGuQA8i5QTaWJpIeCQ.text: Thank You, Yelp! Never would've found this place without you! tucked into a nondescript office park, this has to be one of the strangest located great restaurants I have ever been to.  I have a rule that when dining out, I don't typically order seafood if I am too far from a coast. lake or river fish, yes. SEAfood, no. but this time i broke my own rule and had the Mediterranean Sea Bass. It was actually fresh and was cooked perfectly. So glad I took the chance! The Beet Salad was great ( I love beets! ) as well. My wife had the Pork belly appetizer and the Veal with angel hair pasta as her dinner. We share everything, so I can tell you they were awesome too. She also loved her Pear Martini.

O0hUYjcbppg41fYQ2HIfSQ.text: As usual, the food and service is very good here but can you please refinish the floor? It's really showing it age. Worn and discolored, it takes away from the overall experience. The ottomans in the lounge area also need cleaning or even better, reupholstered.   The place is looking rundown and tha really a shame for a high end, Summerlin  dining spot.  Update 05-12-16;  Dined last night and a brand new floor has been put in. The food and service is still top notch. Try the Blueberry Crush for an excellent cocktail before dinnrer.

9WJqb5u7sij58d2USIsiZg.text: I've been to Vintner Grill several times and it has yet to disappoint me. Their food, cocktails, and service are all great. They have a great selection of meats and cheeses, and I must say, I think this place has the best "make your own" charcuterie and cheese board I've had. The truffle cheese is to die for, I even considered asking them if I was able to purchase some haha. My favorite entree to get is the prime beef tenderloin with potato puree. It's so juicy and fulfilling. Their lamb bolognese is also delicious, very rich and flavorful. It's also a beautiful restaurant. I definitely look forward to coming back.

9wx6QP2jgqv1zPqqUlYi4w.text: Although Vinters is probably the most expensive restaurant in Summerlin, for the right moment, it's worth it.  Tucked into the back of an office park (really) one comes through the back parking lot into..... "Voila!"  Valet parking, white linen table cloths, outdoor fire pits in a tiered outdoor dining landscape, white tented private dining areas - and then a beautiful long bar inside with more great seating, white leather booths, more.  If you were dropped into this spot with no clue where you were, you would guess Miami Beach.    Upscale, fantastic wines, good service and an interesting crowd that is mostly 40-60-ish early in the evening and then becomes the hip spot for the upscale younger crowd until the last hour of the evening when it again calms down and people stop for a nightcap or dessert on the way home from a show, the Strip, whatever.    But great people-watching and always good conversation with some fascinating person/people when I go there to eat at the bar, and I often do go alone.  Food is quite good, although I would say there are places in Summerlin where the food is just as good, perhaps even better, and it would cost you 25-50% less. So you're paying for extraordinary ambiance (relatively speaking).  However, if you are out at the Red Rock Resort (or the JW Marriott) in Summerlin and want to do something fun and different one night - or if you're a local - this is something a little different, and in my opinion, worth it.

T3XkD1aoJXlHwL6RfucGjg.text: One of the best meals I've had in Las Vegas. The menu changes daily and offers a wonderful variety of cheese, meats (fromage and carne) and flatbreads for apps.  I had the wild boar bolognese pasta for dinner. Fantastic wine selection.

euI6izEtndIowxQSLm4syQ.text: I work in the building that Vintner is at. I have lunch there a couple of times a quarter; I would go more but I like getting away from the office.  I enjoy all of their sandwiches, cobb salad, lamb Bolognese, and iced tea.  Great selection of wines on tap; it's an elegant place for a happy hour.

ZadnZg49lXeOjX8LVIyM5w.text: I'm in love with Vintner grill I wish I could come here everyday and drink martinis and eat cheese, meats, and fresh breads :) This is where you take spoiled girls!!!

S3Yu3kXHGRK3Gr-L66UAvQ.text: I love their pan seared Halibut and Pearfection Martini.

oaQykZCkZTOzQijCKqdIFg.text: They will give you a candle on your birthday. Not even wish you happy birthday. Not happy at all. The bus boy was nice.

WQ0D6dFDZiPB2Lk5CV02JA.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our evening at Vinter's Grill.  Our waiter Jeff was not only prompt but cordial and attentive throughout the evening.  We started with the fromage/carne choosing Brie, Manchego and wild boar salami.  All 3 were excellent.  We shared the mixed green salad followed by our generous entrees of Sea Bass and Portobella Picatta.  Both were fantastic!  Our entire experience was outstanding from the bread to the French press coffee.

XYNH2AEE3oRnqm9lmhNvMQ.text: A hidden gem in Las Vegas.  Located in an office park up the street of Red Rock Casino.  The outdoor is very charming and the indoor is very fresh and energetic.  I go here on our special occassions, Birthdays and special events.  Very charming restaurant.  The curry chicken salad and the choice of cheese and meats to start is exquisite!  If you are looking for a restaurant with amazing food, atmosphere and service, this is the place.  One of the hidden gems in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy olive oil and butter

dd6A6q4o8EtIvqBHasdlPw.text: Although it seemed very far and like it was in the middle of no where, I loved this place a lot! The ambiance is very romantic.   We started off with burrata insalata. We actually didn't even know what it was, but just ordered it. The cheese was very rich in flavor and the dressing was just enough to not over power everything that was in it. We also had the italian sausage flat bread which was also good.  I had the pacific salmon with maine lobster. I loved how the lobster was hidden in each bite under the fish. The fish was cooked perfectly, and the sauces also weren't over powering the salmon and lobster. I was a big fan of the corn. I just love corn in my food. It made it perfect!  We ended with the strawberry shortcake dessert. It wasn't too sweet, and it came in a cute little glass.   Service wasn't amazing and extravagant, but the waiter was very knowledgeable and knew what he was talking about! Definitely will go back.

xI-S13iXsEjDsfFIfezKEQ.text: Great food, but portions are small for what you're paying. Good for business meals, special occasions, and visitors.

qUyUFQP1SyeApTisCcqw6Q.text: The food was really 4 star quality, but they get a star bump for the great decor and fabulous service !   My coworker and I ventured this way because we were in the mood for a fabulous lunch. This place really delivered and I'd venture to say on a Monday it's one of the best lunches one can buy in the Summerlin area.   We wanted to try a couple of things and decided on the steak cobb salad and the chicken. I've eaten a ton of cobb salads (having done low carb on and off for nearly a year now!), and this is my pick for the best one in Las Vegas. They split it up for us without even asking, and my half portion was very substatial. Warm delicious steak. Asparagus. Fresh soft bleu cheese crumbles. Ever so lightly dressed. YUM. This is what the salad on the lunch menu at Simon is trying to be - exact at Simon they charge you $5 more for it, give you half as much food, and serve you sad little steak crumbles that are cold and dry. I love it when a place promises steak on a salad and delivers WARM steak. So important!!  We split the chicken for our main course. It was so delicious! Light honey flavor on the skin, and moist amazing chicken. I'm not the world's biggest chicken fan, but this won me over!! It was served with broccolini and what my coworked called "spetzel mac and cheese". So delicious!!   The atmosphere is light and airy and beautiful. Great for everything from a ladies lunch to a birthday lunch to a power lunch. Service was awesome. We were in and out of there in 45 minutes (even with 2 courses!) - so important on a lunch break. Our bill was around $22 a person with tax/tip - more than worth it for the quality of the experience.

zpmg2UQ9p-alNBx6Urb7LA.text: I popped in here for dinner with a friend and her parents. This is a really cool place, but my review is a 3.5, but I'll round up because the food was good.  Made the reservation via OpenTable, but my friend did too. We both got different times available to us. Made the planning a bit awkward. So, if someone at OpenTable see's this review, get your act together.  Ok, now on to the important stuff.  Food, very good. I had the hummus, and then a flatbread (pizza type). They have a guy who comes around with about 10 different styles of bread. At the table, the butter is actually shaped as a dish, and has two indents. One contains olive oil, the other...I forgot, but it was good. It's hard to describe. And no, I didn't take a picture. The butter dish thing is also covered in sea salt and pepper for added goodness.  The menu is a bit uncomfortable. The first two pages are just meats and cheeses. The menu is a bit confusing and overwhelming.  Our server seemed to give us a little attitude when we asked questions about how the first two pages of the menu worked. He then went into a routine about the menu, specials, etc. It was very rehearsed and the conversation didn't really feel natural. It didn't feel like he was offering or sharing any useful info. This is the only reason why I say it was a 3.5 star experience.  Also, when I had some leftovers, I asked for a box. The look on the servers face was as if I had offended him.  I'm making this review sound way more negative than it should be.   I had a very nice meal here, and overall, I'd come back for a nice occasion.  P.S. The bar, is filled with cougs.

Uk7zXJ9xvoBXknqq1sDizg.text: Go. Cool, hip, all that. Loud enough, quite enough. Good service, very good food. You'll like yourself for being there.

0qoUzCK81tglim3bSMztCA.text: The atmosphere and service is great. BUT, the food is mediocre. We had a large group and everyone had a problem with the taste. Same problem with desert.

GYvQSa6VBqEsafqu2sGFtw.text: We had an awesome birthday dinner here for mi amor on a bustling, windy, Saturday night. He ordered the NY strip steak and I ordered the half chicken. These were full on entrees, so we definitely could have passed on the calamari we ordered as an appetizer, which was pretty forgettable. Our entrees tasted amazing.. I honestly think the half chicken is one of the best chicken dishes I've ever tasted in my life.   For all the wine lovers.. they have a huge selection. After all, the place is called Vintner (wine maker). We did not get any wine, but we tried the pear-tini which was strong but delicious.  I was a bit wary of this place due to recent reviews about the service. Our server was Jeff, and he was pretty stellar. No complaints there. However, we did have some dirty plates and utensils upon being seated, but that was taken care of promptly.  The decor is also amazing. There were people who were dressed up, there were people who dressed casually. Personally I'd feel a bit out of place if I just donned jeans.

GhCKLeDRIv-Y2DNW-PCqDA.text: Absolutely delicious food. Terrible service!!!! Waiter ignored us completely. Took drink orders, but we finished our food and never were taken care of. Had to cancel the drinks as we had nothing left to eat with them. The bread was great, all four crumbs of it.  Hope they fix the service, because there are plenty of wonderful places around to eat.

EDtkMwcftlPdmlldUzM5MQ.text: Part of my job (lucky me) is to find good restaurants for corporate lunches and dinners. I work in Summerlin so Vintner's was a go-to venue for years. Until one time my coworkers and I were there having lunch when one of them crunched on something and found a chunk of glass in her food. The waiter said they'd broken a glass in the kitchen but didn't think it had gone near the food. I was surprised they didn't know to throw away everything they were working on. She could have been seriously hurt. But, we chalked it up to experience and continued to go there. Until my husband and I decided to go for lunch one Saturday. We were shopping, so we were casually but nicely dressed. As we went in, the hostess looked us up and down and said, "I'm sorry, we're very busy today." There were about ten people seated and there was plenty of room. I've never been turned away from there before, even when they were extremely full and we walked in with a large team. So my husband and I left, and I've never gone back. Not for lunch with my coworkers, nor with my boss and his team for a corporate dinner - there are plenty of other fine restaurants in Summerlin now for me to steer him to instead. "Other Mama" for instance. Check it out - amazing food AND great service. No more Vintner's for me. It's a horrible feeling to be rejected like that. I was embarrassed in front of my new husband - it was his first visit and I'd spoken highly of the place. I'm English-born so I'm used to that kind of snobbery in the UK, but never had it here in the US. I wish they knew how much money they've lost due to her awful behavior.

9vjXkQOEspZS5HT-TNx2qA.text: I have eaten at Vitner Grill a handful of times and they always deliver. Love the atmosphere, staff, wine selection and food. This is a great strip alternative out in the Summerlin area. I love there cheese plate selection, always a good way to try several new types of cheese. Last night I ordered the rib eye and it was amazing. The hash that it is served with was solid. Great outdoor seating area. You have to check this place out.

ZfqDQKm-GRZ-VWIXx8BMeg.text: I recently moved to the area and this has become my go to restaurant. It is clearly the best restaurant off the strip. The food, cocktails and wine list are all first class. If you are looking for a special restaurant for a romantic night out or entertaining for business, this should be at the top of your list.

cIFD5QQdVrrmsFdjECzaoA.text: Let's face it, Vegas has a lot of great food. What Vegas restaurants lack is an outdoor space like Vitners Grill. It is perfect. The decor is on point, the plants are lush, the space is inviting, tranquil, and simply the best outdoor dining I've ever experienced. The food is as good as you'd expect, both my fiance and I had the crab ravioli. Blueberry crush is a great cocktail. Waitstaff were attentive and humorous.  Go here for the outdoor space. You wouldn't be disappointed.

nA7fGIuxReHTvYnUspvhDw.text: Wonderful ambiance, good drinks, and fantastic food!  One of the best Moscow mules I've ever had.   Get one of every bread offer! Especially the white chocolate walnut!  You'll need to start with a charcuterie board. The smoked duck is a must and the lavender goat cheese is to die for!   Calamari is also the best I've ever had. Another great starter.   Atlantic salmon tagine is unbelievable!!  Tiramisu...ugh just everything...amazing.   This will be a regular every time I visit :)

BKEn2vmh5jdd0DPsI8Eh8Q.text: I have heard from several people that VG has replaced Rosemary's (respect) as the best off-strip restaurant in town.  So, I finally tried it Friday.  I was a bit concerned, as several yelpers had commented on the poor service.  I have to agree with them.  Although we were seated promptly, we had to wait a good while before a server came with a drink menu.  We then had to wait a good while to get our bottle of wine.  Although everyone was friendly, it's like they needed a few more servers on the floor.  We got a 5 piece charcuterie plate to start.  The 10 year aged cheddar was great, but only had 2 small pieces.  Our table had 4 people, and it was not enough for everyone to really get a good taste.  Some other cheeses (the blue for example) came with a lot more on the plate.  I understand that different cheeses have different prices, but I would have appreciated it had the server told us this cheddar is a small serving, so we could have ordered more or another selection.  I had the porterhouses, which was okay, not great.  The star of the show in my estimation was the chicken and mac n cheese that one in our party had.    I will say the wine list was reasonable and diverse.  I will not return unless someone else is paying.  I can see why VG is popular, but I will just go to Todd's next time I want to eat well off-strip, and it certainly does not make me forget Rosemary's.

aV4gWQKSBZWDYRe8rHOmAw.text: Food was "OK". I ordered salmon & walnut salad. I wasn't too impressed. Atmosphere was nice; although I didn't have most pleasant waiter.

Hs92u1HkSpFdR1_8OF1w6g.text: First time at Vintner Grill, touted as one of the best restaurants in the Summerlin area of Vegas.    The restaurant is quite large and has a nice atmosphere but it is located in an Office Park, which seems a little weird when you drive up.   We ordered two appetizers: the Heirloom tomato salad and the butter lettuce salad. The tomatoes were a little past their prime as Heirlooms have little shelf life, and the result was a mushier salad than I wanted.  The butter lettuce salad was quite good with a nice portion and tasty seasoning.   Bread came after appetizers, a little late, and the pretzel roll I had was dense and not fresh, maybe leftover from Sunday brunch!  For our main courses, I ordered the sea bass and my wife ordered halibut.  The sea bass was very fresh and tasted very good, even excellent. The halibut was the same -- excellent.   Service was quite good.  The cheese and carne (charcuterie) meals looked very interesting and we'll probably try it on our next visit.   All-in-all, a very good meal in a nice atmosphere. We'll be back.

oCdUM5XXe-XHyZ3kK7Wj2A.text: I enjoyed the food here and the ambience of the restaurant. It was a little hard to find as it's located in office buildings. I feel that some of the food was a little overpriced but it was good quality. I would recommend to a friend but it is not cheap.

F4X8wyL6d0fGrJ_SF4m7pg.text: This restaurant has been on my list of wanna tries for quite some time but sometimes it's hard to make it around to everything. I was asked out on a date and luckily this is the place he chose. Being a Friday night and beautiful out, I thought it might be crowded but when I got there it was a nice crowd and not overly busy.   I was quickly greeted when I walked in the door and found my date. We were seated in a corner and our server promptly arrived to ask for our choice of flat or sparkling water. As we settled in I noticed that Casablanca was playing on a screen in the middle of the room and the ambiance was contemporary yet very comfortable.   Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and over all a great server. We took our time with our meal as we wanted to chat and visit but it never seemed to phase the server and he knew how to let us have time while still keeping the dinner moving along. We started off with wine and a cheeseboard. Both being pretty open to most foods, we just let the server pick the cheese and were happy with everything he brought.   As with what is their staple, while we waited for our appetizer another person came around and offered us a selection of breads from his tray. We took a few selections and enjoyed the accompanying honey and butter. I can say that my low carb lifestyle was killed this night but I wasn't upset.   After we finished off the first bottle and were well into our second we decided that after all the cheese and bread we'd just share the salmon tandori entree. Once again we were quite pleased with the food and service.   This was definitely a great experience and I can't wait until I go back to try more of their selections. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal, great service, and great atmosphere.

0I1y_aD4gJNpKX2choOz4A.text: This restaurant is one of our very favorites in Las Vegas. We come to Las Vegas five or six times per year and we always make it a point to have at least one meal here. This evening we wanted to share the restaurant with our friends who were in town for her 50th birthday. In fact earlier in the week she had rented a cabana and had a wonderful birthday so for that I give them five stars.   This evening was probably one of the worst experiences we have had at this restaurant ever. I would probably give them one star for rudeness and lack of courtesy but I am giving them three stars because as usual the food was fantastic.   We made a reservation for 9:45 which is an option on OpenTable. We arrived at the restaurant at 9:40. The minute we were seated, we were told,  by the curt waiter, that we had less than 10 minutes to order our food. We rushed and ordered our food and our bottle of wine. After we received our food we figured that we could take our time and eat and enjoy our dinner and our company at our leisure. Shortly after we received our food the waitstaff started cleaning up the restaurant around us and others hovered giving us the stair down. Our waiter was a bit rigid but did not appear to pressure us.   The most appalling behavior was by the bartender. Approximately five minutes after we received our food he cranked the music up so offensively loud that we could not hear each other speak. He did this for a few minutes as if to announce "okay you've been here long enough it's time to go".  A few minutes later he did it again. A gentleman from the other table in the restaurant openly voiced his disgust at the behavior. I yelled across the restaurant and announced "okay we get the message were getting out".  Most of us still had the majority of food on our plates and half full glasses of wine. My husband was so angry he ordered dessert menus all around the table and ordered another bottle of wine just to let them know that we were there to dine and enjoy our evening regardless of their abhorrent behavior.   I would like to make a suggestion that they not offer a 9:45  reservation as an option if they are going to rush their guests the minute they sit down. The restaurant of this caliber comes with an expectation of a fine dining experience, not 15 minutes at Taco Bell.  This is the second time we have made a late dinner reservation and the second time we were rushed through our meal. We will think twice before making a late dinner reservation again that is for sure. There are plenty of restaurants in town who are more than happy to take your business and your money at 9:45 PM.

jy6ylGhEdxOnov6jfKSr4w.text: Visited this past Saturday and had a great time, but mostly because the food was delicious and I was with great company. I would've given it five stars except our server was dismissive and made no attempt to assist my friend when she asked questions about the various cheeses. It felt condescending, to be honest.  That guy aside, she ended up ordering something resembling burrata with jam - it was delicious. For dinner, I ordered the halibut, which was amazing with this very flavorful couscous something or other underneath it.  My friend ordered the honey dijon chicken. She enjoyed it but said it was a little sweeter than she was used to, but she loved the mac and cheese that came with it.  Because the service wasn't so great, we left and had dessert at another nearby restaurant.  I will definitely be back because the food is great... I'll just be sure to ask to move tables if I end up with the same server (whose name I don't recall because frankly, I don't think he ever told us in those 35 words he used the entire time he waited on us).

IJJzonE-n0HBanzO4Pjy9w.text: I really like this place! My husband called and asked them to play Some Like it Hot, because they play black and white movies for dinner, so awesome! When I was there eating,  it felt like I wasn't in Vegas. The decor reminded me of California or some sea side town from the huge beautiful bar to the white wooden walls. It was very cozy and elegant.  The food was fabulous. For starters we had calamari and the crab cakes. The calamari came with a delicious lemon sauce, and the crab cakes were decadent and flakey.  For our main meal we ordered the Mediterranean Sea Bass and the 14 oz New York strip steak. The Sea Bass was huge, there was definitely enough for left overs. It was fried perfectly, warm and tender on the inside. It came with fresh veggies and a coconut cream sauce, amazing. The steak was medium rare, big portion, nice and juicy. It came with a baked potato and asparagus. For dessert we had the creme brulee, which was great too. Throughout the night we must have tried six different wines. They have an extensive wine/beer list.  We really enjoyed our expierence and we will definitely be back!

onPwd_MSPm_MGwLWrcRMdg.text: I go to VG about four to six times a year.  The food is always great, very well prepared with fresh ingredients and wide selection to meet most peoples palate.   The kitchen staff is consistently great,  great taste,  presentation and sizzling hot!   Down side is the waiter seemed aloof,  out of synch and generally poor performance.  The maitre'd would normally catch things like empty water glass,  empty wine glass...  The one at VG seemed content chit chatting with the very attractive teenage hostess.  Really disappointed in the service overall.   Great reputation,  catering to local LV Summerlin residence.  My casual observation tonight and overtime reveals an over abundance of service for those they know as regular and likely high wealth big spenders,  the rest of us are somewhat of a nuisance.  Great complimentary valet,  great hostess,  kitchen and food excellent as well.   You'll have to beg for a cocktail,  water or heaven forbid fresh ground pepper.   No longer a fan.

JmrIIudHhs9noHy3WHPM9w.text: Beautiful, romantic place.  My wife and I had dinner last night and were given a cozy booth with pillows.   My wife had the white bean hummus appetizer and I had the crab cakes and both were exemplary.  She had the vegan entree and asked to have some red chili on it and the chef graciously complied.  She had had this dish before and she said it was even better with "a little kick".  I had the pan seared scallops and the were cooked perfectly.    I have been here numerous times and could never tire of this gem of a place.  Everything was impeccable, from the service right down to the romantic music.  We left very happy and will be back.

czbzcHiKuPYe3_fiZpAx-A.text: Absolutely love this place! Everything about it. Great atmosphere, gorgeous patio, knowledgeable and efficient staff, great cocktails, great wine list. Amazing cheese and charcuterie selection (Many house made) I make it a point to never get chicken at a restaurant but I can't help myself! Their chicken is amazing! As with everything else I've had. Definitely the best restaurant off the strip and beats a lot of the places on the strip for half the money.

YRoAr5NcpGrCpNOTnfmVdg.text: Great atmosphere and yummy food. The salads have very generous portions - lots of chicken in the curried chicken salad. The outdoor patio is great in the evening. It's also a great spot for lunch.

vltXYp01vSYEJS9A7lVjLA.text: So delicious!!  We came here on a Friday night for a 7:45pm reservation. The restaurant and bar area were crowded but we were seated right away in their outdoor area, which was also quite full. The weather was gorgeous and the outside setting was very cute. Lots of white decor and the little lighted lanterns helped the ambience tremendously. Service was very good.  We ordered:  (I'll upload some pics I took of the food) -prosecco -Moscow Mule -proscuitto flatbread -spring salad -intermezzo pasta course (a special that night) which was ricotta filled pasta pouches with black truffle shavings -lamb bolognese -lamb tagine  Everything tasted so delicious! I love that the spring salad had a lot of components (beans, corn etc) so that it created different textures and flavors in each bite. The flatbread had a very nice crust, crispy yet chewy. The special intermezzo pasta course was very rich and flavorful. The outstanding dish for me was the lamb bolognese. The shreds of lamb were very tender and paired perfectly with the pasta.  As we had several boxes of left over food, needless to say we did not have room for dessert. I will definitely be coming back to Vintner.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb bolognese and lamb tagine
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spring salad and proscuitto flatbread

Kz2t2g-iEgTE3N_MSySttQ.text: Ambiance - Trendy/Sophisticated Food: really good and reasonably priced. App: Octopus with gnocchi - perfect flavor and texture Breads: just OK. I had the pretzel bread and it was cold, not warm. The butter was rock hard but good. Cheese sampler: raspberry jam was good, cheese was good Lamb Bolognese: amazing! Rich and a good amount of lamb. The truffle ricotta on top complement ed the dish very well. Rib Eye: my husband said it was good but lacking some flavor. The potatoes it came with was just OK and should have been served with something with more flavor. Overall the service was great and loved the ambiance.

IjB9i-QvWgBiMYqsfOx-UQ.text: Great food, reasonable priced wine and wonderful ambiance. I love the old black and white movies they play with no sound. It gives the place an east coast vibe. Never had a problem with service. We have been here at least 10 times. My only complaint are the tables where my husband has to sit with his back to the restaurant facing a window, but it might as well be a wall. We love this place and is one of our favorite Friday date night places.  If you get a chance they have a great patio as well.

pbaHvptkLDR66Gihlbo17Q.text: I came here this past weekend with my family for my uncle & mom's birthdays. I've been here several times before and always love the food and atmosphere. However, this experience was a bit disappointing. The food was good, the service was poor. Our waiter had a very stuffy demeanor and was quite rude. Not only that, but he spilled an entire beer on my uncle - all over his pants. All he did was offer to bring us a napkin. You would think that he would have taken the beer off the bill, offer a dry cleaning bill, or bring another drink on the house but he did nothing. This was very disappointing to me and my entire family, as we expected a restaurant of this caliber to be more accommodating and provide excellent and quality service to guests. Mind you, we spent well over $400 AND I let the restaurant know ahead of time that we had two birthdays at the table. I love Vintner Grill, but this experience was disappointing.,.

peKLA308zI7b3y6hPIxuAg.text: This place is excellent! You feel like you're in a top notch restaurant the second you walk in. The food was very good. I had the crab ravioli and about half way through couldn't eat the rest. The flavor was very different. But everything else we ordered was wonderful! The service was so friendly. And the pricing was very decent for this type of restaurant. We'll be back!

3Qwp-ckOX08RkMsDOppORg.text: Excellent! first time here for a birthday dinner. Quite pricey. White table clothed, bar and lounge, spacious patio with dining cabanas. The menu includes American dishes with influences from France, Spain and Italy.   For starters-Oven Roasted Beets with Baby Spinach, goat cheese,Mango, Hazelnuts and Mustard Vinaigrette. There was an appetizer we ordered and it had octopus in it but I don't see it on the menu online. For entrees- Bouillabaisse with Mussels, Clams, snapper, Shrimp, calamari, Scallops with Saffron Broth and a fish dish which I don't remember what's on it :) . They were cooked to perfection and very flavorful and good portion.   Huge wine selection and cheese plated. We ordered two cocktails-Pumpkin Pie-Stoli vanilla, fresh pumpkin puree and cream de cacao garnished with a graham cracker rim and they were nice and strong. We ordered deserts as well and it came with a candle and a Happy Birthday on it, it was very cute.  The service was excellent. Our dishes were removed as soon as we finished and our drinks were never empty. He made sure everything was good and serviced in a timely manner. It was a remarkable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GqCu5JtnkfoSf9p7ML7zew.text: After many years this place still continues to surprise me!!  To see Jeff still working the floor, with great attention to his guests, and the rest of the staff still crushing it is great to see!  Had the beef barley soup which was really good, I do wish the mushrooms were a bit caramelized, but I'm just Being picky. The lamb was great, and the chocolate tart was amazing!!!

mhzm1Ck67JXJf8TbQrT5EQ.text: Fav spot not just for a romantic dinner but for happy hour.  I recommend trying the Moscow Mule and appetizers are spot on delicious.  The dinner menu is just a decadent.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ouDXE5Q8yiNf_7gO18rOEA.text: What a surprise. This place is not easy to find but once you do wow what a cool romantic spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh,  love the sparkling .

47vQVewuCI4GPuHteACXIA.text: We went there for dinner last night 6-23-18.  We were pleasantly surprised by the reception, atmosphere and food.  While a little noisy, all else was very good.  I had boullavayy

nufCa6ZUwqnDf-U4L2WNvw.text: One of the most fabulous restaurants I have ever been to! It's located with office building so at first you have a hard time finding it.  Had probably the best table in the whole restaurant a huge booth for 2. Very romantic and cozy!  Ordered a Moscow mules and I have never had a more perfect mule before. Mixed perfectly and serves with the lime and mint and a homemade candies ginger. It was beautiful.  Ordered the salmon and chicken and it was cooked perfectly.   Can't wait to go back and have another amazing night!

UMoI4HbBTPugpIjGCiqXGw.text: Fabulous ... I too am a chef ... this place has artists ... great food ... first place I have found in Vegas that owns up to what they are selling ... highly recommend

MrKk9brpwxMBHiUIKx0jGw.text: I ate hear on Friday night with my parents in town and had a very pleasant experience. The food was superb and far better than just about anything I can remember from the Strip. The service was also superb and the place was lovely. I highly recommend you check this restaurant out if you live in Summerlin and don't want to deal with the hassle of the strip. I will be coming back in a few months that I guarantee you !!  David G.  My waiter ( a very nice guy from Europe ( I think he said Hungary or Bulgaria lol) was outstanding too.

-ouVIkJacPm3pvrwqy5RgQ.text: Booked a 10pm table for NYE for my boyfriend and me. Seated quickly after arriving. Greeted briefly by server a few minutes after being seated and ordered waters and drinks. Took her about 10-15 minutes to return to get our order. We ordered from the Prix Fixe menu. Started with a smoked duck appetizer with goat cheese - I loved it, BF not so much as he doesn't like goat cheese. Next we had a salad with candied walnuts and pears with Gorgonzola crostinis. Very tasty especially the walnuts! For entrees I had the Chilean sea bass and BF has the bone in filet Mignon. Mine was light and flavorful, sides were ok. His steak was cooked fine (medium rare toward the bone) but was dry and lacked flavor. His garlic mashed potatoes were amazing. For dessert we both opted for the chocolate lava cake with vanilla gelato and fruit topping. It was so decadent and rich, definitely the best part of the meal. We were also given glasses of Prosecco as part of the meal, which was ok. Biggest complaint was the service. Server didn't come by very often to check on us. She only brought us our drinks, not any food. She seemed more interested in attending to other tables with larger parties. She also immediately dropped off the check as soon as our dessert plates were cleared. She supposedly said "no rush" according to my BF but I didn't hear it. We both found this quite rude. We had wanted to stay and enjoy some additional drinks. The Moscow mule was very good, I had another with pear which was just ok. I have worked as a server and for such a nice restaurant we were rather offended that the check was given to us right away without asking for it or seeing if we wanted anything else. I don't know if she was rushing us out before midnight, we finished around 11:20pm. Shortly after dropping off the check we saw her filling the wine glasses of a 6 person party near us. While we enjoyed our food and will likely return, if she is our waitress we will certainly ask for a different one.

PE6dYUmxWugfBMI8EtcoEA.text: Amazing calamari, with their sauce! This place was suggested by a friend. Nice atmosphere and service!

Y8HFOfgUaYfTKWk_5VPanw.text: Love this place!   Awesome for lunch or dinner.  The filet is AMAZING!!!!   Also the chicken with Mac and cheese.  It's so good, it will change your life.  Wow.  Absolutely perfect place to go.

m0MNTtBfomW7X-I6ueEm_Q.text: Took my wife to dinner for her bday a few weeks ago. She got the halibut and said it was the best meal she's ever had in her life. I got the ribeye and brie mashed potatoes and it was phenomenal. The cheese board to kick dinner off was refreshing and delicious.

yadfbJuDiAvsd16jGjRBSQ.text: What can I say, what a hidden gem. Go east just past Costco and make a left and then a right into the parking lot. Look for the valet. Lol The cheese nd meat platters are great and filling, save room for dinner. The lamb was very well made and served perfectly presented. The lamb bolagnaise is a must.  AND...so inexpensive it's not fair to them!!!

GbKOXBZX_gPKXMRnq-_tag.text: Amazing! Hidden away in the corner if an office park. I'd like to keep this place a secret but I think the secret is out. Compliments to the chef, love the cheese platters.

4kC2cj7rdThmJaE7mcOSvg.text: To start this was our second attempt to enjoy VG.  The first time we were sat next to the server doors and it was loud and the service was non existant. We decided to give it another try on a sunday for our anniversary.  Made reservations and showed up early.  Business was slow.  Bartender was on point. Great old fashioned and pear vodka drink. When we were sat we had told the hostess about our first visit and the location in which we were sat. Needless to say the hostess attempted to once again seat us in the corner by the server station. When I asked to sit in the one of the 25 other tables that were open she rolled her eyes and took attitude.  Once seated service was average, food was good not excellent by any means. It was our anniversary and while we were not looking for anything free we were only offered a dessert menu.  While behind us a couple who were obviously regulars were 'taken care of' appetizers, a dessert and after dinner cocktails.  Needing to salvage our night free we ended up at DTS and wolfgang pucks.  Drinks were perfect, dessert 'espresso tirimasu' and 'cookies' were awesome and our bartender 'tiffany' was nice and served us immediately and was friendly.   Needless to say we are done with VG.  If your a regular they will kiss ur A.  But anyone else is just a customer.  Come in, eat, pay, and leave.     There are alot of better places to spend your money and time.

_yxApEBK1H58OiTBQU2CYA.text: I went here for the first time tonight and I was very impressed! The restaurant looks like you'll be paying outrageous prices but the prices are actually quite reasonable. They have wine flights which is a huge bonus to me as I like being able to try a variety of wines. The sommelier came to the table and explained each wine, its origin and the varietal. I got the crab ravioli and it was very good. Our server Kris was so nice and professional. We were shocked to find out afterwards that it was his first night serving on his own because he was very knowledgeable and familiar with the menu. We will definitely be returning!

rcoWH9NFTBwxtbas_Gz7AQ.text: Absolutely loved this place. I had the petite sirloin which was cooked perfectly. The service was great and the wine selection is amazing. The decor and ambiance is excellent as well. We made a reservation and our table was ready upon our arrival. They also provide valet parking, though it didn't seem necessary for us as the parking lot was pretty open.   It's in a business Park which threw us off a bit but I think that just added to the uniqueness of it. Highly recommend and will be coming back.

0gN0qNqDE7IkCyx5RoNuuA.text: They did a nice job with Thanksgiving Dinner.  Service was good and so was the food.  We had a group of 5, it was a bit on the pricier side for turkey dinner... we would've liked some dark meat turkey and maybe the option of the sides being family-style so you can feel like you are having seconds, but all around good meal.

2ToyOXiREEuIN2e9Dfr-Wg.text: Decided to come here with my girlfriend for a special occasion. We were very impressed. It's fairly easy to get to and the staff was kind when we arrived. While we were on our way to be seated, I was awestruck with the elegance/fanciness of the interior and the ambiance of the restaurant. I highly recommend dressing to impress. The food was of the highest quality. Absolutely delicious from the bread to the dessert. I ordered a New York strip and it was by far one of the best things I've ever tasted. Additionally, the cocktails are on point. The best part about them is that they pour their cocktails strong, yet they go down very easy. My girlfriend ordered dessert and that was heavenly too (big surprise there). Finally, our waiter was funny, professional, and he gave us the perfect amount of attention. Overall, I highly recommend coming here if you want to celebrate a special occasion or even if you want to simply live the lavish night for an evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wVvD1Z7941gqWk9R9qRClA.text: We had never heard of this restaurant but with it being Mother's Day we relied on our handy dandy Yelp reviews to find somewhere new. And good thing we did because we fell head over heels for this unique and delicious restaurant. It is a must for any foodie!!! The food was very good and it was all pretty unique and creative. I was expecting a different menu but like I said it was Mother's Day. So they did have a set menu for a fix price or you could order from the menu.  My only complaint was that we went during lunch and ate like it was dinner. I wish I would have known the menu was changed so i could  have gone during  dinner and with a larger appetite. Try it for yourself.

JzyHeyJHF_lcy-TaM7Rx0A.text: I feel like I'm in Miami in this restaurant.  It's tropical elegance with a twist of upscale decadence.  The food is good, too. Consistent! My favorite is the bouillabaisse, which is a little bit different than a typical one, in a rich saffron broth.  I also like the roasted chicken and mac and cheese. The other dishes I've sampled are worthy, as well, including a lamb dish.  The salad wedge with cheese and prosciutto is also delicious.  I like the chocolatey chocolate dessert in a glass (but forgot its name). Service is a bit uneven, but never subpar.  It can be a little awkward parking here. Feel free to pull into any spot in a stall near the restaurant, even if under an awning.  Avoid rush times, particularly if you do not have reservations, as it can get a little crowded.  Also avoid the night that they do some kind of DJ thing. (Maybe they've already stopped that nonsense).  Perfect for a power lunch or dinner. But also a good romantic spot.

4ICclyo6d93a2iSTGHD3rw.text: This is where my roommate and I spent Christmas 2017. They were fully booked when we called, but decided to chance it anyway. We got there a little before 5pm and had our pick of seats at the bar.  The cuisine is upscale, Mediterranean-inspired fare fit for the most judicious palates. For the main course, I went with the perfectly cooked sea bass (replete with a yummy coconut Harissa sauce) while my companion tried the Moroccan-spiced rack of lamb.  You should be kicking yourself if you leave without trying their cheese plates. Possibly as sublime as their food, you have the option of choosing from an extensive menu of hard, soft, blue, etc. cheeses and meats. Whoever assembles the final masterpiece also picks a small selection of complementary jams to go with your choice. Paired with a flight of sparkling wine, and I was in blissfully indulgent heaven.  Since it is winter, their outdoor area was shuttered when we visited. My date assured me it is stunning and *well* worth a trek back to Summerlin in the warmer months.

ViDuYb8ZQWuueyA1X918qw.text: Came here for my birthday and was impressed by the service and satisfied by the delicious food. I will definitely be coming here more frequently.

ZUulaUUDNYQ_Ohr98E5v7Q.text: A bit hard to find as it is in an office building. Very attractive decor and ambiance. Charcuterie platters are FABULOUS! Try the truffle ricotta and the sliced duck. The bread basket served before your meal is also delicious.  The service was trying to provide a fine dining experience but the waiter kept spilling the water.  Every pour he spilled water.  Every pour.  The table cloth was all wet.   Kind of funny in hindsight but it was distracting during a business lunch last week.

i-B7jTvVabOLbFvUAmDfwg.text: What a great lunch spot.  This is a beautiful restaurant with great service.  We had the sea bass and crab ravioli.  Both were great. I'll be back to sit at the bar for a drink.  The bar has a mahogany wood country club feel while the restaurant is light and bright and tastefully decorated.

aBJveg93jCrGTOkwtNrg1A.text: One of favorite places to frequent in my beloved city. Whether it's for dinner or to grab a drink after work, Vitner Grill offers a laid-back, but upscale atmosphere.

KQsBvMYUeqQjAMrm8ROfEg.text: I love this place! I've been here more than several time and I decided after yesterday's drop in they deserve a review. I order to go. I decided on for my girlfriend vegan/gluten free, spaghetti squash. She was very pleased with the dish. I was very pleased with the service as a to go costumer. I was escorted to the bar to place the order. The bartender was so kind and friendly. He recommended the vegan dish for me.  5 stars I'll return again and again.

eqCSYdTjaXDuU-7AUMpuxQ.text: Had a wonderful TG dinner with the family, thank you VG for opening on TG. Food and service were Great, my old fashion wasn't bad either.

TMuk1U84-r-jWeBT_WE_Zg.text: I came here last night and everything about this place was absolutely fantastic! Beautiful decor and ambience. We were seated and greeted with very friendly waiters. We had a waiter who definitely knew what he was talking about. The appetizers (different cheeses and breads) were delicious. The people at my table loved their caesar salads. My entree was fabulous. It's hard to get chicken right, but my chicken had so much flavor. I love broccolini, but the way they seasoned it was too spicy for my liking. That was just a minor thing, though. The food came out pretty quickly. Drinks were also delicious. I had the assorted sorbets for dessert (which were yogurt and chocolate). I had a bite of the creme brulee and the tiramisu which were very good. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free-range half chicken with truffle honey-mustard glaze, cavatelli &#34;mac and cheese&#34; and broccolini

I3aetAGHmBFz-6blxx3IHQ.text: The outdoor patio is gorgeous, and if you can manage to make it to this place when the weather is permitting, it's a nice place to sit and share a meal. The interior is nice as well, and has an upscale vibe like the 5-star restaurants on the strip.   As for the dishes:  Charcuterie- Some notable cheeses with meats. Everyone's got their preferences w/ cheeses and meats, so I think you will find something you like by getting an assortment w/ a group.   BRAISED LAMB BOLOGNESE - 5 stars. Oh my gosh, I was obsessing and thinking about it for a week after, wanting to go back. Well, you know how that works...we always find some other restaurant to try. But this  bolognese had amazing sauce, and it was creamy and fatty in a great way.   Crispy calamari- 3 stars. Wasn't totally digging it.   Seared sea scallops- 5 stars. Cooked to perfection. Scallops were sweet, flavorful, and delicious.   Bouillabaisse- 2 stars. Maybe the fact that I've had amazing bouillabaisse in France just sorta ruined it for me, but it tasted nothing like it was supposed to. The broth was overly salty and inedible.   Medallion steaks - 2 stars. The meat was tough, and that already ruined it for me. The flavor was meh as well.   Bone-in rib eye- 4 stars.   There were couple other dishes I got to try, but the most notable that I'd go back for are the scallops and the braised lamb bolognese. Great service and nice ambiance!

photos.caption: Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie with meat and cheeses- 4/5 stars. Loved the jam on the side.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus with gnocchi salad. Gnocchi was not good at all. I wasn&#39;t able to try the octopus.
Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari- 3/5 stars.

PuPIO6nvPE2FCDeXPYBcUA.text: We have been on a roll lately. Every place we have dined at has been outstanding, and Vintner Grill is keeping the streak going. :)  It is not the easiest place to find. It is located inside an office building area, which was kind of odd. But once you walk in it is very beautifully designed with plenty of parking to go around.  Our waiter, Jeff, was excellent. He made some excellent recommendations for us and was on point. We had the grilled octopus and smoked tomato soup. Both fantastic. For the mains, we had the lamb rack and the lamb bolognese pasta. Again, another fabulous dish. Finally for dessert we had the upside down apple pie and the champagne pound cake was divine. Will be back. :)

XcwGDCiEdTAorOtJevQjBg.text: When you want to get off the strip for good, good food, a great wine list, an atmosphere set for dining and professional service, here is where you go.  A little bit of a trip but definitely worthwhile.  Everything is great.

VqAWojyPsICkaNq5Jxtlbg.text: This swanky joint is a hidden gem located within a business plaza in Summerlin near Indigo Drive. Signage is difficult to spot (and none of it's lighted). They offer valet parking (it's Summerlin!) You don't have to valet, just be prepared to walk 100 feet to the entrance.   VG has solid menu options ranging from filet to risotto and even octopus. They're open for lunch M-F & dinner every day. The cocktail and wine menus have been changing regularly and that is a plus. Their popular cocktail offerings vary from a blueberry crush to a champagne cocktail. The variety of wines is extensive, so they live up to their name. I can usually find something new to try even after being here too many times to remember.   They have a Lounge Menu with smaller sized snacks such as a margherita flatbread, crab cake and shrimp cocktail.  I recommend trying their cheese & meat boards (known to some as charcuterie). I've tried the boar salami and smoked duck with Stilton blue cheese. Tasty! They also have more flatbread options such as Italian sausage with burrata cheese. Thursday has been live music night and the place can be quite busy for that.   The patio is very nice, with a firepit to add ambiance. They have gaming  at the bar, and this is one of my favorite places to play video poker.  The big benefit is top notch beverages with no smoking!

Photo of Vintner Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My $1,000 winning smile

BmZfDB48G8DoiQhIemlzgQ.text: This place is interesting. You can't see it from the Main Street, and it is in a place that you wouldn't expect a restaurant to be. That being said, the place was absolutely packed. It is fairly large inside with outdoor seating, but I feel  reservations are a must. Good food, great drink/wine selection. I'm sorry I didn't save room for dessert.

xAU4om40EeuuNOxBd65Zsg.text: Great out of the way spot! Food was the best I've had in Vegas in a long time! Will be back.

YdKcQdE0xeUy5hbudFnZMw.text: Service was a little slow to start...but picked up after our food order went in. Great atmosphere...private location.  We went for dinner and my husband and I both loved our meal choices.  Amazing bread choices, great cocktail menue, and the main courses were great.

mmP-WcU_VfVPcjBmZyrfpA.text: What a hidden gem this restaurant is!  Beautiful decor and atmosphere.  Good service.  The food is amazing!  The curry sauce that comes with the fried calamari was so good I could have drank it!  My New York Steak was cooked perfectly, as was my husband's lamb chops.  Pricey, but worth it for such a great meal!  Highly recommend!

JaV6hGBJWtz1EsIVTSI2Dw.text: I can't believe I never wrote a review for this restaurant! Came here for my birthday dinner with my mother and step dad and everyone loved it! We are outside for dinner and it feels like you're not in Vegas. The lamb bolognese was spectacular as I wanted something hearty. My mom got this ravioli which she loved. The service was great and the ambience was magical! Definitely have been waiting for another occasion to go here. I'm always suggesting this restaurant to my friends especially the ones last that live in summerlin. Such a gem to have in our backyard!!!
